Title: Data-analyst
Description:
Profile Data Analyst

General Description:

The data analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide valuable insights that support decision-making within the organization. This role requires an in-depth knowledge of data analysis techniques and tools.




TPEX and the Evolution towards Autonomous Buildings

At TPEX International, we strive to lead the evolution towards autonomous buildings. Our mission is to transform buildings into self-regulating, sustainable, and efficient environments through advanced technologies and innovative solutions.




Intelligent Systems: We integrate advanced systems capable of collecting and analyzing real-time data. These systems help optimize energy consumption, improve indoor climate, and minimize operational costs.

Digital Twins: By utilizing Digital Twins, we can create virtual models of our buildings. These models allow us to perform simulations, monitor performance, and plan proactive maintenance.

Automation: We develop and implement tools that automate various aspects of building management. This includes reading building data and directing suppliers based on this information.

Sustainability: Our commitment to sustainability remains a core value. By reducing waste and promoting a culture of sustainability, we aim for buildings that not only meet today's needs but also leave a positive legacy for future generations.

Collaboration and Innovation: We work closely with various departments and external partners to ensure continuous innovation. Our R&D department plays a crucial role in developing new technologies and solutions that contribute to our vision of autonomous buildings.

At TPEX International, we are determined to play a leading role in the transition to autonomous buildings. Our expertise and dedication to innovation enable us to manage buildings that are not only efficient and sustainable but also future-ready.




What You Will Do:

As a data analyst, you will manage, analyze, and maintain building data accurately. Your core task is to convey data accurately to the end customer. You ensure that the data is accurate and complete, as our automatic tools will not work accurately otherwise. Besides these tasks, there is time and space to develop yourself and contribute to the R&D department. Here we develop tools to automate aspects of building management. Think of reading buildings and directing suppliers based on this information.




Responsibilities:

Collecting and processing large datasets from various sources.
Analyzing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Developing reports and dashboards to visualize and communicate findings.
Collaborating with various departments to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Ensuring the integrity and quality of the data.
Advising stakeholders based on data analysis and findings.




Required Skills:

Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze and interpret complex data to obtain valuable insights.
Technical Skills: Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau & Azure.
Problem-Solving Ability: Able to identify problems and develop effective solutions based on data analysis.
Communication: Strong oral and written communication skills to present findings clearly and concisely to stakeholders.
Detail-Oriented: Accuracy and attention to detail when working with data to ensure the integrity and quality of the data.
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with various departments and teams to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.




Working Conditions:

Vacation Days: 25 vacation days per year.
Company Lunch: A joint lunch every Tuesday.
Team: Working in a small, close-knit team.
Team events: Regular fun team events.
Work Environment: Particularly inspiring environment in the EDGE Stadium in Amsterdam.
Salary indication: €3.800,- tot €4.500,- depending on experience and skill.

Title: Data Analist, Rotterdam
HTML:
Ben jij de data analist die complexe informatie kan omzetten in rapportages en dashboards die onze klanten en wijzelf ook begrijpen? En weet je ook hoe je deze resultaten benut voor inzichten, forecasts en actiepunten? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou! Wil jij mooie merken als Odido, Interpolis, Carglass, Hans Anders en UNICEF Nederland helpen alles uit hun marketing automation te halen? Dan zit je bij 100procent precies goed.

Over 100procent

100procent is een zeer dynamische marketing automation agency dat in korte tijd al een bijzonder respectabele klantenlijst heeft opgebouwd met o.a.: DPG Media, Kruidvat, Allianz Direct, WE Fashion, Koninklijk Theater Carré en vele anderen. We zijn een hecht team van zo’n 50 collega’s. Zo komen we allemaal vrijdag op kantoor voor teamsessies, kennisdeling en een goed verzorgde lunch en we sluiten de week af met een vrijdagmiddag borrel.

Data Analist bij 100procent

Jij bent de expert die klanten en collega’s voorziet van “actionable” inzichten. Je kent de business processen en databronnen die voor onze klanten relevant zijn. Dankzij jouw analyse en inzichten kunnen wij onze diensten verder aanscherpen en uitbouwen. Je weet wat er nodig is om consumentengedrag, markttrends en de performance van de verschillende kanalen te meten en te analyseren. Daarmee sta je aan de basis van de strategische plannen voor onze klanten. Je hebt een voortrekkersrol in het inspireren en overtuigen van je 100procent collega’s en samen met hen bouw je aan het data- en informatiefundament van 100procent.

Functie-eisen

Wat zoeken we in onze nieuwe collega?

  • Flexibel en een echte pionier;
  • Overtuigend, inspirerend en sterk in communicatie op alle functieniveaus;
  • Een aantal jaren aantoonbare ervaring als Data Analist;
  • Zelfstandig in het kiezen van databron, analyse en presentatievorm van data;
  • Kennis van tools als PowerBI, Excel, Clickview, SAS, Tableau of Google Data Studio;
  • Ervaring in SQL, e/o Python is een pré;
  • Nauwkeurig;
  • Commercieel inzicht.

Functie-voorstel

Wat bieden wij:

  • Een inspirerende, snelgroeiende omgeving, waarin je kunt laten zien dat het anders kan en je wordt uitgedaagd de lat hoger te leggen bij onze diverse A-merk klanten;
  • De mogelijkheid om jezelf continu te blijven ontwikkelen, dankzij een opleidingsbudget;
  • Een enthousiast team met gedreven professionals waarin iedereen van elkaar kan leren;
  • Een salaris tussen de 3500-4500 op basis van 40 uur per week, afhankelijk van je opleiding en werkervaring;
  • Extra benefits, zoals een pensioenregeling, reiskostenvergoeding, een unieke bonusstructuur en een royale vergoeding voor je thuiswerkplek;
  • Flexibele werkplekken, werktijden en parttime mogelijkheden;
  • Een gezellige werksfeer, regelmatig uitjes, vrijdagmiddagborrels en een gezonde dosis fun!

Ben jij de 100%er die wij zoeken? Reageer dan nu!

Heb je nog vragen over deze functie?

Neem voor meer info contact op met Charlotte via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina.il of bel 010 – 2540320.

We kijken uit naar je sollicitatie!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to accelerate their career…




They're looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer , to join them in their office in Utrecht, for where you would be responsible for playing a key role in designing, building, and maintaining ELT pipelines using a modern technology toolkit, Collaborate with stakeholders to drive data-informed decision-making processes. Develop and enhance visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau

You must be experienced in :

Proven experience in building and maintaining data pipelines and ETL processes.
Hands-on experience with dbt (data build tool)
Advanced SQL skills and intermediate Python proficiency.
Strong expertise in visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau)
Proficiency in Dutch and English

Would you like to hear more about the opportunity?

Apply or reach out directly so we can discuss it in more detail.




B.javaid@gcstechtalent.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a data analyst you will be supporting the Journey Decisioning team that resides in the Personalization product area. This team focuses on recommending the most relevant next step for a visitor at the current moment, given all that we know about them. That unfolds into 2 separate products/components, one that focuses on personalised lay-outs (which components do we show to customers - and in which order), and one that focuses on journey guidance (what is the most relevant message to show customers in this moment of the journey). The first product is being tested in several of our markets and we're working to extend this into more markets, potentially with more iterations, and to other page types (e.g. Product Pages) and channels (e.g. App). The second product is in its design stage and we aim to launch this later in the year.




The scope of the consultant services is to assist




The majority of your work will be done within the Journey Decisioning team. Most of the digital teams atwork in a PEDX (Product, Engineering, Data, eXperience) structure. Next to that you will join a team of peers (data analysts) who work with other teams in the Personalisation product area and the front-end products. his set-up ensures you always have colleagues to think with, learn from, and educate on what you're doing within the Journey Decisioning team.




Requirements:




Must: analytical skills, SQL, good stakeholder management, knowledge/experience on personalisation (e.g. recommender systems, clustering / segmentation, modelling techniques for prediction), knowledge/experience on customer journeys
Nice: experience with GCP, BigQuery, Python (Notebooks), familiar in an FMCG of retail sector, eager to learn, familiar in an eCommerce environment, experience with companies that have both an online and offline sales channel




What 3 things from above are most important?




Analytical skills, knowledge/experience on customer journeys, knowledge/experience on personalisation

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are Paula’s Choice Skincare, a global skincare company founded in the US (Seattle) in 1995. Paula’s Choice is an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brand since 2021 where we are proud to present our core values and continue to grow together with our sister brands.







Our European headquarters are located in the Netherlands (Amersfoort) and local offices in the UK, France (Paris) and Germany (Berlin). We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites (in UK, Germany, France, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark), via marketplaces (Amazon and Bol.com), via selected retail partners, including Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Selfridges, De Bijenkorf, Douglas, and via selected e-tailers including Skincity and CultBeauty.







We are a fast-growing scale-up with a young employer base and a high-energy culture. We adopted an agile way of working and thrive on change. Agile lives and breathes in our full organization, this makes us move fast and grow even faster. We are proud to consistently show high double-digit growth. Our main business (75%) is direct to consumer via our e-commerce business making us a fast-paced profitable organization.







Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.







Does this sound inspiring? That’s great! Because we’d love to get to know you. We are looking for a










Data Analyst

Full Time | Amersfoort




As a Data Analyst, you will focus on translating our data into actionable insights and building robust data models for our data team.




You will be the data team member who continuously raises the effectiveness of our initiatives by providing data-driven insights and advising on how to improve further. You will constantly work on obtaining an in-depth understanding of the business challenges from your stakeholders and using these insights to develop (data-driven) solutions while always thinking customer-first (internal and external). The data intelligence consists of designing, building and maintaining reporting (PowerBi) as well as analyses to (dis)prove hypotheses or evaluate initiatives from the business.




Furthermore, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions. You will work closely with data teammembers and business stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate these into a data model. You are responsible to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and actionable.




In this role, you will report directly to the data team manager. You will mainly support all different types of functional domains, but the main focus is on marketing areas such as Retention, Online Marketing and eCommerce. As our data team is consistently evolving, hardly anything is set in stone, and you will be challenged to be innovative and creative in finding innovative solutions.




What will you be doing:

Work with various stakeholders from several departments to perform data-driven analyses, transform the results into actionable insights, and communicate the results to the stakeholders.
Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of data.
Develop and maintain ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to ensure data quality and integrity.
Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards containing customer metrics and KPIs used by various internal stakeholders.
Educating teams on data-informed decision-making and advocating the work of the data team across the business




What will you bring?

At least 4+ years of relevant working experience as business/data analyst/analytics engineer or any other relevant data role, preferably in Marketing, retail, e-commerce or other related business function
Experience in building and maintaining data models
Master’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, marketing, IT or a relevant related field
Natural tendency to always want to raise the bar and put the customer first (internal and external)
Thrives on working with a multi-disciplinary group of stakeholders and enjoys presenting insights to business partners
Analytically strong data addict, gets energy from quickly creating insights and translating these into actionable improvement suggestions.
Self-starting and able to balance thoroughness with speed and focus on delivery
Experience with SQL, Python and version control system like GIT. Databricks, PowerBi, Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure are a plus
Fluent in English







Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.







Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitments, our willingness to collaborate, listen and learn. If you recognize yourself in our values, you will feel at home at Paula’s Choice:







Each of us is powerful on our own, but together we are unstoppable.




BUILD TRUST: We set the standard for skincare, transparency and shared knowledge

BE BOLD: We lead through innovation and disrupting the status quo

ACT WITH KINDNESS: We operate out of respect and care for our customers, our colleagues, and the planet

CREATE COMMUNITY: We build a welcoming and inclusive community with a culture of growth and empowerment




Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Beschrijving van het bedrijf

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Functieomschrijving

Als Business Data Analyst ben je onderdeel van het Customer Excellence Team, waarbij je onze organisatie ondersteunt en faciliteert met data-analyse en effectief besluitvormingsproces mogelijk maakt. In nauwe samenwerking met je collega's in Customer Excellence, Business Technology Services en de verschillende zakelijke belanghebbenden, transformeer je markt- en klantgegevens in duurzame dashboards/analytische rapporten op basis van zakelijke use cases. De ideale kandidaat heeft een sterke affiniteit met data-analyse en de gezondheidszorgomgeving, is een snelle leerling en brengt een positieve 'can-do' mentaliteit mee. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Business Analytics.




Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

Analytics & Reporting - Begrijp, combineer en transformeer lokale en wereldwijde datasets in visualisaties. Bouw duurzame dashboards (PowerBI) om zowel operationele rapportage als strategische besluitvorming te ondersteunen. Begeleid collega's bij het ontwikkelen van de juiste visualisaties voor het presenteren van resultaten.
Data modeling - Begrijp en optimaliseer de datamodellen van huidige use cases. Ontwikkel datamodellen voor nieuwe use cases. Help bij het beheren van de verschillende datamodellen die zakelijke gebruikers in staat stellen hun vragen te beantwoorden.
Data governance - Werk samen met interne belanghebbenden van verschillende afdelingen om vorm te geven aan hoe we klantgegevens beheren, om afstemming te waarborgen en analytische tools duurzaam en compliant te houden.
State-of-the-art data platform - Mogelijkheid om vertrouwd te raken met een state-of-the-art data platform (Palantir Foundry).
Innovatie - Verken en innoveer nieuwe oplossingen en mogelijkheden op het gebied van data, analytics en AI om zakelijke problemen en kansen aan te pakken.




Functie-eisen

Bachelor's of hoger diploma met academische cursussen in kwantitatieve methoden, analytics, statistiek, economie of financiën.
Ervaring in een zakelijke omgeving en ervaring met relevante klant-/marktgegevens binnen de biofarmaceutische industrie is een pluspunt.
Analytisch sterk. Vermogen om snel analytics en dataproducten te koppelen aan zakelijke behoeften. In staat om gegevens te analyseren en zinvolle conclusies te trekken. Affiniteit met relationele database query-talen zoals SQL.
Je moet snel in de driver's seat kunnen zitten en aan de verschillende use cases kunnen werken met het vermogen om snel de nieuwe omgeving en het Palantir Foundry-platform te leren.
Expertkennis van een analysetool zoals Microsoft PowerBI en nieuwsgierig om meer te leren over hun platforms. Gepassioneerd over technologie en enthousiast over de impact van opkomende/disruptieve technologieën.
Hecht belang aan het creëren van duurzame, goed gedocumenteerde, conforme dataproducten.
Geweldige samenwerker en uitstekende schriftelijke en mondelinge communicatieve vaardigheden.
Vermogen om zelfstandig zakelijke vragen te formuleren, gegevensbronnen te identificeren, een methodologie te formuleren en projecttijden en -resultaten te beheren.
Vloeiend in zowel Engels als bij voorkeur Nederlands, met uitstekende schriftelijke, mondelinge en presentatievaardigheden.

Aanvullende informatie

AbbVie zet zich in om integer te handelen, innovatie te bevorderen, levens te veranderen, onze gemeenschap te dienen en diversiteit en inclusie te omarmen. Het is het beleid van AbbVie om gekwalificeerde mensen aan te nemen op basis van vaardigheden, zonder discriminatie ten opzichte van werknemers of sollicitanten op grond van ras, huidskleur, godsdienst, afkomst, leeftijd, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), lichamelijke of geestelijke beperking, medische aandoening, genetische informatie, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, seksuele geaardheid, burgerlijke staat of elke andere vorm van discriminatie.

For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Functieomschrijving

Als Business Data Analyst ben je onderdeel van het Customer Excellence Team, waarbij je onze organisatie ondersteunt en faciliteert met data-analyse en effectief besluitvormingsproces mogelijk maakt. In nauwe samenwerking met je collega's in Customer Excellence, Business Technology Services en de verschillende zakelijke belanghebbenden, transformeer je markt- en klantgegevens in duurzame dashboards/analytische rapporten op basis van zakelijke use cases. De ideale kandidaat heeft een sterke affiniteit met data-analyse en de gezondheidszorgomgeving, is een snelle leerling en brengt een positieve 'can-do' mentaliteit mee. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Business Analytics.


Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Analytics & Reporting - Begrijp, combineer en transformeer lokale en wereldwijde datasets in visualisaties. Bouw duurzame dashboards (PowerBI) om zowel operationele rapportage als strategische besluitvorming te ondersteunen. Begeleid collega's bij het ontwikkelen van de juiste visualisaties voor het presenteren van resultaten.
  • Data modeling - Begrijp en optimaliseer de datamodellen van huidige use cases. Ontwikkel datamodellen voor nieuwe use cases. Help bij het beheren van de verschillende datamodellen die zakelijke gebruikers in staat stellen hun vragen te beantwoorden.
  • Data governance - Werk samen met interne belanghebbenden van verschillende afdelingen om vorm te geven aan hoe we klantgegevens beheren, om afstemming te waarborgen en analytische tools duurzaam en compliant te houden.
  • State-of-the-art data platform - Mogelijkheid om vertrouwd te raken met een state-of-the-art data platform (Palantir Foundry).
  • Innovatie - Verken en innoveer nieuwe oplossingen en mogelijkheden op het gebied van data, analytics en AI om zakelijke problemen en kansen aan te pakken.


Functie-eisen

  • Bachelor's of hoger diploma met academische cursussen in kwantitatieve methoden, analytics, statistiek, economie of financiën.
  • Ervaring in een zakelijke omgeving en ervaring met relevante klant-/marktgegevens binnen de biofarmaceutische industrie is een pluspunt.
  • Analytisch sterk. Vermogen om snel analytics en dataproducten te koppelen aan zakelijke behoeften. In staat om gegevens te analyseren en zinvolle conclusies te trekken. Affiniteit met relationele database query-talen zoals SQL.
  • Je moet snel in de driver's seat kunnen zitten en aan de verschillende use cases kunnen werken met het vermogen om snel de nieuwe omgeving en het Palantir Foundry-platform te leren.
  • Expertkennis van een analysetool zoals Microsoft PowerBI en nieuwsgierig om meer te leren over hun platforms. Gepassioneerd over technologie en enthousiast over de impact van opkomende/disruptieve technologieën.
  • Hecht belang aan het creëren van duurzame, goed gedocumenteerde, conforme dataproducten.
  • Geweldige samenwerker en uitstekende schriftelijke en mondelinge communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Vermogen om zelfstandig zakelijke vragen te formuleren, gegevensbronnen te identificeren, een methodologie te formuleren en projecttijden en -resultaten te beheren.
  • Vloeiend in zowel Engels als bij voorkeur Nederlands, met uitstekende schriftelijke, mondelinge en presentatievaardigheden.

Aanvullende informatie

AbbVie zet zich in om integer te handelen, innovatie te bevorderen, levens te veranderen, onze gemeenschap te dienen en diversiteit en inclusie te omarmen. Het is het beleid van AbbVie om gekwalificeerde mensen aan te nemen op basis van vaardigheden, zonder discriminatie ten opzichte van werknemers of sollicitanten op grond van ras, huidskleur, godsdienst, afkomst, leeftijd, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), lichamelijke of geestelijke beperking, medische aandoening, genetische informatie, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, seksuele geaardheid, burgerlijke staat of elke andere vorm van discriminatie.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My Client based in Utrecht are hiring for a Data Analyst to join their team and be part of their expansion project for 2025. Please see below the key responsibilities and requirements.




Responsibilities:

Analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Develop and maintain data pipelines for efficient data processing and reporting.
Leverage tools on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) (such as BigQuery, Dataflow, etc.) to process, analyze, and visualize data.
Design, implement, and optimize ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to support data quality and availability.
Work closely with other teams to understand business needs and identify data-driven opportunities.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and other data visualizations for various business units.
Ensure data integrity and provide recommendations to improve data collection and management processes.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data querying.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) tools, including BigQuery, Dataflow, and Pub/Sub.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data transformation tools.
Solid understanding of data analysis techniques, data visualization, and reporting.
Proficiency with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio is a plus.
Ability to analyze complex data sets and translate them into actionable insights.




Salary Package:

Up to €60,000
Bonus scheme
Flexible hybrid working
Travel Reimbursement

Title: Informatie Analist BI / Business Analist / BI Analist
HTML:
Ben jij analytisch sterk en wil je bijdragen aan de digitale transformatie van een dynamisch familiebedrijf?


Over de functie

De organisatie zoekt een Informatie Analist met een focus op Business Intelligence en reporting. In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren en visualiseren van data, en speel je een sleutelrol in het vertalen van businessvragen naar bruikbare inzichten. Je werkt nauw samen met developers en leidt het sprintteam om te bepalen welke stories worden opgepakt.

Je taken omvatten onder andere:

  • Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van rapportages in Power BI Desktop;
  • Definiëren van de juiste requirements voor de Data Engineers (momenteel bij derde partijen);
  • Werken met SQL is een pré;
  • Meedenken over finance- en inkooprapportages, met minder focus op retail;
  • Agile werken en het coördineren van BI-gerelateerde sprints;
  • Samenwerken met diverse stakeholders binnen de organisatie om data-gedreven beslissingen te ondersteunen.


Over de organisatie

De organisatie is een dynamisch familiebedrijf met een praktische cultuur en korte lijnen. Met een sterke focus op retail en logistiek, heeft IT een cruciale rol in de bedrijfsvoering. De organisatie gebruikt moderne systemen zoals Dynamics 365 en een datawarehouse om operationele processen te ondersteunen en optimaliseren.


Wie ben jij

  • Je hebt een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding;
  • 2 tot 3 jaar werkervaring als BI-specialist, Functioneel BI-consultant of Technisch Business Analist;
  • Ervaring met Power BI Desktop, en bij voorkeur kennis van SQL;
  • Ervaring met tools zoals Tableau of QlikView is een pré;
  • Affiniteit met finance en inkooprapportages;
  • Ervaring met Agile werken en het leiden van sprints;
  • Communicatief sterk en analytisch ingesteld;
  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.


Wat bieden we je

  • Een aantrekkelijk salaris tot €6.200, afhankelijk van ervaring;
  • Een fulltime dienstverband (32 tot 40 uur per week, met mogelijkheden voor 36 uur);
  • Werken in een dynamisch familiebedrijf met korte lijnen en een hands-on mentaliteit.


Interesse?

Kan jij je vinden in de bovenstaande beschrijving en wil je een stap maken in je carrière? Neem dan contact op met ons. Stuur je een recent CV mee? Dan kunnen we meteen kijken of jouw ervaring aansluit bij het opgestelde profiel.

Title: Data Analyst - Freelance - Amsterdam
Description:
Job Title: Freelance Data Analyst

Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands

Contract Type: Freelance

Duration: 9 months

Start Date: ASAP




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse and manipulate large datasets using Python and SQL to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Create and maintain automated reporting and dashboards using Power BI.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to define KPIs, business metrics, and analytical requirements.
Build statistical models and forecasts to assist with decision-making.
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous data validation and cleansing techniques.
Translate complex data analysis into clear, understandable business recommendations.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Proven experience (3+ years) as a Data Analyst or similar role, preferably in a freelance capacity.
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
Solid experience with Python for data analysis, automation, and building models.
Some experience working with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Strong ability to analyse large datasets, draw insights, and generate actionable recommendations.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical data to non-technical teams.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in the Finance Industry is a plus.
Familiarity with ETL processes and database management systems.
Knowledge of data privacy laws, including GDPR compliance.
Ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
For this vacancy, proficiency in the Dutch language at B2 level is a requirement. If you do not meet this requirement, we will not consider your application in the selection process.




Bij KLM Health Services krijg je als Data Analist een unieke kans om jouw talent voor data in te zetten op het hoogste niveau. Geen gespreid bedje, maar een uitdagende rol waarin je organisatie breed verantwoordelijk bent voor het verwerken en analyseren van data. Met behulp van tools zoals Power BI vertaal je complexe datasets naar heldere inzichten die niet alleen onze dagelijkse operatie versterken, maar ook bijdragen aan strategische beslissingen.

Ben jij klaar om met jouw expertise in data-analyse en Power BI impact te maken binnen een organisatie waar gezondheid vooropstaat? Lees dan verder!




Wat ga je doen

Als Data Analist bij KLM Health Services krijg je een uitdagende rol waarin je jouw expertise inzet op zowel IT-gebied als strategisch niveau. In deze rol werk je als verbindende schakel tussen data en de business, waarbij je nauw samenwerkt met verschillende stakeholders. Met jouw ervaring weet je prioriteiten te stellen en effectief te schakelen tussen projecten. Jij zorgt ervoor dat data op de juiste manier wordt ingezet om strategische en operationele doelstellingen te behalen. Je krijgt de ruimte om jouw functie zelf vorm te geven, zodat je de organisatie op de best mogelijke manier kunt ondersteunen.




Verder houdt je bezig met het:

vertalen van bedrijfsbehoefte naar concrete vragen en toepasbare analyses.

verzamelen van relevante datasets door middel van gesprekken met stakeholders, en deze verwerken in Power Bi voor visueel aantrekkelijke rapportages.
ondersteunen van de Product Owner en Business Analist.
meedenken en bewaken van data/privacy compliance en signaleren van risico’s.
presenteren van resultaten aan de stakeholders met een doeltreffende communicatiestijl.
proactief verslag uitbrengen aan het team over het voortgang van projecten.




Waar je terecht komt

KLM Health Services, Airport Medical Services en Executive Health Management helpen met gezond leven, werken en reizen. Van eerste hulp en medische ondersteuning tot vaccinaties, health check-ups en lifestyle programma’s. Dit doen we met een team van artsen, verpleegkundigen, assistenten en coaches.

De afdeling Digital is een platte afdeling met weinig hiërarchie. Je bent samen met een junior collega het hart van het datateam. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar we samen lerend de organisatie continu verder ontwikkelen. Binnen deze context speelt de afdeling Digital een belangrijke rol. Wij adviseren over digitale innovatie, leveren waardevolle inzichten, beheren het digitale landschap en bieden support.




Wie jij bent

De ideale Data Analist voor deze functie is iemand met:

HBO werk-en denk niveau;
minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie;
ervaring in Power BI (diepgaande kennis) en SQL;
ervaring als Data Analist in een agile omgeving;
sterke communicatievaardigheden die makkelijk schakelt op verschillende niveaus.




Wat wij bieden

Een functie vol uitdagingen met volop ruimte voor eigen invulling. Je krijgt de vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid om jouw werk op jouw manier uit te voeren. Daarnaast bieden wij een Data Analist bij ons:

de mogelijkheid om hybride te werken in afstemming met je team.
een functie voor 32 a 40 uur per week.
een salaris tussen €3.425 en €4.564 bruto o.b.v. 40 uur afhankelijke van je werkervaring.
8% vakantiegeld en 5% eindejaarsuitkering.
max 10% winstdeling.
20 vakantiedagen en 6 ADV dagen. En leeftijd afhankelijk nog maximaal 9 extra vakantiedagen.
een thuiswerkbudget van €900,-.
een fietsplan: een belastingvrije vergoeding (eenmalig) voor aanschaf van een fiets voor zakelijk gebruik.
korting Travel Clinic Travel bij KLM Health Services: 15% korting op vaccinaties.
deelname aan Cultuur Werkt! met korting of soms gratis naar culturele voorstellingen of concerten.




Daarnaast kun je na een jaar dienstverband gebruik maken van een gunstige regeling voor KLM-tickets.




Vervolg

Spreekt deze vacature je aan? Solliciteer dan direct! Na ontvangst van je sollicitatie doorlopen we de volgende stappen:

1. telefonische kennismaking met Nilab Ahmadi, Recruitment Specialist.

2. 1e gesprek bij KLM Health Services met de Teammanager Digital + collega

3. 2de gesprek bij KLM Health Services met HR Business Partner + collega

4. beide enthousiast? Top! Wij doen je een aanbod.




Heb je nog vragen dan kan je altijd bellen met Nilab Ahmadi via 0627381868 of mailen naar nilab@raas.today

Show more

  • 8% vakantiegeld en 5% eindejaarsuitkering.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Lay the groundwork for tomorrow with Kubota!




Since 1890, Kubota has evolved in a unique way worldwide. With a strong will to solve problems in food, water and the environment, we have leveraged our strength as a manufacturer and a solutions provider. Spanning across 120+ countries and employing more than 50,000 people in Asia, Europe and North America, Kubota generates revenue in excess of $20 billion. From agricultural and industrial machinery, and overall water solutions, to any other living environment solution, our question, and our challenge was always the same: what can we do to meet the demands and enhance our lives for tomorrow?




Explore this exciting career opportunity and join us on the journey as we seek to be an “Essentials Innovator for Supporting Life”.




My job, Our future




Are you intraprenuer? Do you want to contribute to an economically and sustainably future-proof farmer’s wellbeing relevant to the Europe? Are you looking for hands-on opportunities to develop products that will be on the market within next 3 years? If so, we have an interesting position for you at Kubota's Innovation Center Europe (ICE).




Innovation Centers




In June 2019, Kubota Corporation established Innovation Centers, first in Japan and then Europe, for the creation of new business ventures, products and services in Kubota’s fields of business, including agriculture and construction. Working together with external partners, the Innovation Centers should foster open innovation for proactive engagement with ICT, AI, Telematics and other advanced technologies, to accelerate the creation of new business, products and services.




Role description




ICE is looking for a business intelligence analyst to provide European support to our innovation team in business model innovation, to deliver analytics to support strategic and operational initiatives of Kubota Innovation Center and to continue to strengthen the quality of our work, grow our portfolio of projects and establish new strategic learning partnerships.




You will conduct independent & joint, high-quality business research, supervised by Strategic Business Development Manager, and incorporate the research findings in innovative product development strategy within agriculture sector. Also, you will be involved in customer development activities within innovation projects with farmers, start-ups, technology providers and business units of Kubota. Main target will be the development on sustainable business models and go-to-market strategies for future products though market intelligence and Power BI tools.

As part of Kubota Innovation Center team, you will have a strong voice in project execution, innovation strategy, process improvements, and structuring joint product development within our portfolio.




Additionally, you continuously strengthen the quality of our work, by identifying systemic fixes and ways to improve our market research and business hypothesis, by ensuring Kubota Innovation Center is always at the cutting edge. You will put the right approach in place to our work and proof that it is useful within the context of the targeted countries and the agriculture & technology entrepreneurship sectors we work in.




In this role, you will interpret & analyze performance indicators and metrics in order to create meaningful dashboards & reporting both at a detailed and executive level:

Designing and developing interactive dashboards and reports
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs
Analyzing datasets to uncover trends and insights
Maintaining data accuracy and integrity within BI systems
Translating business requirements into technical specifications




What we expect from you:

Master degree in business administration, economics, development economics, statistics, computer science, or related field with a strong component of financial analysis
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel functionality & ability to work with statistical data for market intelligence surveys
At least 1-2 years of work experience in consulting firm or similar type companies
Critical thinking for effective problem-solving
Demonstrated experience in writing and editing market analysis
Communicate easy about complex topics: data visualization skills
Proactive business affinity and min. B2 proficiency in English




What we would like to see in you:

Proficiency in other European languages (e.g., French, Italian, Spanish).




What makes you successful:

Advanced Power BI skills
Sharp analytical ability
Keenness to synthesise evidence from diverse sources (qualitative interviews, design surveys, statistical data, etc.)
Good understanding of deliverables, including statistical information from open sources and literature reviews, and ability to convey complex information concisely and clearly
Interest to develop, or previous experience, in analysing big data




What you can expect from us:

Rapidly growing international team with focus on result and disruptive ideas in agriculture sector
Ongoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path
The opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve farmer well-being & profitability.
Diverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to work
Entrepreneurial spirit in our team
Show more
HTML:
Lay the groundwork for tomorrow with Kubota!


Since 1890, Kubota has evolved in a unique way worldwide. With a strong will to solve problems in food, water and the environment, we have leveraged our strength as a manufacturer and a solutions provider. Spanning across 120+ countries and employing more than 50,000 people in Asia, Europe and North America, Kubota generates revenue in excess of $20 billion. From agricultural and industrial machinery, and overall water solutions, to any other living environment solution, our question, and our challenge was always the same: what can we do to meet the demands and enhance our lives for tomorrow?


Explore this exciting career opportunity and join us on the journey as we seek to be an “Essentials Innovator for Supporting Life”.


My job, Our future


Are you intraprenuer? Do you want to contribute to an economically and sustainably future-proof farmer’s wellbeing relevant to the Europe? Are you looking for hands-on opportunities to develop products that will be on the market within next 3 years? If so, we have an interesting position for you at Kubota's Innovation Center Europe (ICE).


Innovation Centers


In June 2019, Kubota Corporation established Innovation Centers, first in Japan and then Europe, for the creation of new business ventures, products and services in Kubota’s fields of business, including agriculture and construction. Working together with external partners, the Innovation Centers should foster open innovation for proactive engagement with ICT, AI, Telematics and other advanced technologies, to accelerate the creation of new business, products and services.


Role description


ICE is looking for a business intelligence analyst to provide European support to our innovation team in business model innovation, to deliver analytics to support strategic and operational initiatives of Kubota Innovation Center and to continue to strengthen the quality of our work, grow our portfolio of projects and establish new strategic learning partnerships.


You will conduct independent & joint, high-quality business research, supervised by Strategic Business Development Manager, and incorporate the research findings in innovative product development strategy within agriculture sector. Also, you will be involved in customer development activities within innovation projects with farmers, start-ups, technology providers and business units of Kubota. Main target will be the development on sustainable business models and go-to-market strategies for future products though market intelligence and Power BI tools.

As part of Kubota Innovation Center team, you will have a strong voice in project execution, innovation strategy, process improvements, and structuring joint product development within our portfolio.


Additionally, you continuously strengthen the quality of our work, by identifying systemic fixes and ways to improve our market research and business hypothesis, by ensuring Kubota Innovation Center is always at the cutting edge. You will put the right approach in place to our work and proof that it is useful within the context of the targeted countries and the agriculture & technology entrepreneurship sectors we work in.


In this role, you will interpret & analyze performance indicators and metrics in order to create meaningful dashboards & reporting both at a detailed and executive level:

  • Designing and developing interactive dashboards and reports
  • Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs
  • Analyzing datasets to uncover trends and insights
  • Maintaining data accuracy and integrity within BI systems
  • Translating business requirements into technical specifications


What we expect from you:

  • Master degree in business administration, economics, development economics, statistics, computer science, or related field with a strong component of financial analysis
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Excel functionality & ability to work with statistical data for market intelligence surveys
  • At least 1-2 years of work experience in consulting firm or similar type companies
  • Critical thinking for effective problem-solving
  • Demonstrated experience in writing and editing market analysis
  • Communicate easy about complex topics: data visualization skills
  • Proactive business affinity and min. B2 proficiency in English


What we would like to see in you:

  • Proficiency in other European languages (e.g., French, Italian, Spanish).


What makes you successful:

  • Advanced Power BI skills
  • Sharp analytical ability
  • Keenness to synthesise evidence from diverse sources (qualitative interviews, design surveys, statistical data, etc.)
  • Good understanding of deliverables, including statistical information from open sources and literature reviews, and ability to convey complex information concisely and clearly
  • Interest to develop, or previous experience, in analysing big data


What you can expect from us:

  • Rapidly growing international team with focus on result and disruptive ideas in agriculture sector
  • Ongoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path
  • The opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve farmer well-being & profitability.
  • Diverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to work
  • Entrepreneurial spirit in our team

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Eindhoven

Work Mode: Hybrid (3 days work from office)

Experience: 8+ years

What You’ll Be Doing:

🔹 Data Analytics: Analyze & interpret large datasets to extract valuable insights

🔹 Power BI & Spotfire: Develop, optimize & maintain dashboards for real-time reporting

🔹 Python Expertise: Automate workflows, develop machine learning models & optimize data pipelines

🔹 Business Insights: Translate complex data into meaningful reports & presentations

🔹 Project Management: Drive analytics initiatives from conception to completion

What You Bring to the Table:

✔ 8+ years of experience in Data Analytics, BI, and reporting

✔ Expert-level proficiency in Python coding (data wrangling, automation, modeling)

✔ Extensive experience in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, dashboarding, advanced visualizations)

✔ Strong knowledge of TIBCO Spotfire for interactive reporting

✔ Ability to work with large datasets & complex business requirements

✔ Excellent communication skills to engage with stakeholders and leadership

✔ Project management expertise with a track record of delivering high-impact solutions

💡 If you’re a Python & Power BI expert who loves solving business problems through data, this role is for you!

Title: Managerial Reporting Specialist
Description:
About the job




Van Caem Klerks Group is an international trading company operating within global markets. Van Caem Klerks Group buys and sells A-branded goods in a variety of different categories, namely: Liquor, Fragrance & Cosmetics and FMCG and We are a service-oriented company with over 50 years of experience in the import/export industry. Our head office is in the heart of Amsterdam, with our international offices in Malta and Curacao. We have 2 of our own warehouses strategically placed near the Port of Rotterdam which helps us provide the best and most efficient service.




Van Caem Klerks Group has a turnover of over 300 million and yet despite this we are quite an informal, flat-organizational structure that prioritizes employee growth and progression. We pride ourselves on our international focus, with over 30 nationalities represented within the company of over 150 employees.




Van Caem Klerks Group consists of the following departments: Trade, Trade Support, Legal, Finance, Treasury, ICT, HR and the Warehouses. We are working towards being a data-driven company and therefore are investing in various software and expansion of the teams: CRM, Cloud, Business Development, Business Intelligence and E-Commerce. We strive for professional growth amongst all employees due to our collaborative and cooperative environment and we also offer a variety of other perks, such as a daily in-house chef service, a company boat – perfect for cruising through Amsterdam’s canals - free drinks at the company bar, a pension plan and of course 25 paid holiday days. Bonuses are calculated based on performance throughout the year due to the fair bonus scheme.




We are looking for:




As a data- and KPI-driven company, Van Caem Klerks Group is looking for a Managerial Reporting Specialist, who will be responsible for providing Management of the company with regular and ad hoc business performance reports from all areas of the organization: Commercial, Finance, Operations, HR and so on. This person will have a full complete overview of the company’s performance and will play a crucial role in generating conclusive and actionable insights and recommendations. If you are passionate about making an impact via data analysis and presentation and want to see your actions producing real business improvements – this role is for you!




Requirements

Fluent in English.
Background in Technical Sciences, Business, Economics, Accounting.
No previous work experience required, but previous Big4 or consultancy experience will be a strong plus.
Experience in MS Excel and MS Power Point. You don’t need to know everything but will have to be able to learn new things and fast.
Critical thinking, ability to see big picture while being attentive to details.
Strong communication skills and ability to patiently explain complex matters in simple terms.
Self-organization and time management skills to fulfil daily, weekly, monthly reporting requirements.
Ability to manage stress level when working against a deadline.
Ability to switch efficiently between tasks of different nature
Positive and self-driven personality will make you very successful in this role and in our Company as a whole!




Benefits

Ability to kick-start a career w/o previous work experience
Very dynamic company operating on global scale
International and energetic team of 30+ nationalities
Working very closely with Senior Management of the organization
Salary level will be discussed with successful candidates
8% holiday allowance
Pension scheme
25 vacation days
Performance based annual bonus up to 3 monthly salaries
PLEASE NOTE: 5 days in the office, WFH/Hybrid is not possible
PLEASE NOTE: Candidates from Europe only




Recruitment process

Introductory interview by Teams: 30 mins
In-person interview in the office: 60 mins
Trial day at the office: 2-3 hours
Job offer to successful candidates

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Als Data Analist ontwikkel jij je verder op gebied van Power BI-dashboarding en data engineering, waarbij je jouw technische kennis in de cloud (Azure) optimaal benut. Jij creëert waarde door data om te zetten in waardevolle informatie die inzicht biedt. Ben jij klaar om een verschil te maken in een technische omgeving waar data en innovatie centraal staan?


Dit bieden wij jou

  • Salaris € 4.000,- en € 5.500,- o.b.v. 40 uur;
  • 36,5 vakantiedagen;
  • IKB 10,5%;
  • Winstuitkering;
  • NS-Business Card;
  • € 30,- per maand voor de inrichting van je thuiswerkplek;
  • Laptop & telefoon.


Over jouw rol als Data Analist

In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en implementeren van complexe Power BI-dashboards en rapporten. Je werkt met Power Query om data te transformeren en te manipuleren, zodat deze optimaal aansluit bij de behoeften van de business. Daarnaast bouw en onderhoud je ETL-pipelines met behulp van DataFactory, waarmee je ervoor zorgt dat data op een gestructureerde en efficiënte manier wordt verwerkt.


Je biedt consultancy aan klanten door hun vragen en behoeften te vertalen naar technische oplossingen. Dit doe je in nauwe samenwerking met een afdeling van ongeveer 20 IT-professionals, waaronder BI-specialisten en functioneel beheerders. Samen werk je aan duurzame projecten voor een betere infrastructuur.


Wat kan je verwachten van de organisatie?

  • Aantal medewerkers 1100+;
  • IT-afdeling 20 medewerkers waaronder data engineering & functioneel beheer;

Maatschappelijke impact:

  • Infrastructuur: ontwerp spoorwegen, bruggen, tunnels & wegen;
  • Mobiliteit: slimme verkeersystemen & mobiliteitsoplossingen;
  • Gebouwde omgeving: duurzaam bouwen en klimaatadaptatie.


Wat breng je mee?

  • Ervaring met het bouwen van complexe Power BI-dashboards en het werken met Power Query voor data manipulatie;
  • Kennis van het bouwen en onderhouden van ETL-pipelines met DataFactory;
  • Ervaring met data engineering in een Azure-omgeving, waaronder Data Bricks;
  • Sterke analytische vaardigheden en het vermogen om businessvragen om te zetten in technische oplossingen;
  • Een proactieve en resultaatgerichte houding;
  • Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om consultancy te bieden aan interne klanten;
  • Ervaring met samenwerken in multidisciplinaire teams.


Interesse?

Herken jij jezelf in deze omschrijving en ben jij klaar voor een uitdagende rol waarin jij het verschil kunt maken? Solliciteer dan nu en word de Data Analist die de organisatie naar een hoger niveau tilt!

Title: BI Data Analist
HTML:
Milgro is hét technologiebedrijf voor het managen van natuurlijk kapitaal. Wij stellen organisaties in staat een duurzame omgang met grondstoffen op winstgevende wijze in hun bedrijfsvoering te integreren. Daarmee versnellen wij ‘het nieuwe normaal’ van een circulaire economie.


Wat ga je doen?

Thuis of op kantoor, als Data & Technology team starten wij de werkdag met een stand-up volgens de scrum-methodiek. Je praat je collega’s bij over de producten waar je gisteren aan gewerkt hebt, wat je prioriteiten voor vandaag zijn en wat nog niet helemaal is gelukt. Met als doel om tijdens de tweewekelijkse ‘sprint’ gezamenlijk iets moois op te kunnen leveren.


Als BI analist heb je een afwisselende baan; van het omzetten van data in begrijpelijke informatie, tot het in gesprek zijn met collega’s van andere afdelingen over een idee dat net is gepitcht en waarvoor een impactanalyse nodig is. Van het analyseren in SQL tot het visualiseren van data in Power BI.


  • Je zorgt voor het ophalen, controleren en verwerken van data. Vervolgens zet je deze om in begrijpelijke informatie en geeft hierover advies;
  • Je maakt rapportages en dashboards die naadloos aansluiten op de behoefte van de eindgebruiker, reken houdend met een gebruiksvriendelijke UI/UX;
  • Je geeft de Product Owner en de rest van product team advies over de beste oplossingen tijdens de discovery fase van een product ontwikkeling;
  • Het onderbouwen van bedrijfsprocessen aan de hand van statistieken, om daarna te helpen met het optimaliseren van deze processen;
  • Het trainen van de superusers en gebruikers in het gebruik van Power BI;
  • Actieve samenwerking met andere afdelingen voor een effectieve productontwikkeling;
  • Beheren van de enterprise rapportages en dashboards in Power BI;
  • Het uitvoeren van impactanalyse bij wijzigingen.


De ideale kandidaat

Is iemand die data-minded en analytisch goed onderbouwd is en energie haalt uit de samenwerking met collega’s van verschillende afdelingen en zich kan verplaatsen in de behoefte van de eindgebruiker. Daarnaast beschik je over:

  • kennis van Power BI en SQL ;
  • kennis van DAX measures;
  • kennis van data modellen volgens de Kimball standaard;
  • minimaal over HBO werk- en denkniveau met bij voorkeur een bedrijfskundige achtergrond. Ervaring in een data-analyse omgeving is een pré;
  • Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift;
  • Krijgt energie van agile-scrum werken.


Wat kan je van ons verwachten?

  • Een uitdagende baan waarbij je werkzaam bent in ons inspirerende kantoor in Rotterdam.
  • Hybride werken: een goede balans tussen thuis en op kantoor werken.
  • Professionele en leuke collega’s.
  • Een prettige informele werksfeer.
  • De kans om je op persoonlijk en professioneel vlak te ontwikkelen.
  • Aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden.


Wie is Milgro?

Milgro is hét technologiebedrijf voor het managen van natuurlijk kapitaal. Wij stellen organisaties in staat een duurzame omgang met grondstoffen op winstgevende wijze in hun bedrijfsvoering te integreren. Daarmee versnellen wij ‘het nieuwe normaal’ van een circulaire economie.

Milgro is een ambitieuze organisatie waarin technologie, ondernemerschap, innovatie en maatschappelijke relevantie samenkomen. Werken bij Milgro betekent veel uitdaging en afwisseling in je werkzaamheden.


Ja, ik wil deze baan bij Milgro!

Leuk dat je enthousiast bent geworden! We zien je sollicitatie graag tegemoet. Stuur jouw CV en motivatiebrief naar Simone Hogeweij via werkenbij@milgro.nl.


In de bepaling of wij wel of geen match zien, wordt onze keuze uitsluitend gebaseerd op jouw kennis, ervaring en jouw eventuele motivatie voor Milgro en de functie. Afkomst, sekse, seksuele oriëntatie, religie of geloofsovertuiging, leeftijd, beperkingen, sociaal-economische status, gezinsstatus en/of andere persoonlijke kenmerken spelen geen rol in onze besluitvorming.


We komen graag zelf in contact met onze nieuwe collega. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.




Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.




We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.




We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.




As a Marketing Data Analyst in our Partnerships and Affiliate Marketing team, you will play a critical role in supporting the success of our affiliate programs and partnerships. We are looking for someone who takes initiative, actively seeks out opportunities for improvement, and is eager to contribute to our team’s success.




In this Role, you’ll get to:

Monitor and Analyse Performance: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various channels, identifying trends, and communicating to the team any anomalies, and opportunities for optimisation.
Generate Insights for Campaign Optimisation: Assist in analysing data to provide insights that help improve campaign performance, ROI, and overall marketing effectiveness.
Develop and Maintain Dashboards: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of dashboards that provide real-time insights into program performance, making it easy for stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends.
Support Partnership Strategies: Work with business developers and learn about the effectiveness of different partnerships, contributing data-driven recommendations for future collaborations.
Take Initiative in Problem-Solving: Proactively identify issues or opportunities for optimisation and develop strategies that improve overall performance.
Collaborate Internationally: Work alongside marketing teams based in Shanghai and other global locations, ensuring that efforts align with broader marketing strategies and global business goals.
Assist in Conducting Experiments: Support the design and analysis of experiments to test new strategies, creatives, or partnership models, contributing to data-driven decisions.




What you'll Need to Succeed:

Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to translate data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Basic SQL Knowledge: Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing datasets is preferred, with a willingness to develop these skills further.
Experience with Data Analysis Tools: Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets, including functions, data manipulation, and pivot tables. Experience with tools like Python, R, or BigQuery is a plus, offering opportunities to engage in more complex data analysis and automation.
Basic Data Visualisation Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimisation. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.




Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What’s more?




Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
We encourage flexible work arrangement.
Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.




Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?




Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!




Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com




Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.









Job Description



Who will you be working with?
The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.



What you are going to do
As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.



Responsibilities include:



Work closely with Sia consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites

Who you are



You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.


Qualifications



What you need



Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.

What we offer



Training opportunities to develop yourself further
Opportunities to work on international assignments
Flexible working hours
A meritocratic approach to promotion
Performance related bonus
An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 Kickstart jouw carrière als Analytics Engineer! 🚀




Ben jij een ervaren Data Analist met skills in SQL, data modeling en dashboarding? Wil je je verder ontwikkelen richting Analytics Engineering en werken met de nieuwste tools en technologieën? Dan is dit jouw kans! Bij Xccelerated krijg je een betaalde advanced training, werk je direct bij een topbedrijf én ontvang je een volwaardig salaris.




🔥 Wat ga je doen?

✅ Werken met data-gedreven teams om slimme businessoplossingen te ontwikkelen.

✅ Data-modellen bouwen en optimaliseren, dashboards maken en waardevolle inzichten leveren.

✅ Data-pipelines ontwikkelen en onderhouden voor rapportages en analyses.

✅ Processen automatiseren en dataflows verbeteren voor soepele operaties.




🚀 Jouw groeipad

🔹 Start met een 2-weekse bootcamp waarin je hands-on aan de slag gaat met deployable code, containerization en Analytics & Data Engineering fundamentals.

🔹 Werk 4 dagen per week als Analytics Engineer bij een toonaangevend bedrijf.

🔹 Op woensdag kom je samen met het Xccelerated-team in Amsterdam voor technische trainingen en coaching van onze experts.

🔹 Na 13 maanden krijg je een vast contract bij het bedrijf waar je werkt.




🎯 Wat breng jij mee?

✔️ Een bachelor- of masterdiploma in een relevant vakgebied.

✔️ 2-4 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of een vergelijkbare rol

✔️ Ervaring met SQL, data modeling en dashboarding.

✔️ Kennis van Cloud-componenten is een plus!

✔️ Je bent analytisch sterk, houdt van data en denkt graag in oplossingen.




🎁 Wat krijg je van ons?

💰 Een goed salaris

🌴 25 vakantiedagen

💻 MacBook & iPhone

🚀 Betaalde bootcamp en wekelijkse trainingen

🍽️ Heerlijke lunches, goede koffie & snacks

🏡 Flexibiliteit: thuis of op kantoor werken




Over Xccelerated

Wij zijn onderdeel van Xebia Group en helpen talenten groeien in Data, Cloud en AI. Bij ons word je onderdeel van een community van 45+ professionals die allemaal gedreven zijn om de wereld van data te veranderen.




🎯 Solliciteren?

📩 Mail Samantha Goncalves via sgoncalves@xccelerated.io of bel +31 6 1388 9770.

🚀 Maak de volgende stap in jouw carrière en word een expert in Analytics Engineering! 🚀

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
About TCS

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital, and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen, and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise, and a global network of innovation and delivery centers.




TCS operates on a global scale & has over 6,08,985 of the world’s best-trained consultants representing 152 nationalities in 53 countries. TCS established its presence in the Netherlands in 1992 and works with leading Dutch Customers across industry sectors, including several NL20 companies. TCS has been ranked #1 in customer satisfaction, among IT services providers in the Netherlands in a survey by Whitelane Research and is recognized as a Top Employer in the Netherlands, Europe & also Global by the Top Employers Institute




For more information, visit www.tcs.com




Role description

A Data Strategist is responsible for defining, implementing, and driving the data strategy across the organization to enable data-driven decision-making. This role bridges the gap between business objectives and data initiatives, ensuring that data assets are leveraged effectively to achieve business goals. The Data Strategist works closely with executives, business leaders, data engineers, and analysts to create actionable insights, optimize data management processes, and build a culture of data literacy within the organization.




Responsibilities:

Data Strategy Development:

Lead the development and execution of the organization’s data strategy, aligning data initiatives with overall business goals and objectives.
Define long-term data strategies, including data collection, management, analysis, and usage, ensuring alignment with corporate priorities.
Identify key opportunities to leverage data as a strategic asset across the business.
Develop and maintain a roadmap for data initiatives that integrates various departments' needs (e.g., marketing, finance, operations, etc.).




Data Governance and Quality Management:

Establish and enforce data governance frameworks to ensure data quality, consistency, and compliance across the organization.
Define best practices for data collection, storage, access, and utilization to ensure data integrity.
Work with IT, data engineering, and other teams to ensure data privacy and security standards are followed, meeting compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Oversee the implementation of data management policies and procedures that promote transparency, trust, and accountability in the organization’s data usage.




Collaboration with Business Leaders:

Serve as the primary point of contact for all data-related initiatives across business functions.
Work with business stakeholders to understand their data needs, translate those into actionable data strategies, and ensure data solutions are aligned with business objectives.
Translate complex data issues into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders, enabling informed decision-making at all levels of the organization.
Work closely with leadership teams to ensure data strategies support long-term business growth and innovation.




Data Analytics and Insights:

Provide guidance on data analytics best practices and methodologies, enabling teams to extract actionable insights from data.
Ensure that business teams are utilizing data effectively for operational, tactical, and strategic decision-making.
Champion data-driven decision-making across the organization by identifying key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics that align with business priorities.
Leverage advanced analytics, including predictive models and data visualizations, to help guide business decisions and strategies.




Data Infrastructure and Tools:

Collaborate with data engineering and IT teams to ensure that the organization has the right tools, platforms, and technologies for collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data.
Identify gaps in data infrastructure and recommend improvements or new technologies to enhance data capabilities.
Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in data analytics tools and technologies, and drive the adoption of relevant tools to improve data workflows.




Performance Monitoring and Reporting:

Track and monitor the effectiveness of data strategies, ensuring data initiatives deliver measurable business value.
Design and implement reporting systems and dashboards to track key business metrics and performance indicators.
Provide regular reports to executive leadership and key stakeholders, summarizing data trends, insights, and the impact of data initiatives on business performance.




Training and Data Literacy:

Foster a data-driven culture by promoting data literacy across the organization.
Lead training initiatives to increase understanding and effective use of data across departments.
Create and implement programs to help teams at all levels develop their data skills, from basic data interpretation to advanced analytics.




Data Innovation and Continuous Improvement:

Explore and experiment with emerging data technologies, techniques, and methodologies to continuously improve data processes and strategies.
Drive innovation within the organization by exploring new ways to leverage data for competitive advantage.
Ensure that data practices are continuously evolving and adapting to industry trends, new challenges, and the evolving business environment.




Skills and Qualifications:

Educational Background:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).




Technical Skills

Proven experience with data analytics, data management, and business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data architecture, and data governance frameworks.
Familiarity with data processing frameworks, such as SQL, Python, R, or other programming languages used for data manipulation and analysis.
Experience with data management platforms (e.g., Hadoop, AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure).
Knowledge of data security and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Strong ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
Proven experience in identifying and developing KPIs and metrics that drive business performance.
Ability to apply advanced statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, or predictive analytics models to solve complex business problems (preferred but not required).




Soft Skills:

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience presenting executive leadership and guiding strategic decision-making.
The ability to translate business problems into data-driven solutions that are both practical and impactful.
Strong leadership and project management skills, with the ability to drive data initiatives across multiple teams.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including business leaders, data engineers, data scientists, and IT professionals.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.
Ability to think strategically about how data can be used to meet business goals and drive organizational change.
Experience in developing and implementing long-term data strategies that support business transformation.




Experience:

Experience with advanced analytics, such as machine learning, AI, or automation in a business context.
Experience working with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and big data solutions.
Familiarity with agile methodologies and how they can be applied to data strategy initiatives




Work Environment:

Collaborative and fast-paced work environment.
Opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technologies.
Supportive and dynamic team culture




Privacy Notice

Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe that employing a diverse workforce is pivotal to our success. Please note, recruiting decisions are always based on applicant’s skills, competencies & experience and potential fitment to the available role
