Interesse gewekt of vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan rechtsreeks contact op met Sjoerd Maas via +31 6 18 40 57 36 of stuur een mail naar sjoerd@forfacts.nl. Kijk voor meer informatie op www.forfacts.nl.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Een positieve toekomst voor iedereen, daar werken we bij Sopra Steria aan. Met meer dan 56.000 collega’s in 30 landen zijn we Europa’s toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale oplossingen. Wij geloven dat het niet alleen technologie is die transformatie aandrijft, maar dat mensen de kern vormen van verandering. Daarom staan mensen centraal in alles wat we doen, zowel individueel als in teamverband. De wereld is hoe we haar vormgeven. Laten we haar samen vormgeven.

Vacatureomschrijving

Als BI Consultant help je onze klanten complexe data-uitdagingen op te lossen. Je verzamelt data uit verschillende bronnen, optimaliseert datasets voor visualisatie en ontwikkelt inzichtelijke en gebruiksvriendelijke dashboards.

Met behulp van je eigen expertise en de design-thinking methodologie van Sopra Steria, verhoog je de kwaliteit van rapportages en visualisaties bij onze klanten. De "actionable insights" uit de rapporten en visualisaties helpen de klanten om de juiste strategische, tactische en operationele beslissingen te nemen.

Naast de waardevolle bijdrage die je levert aan de klant, draag je ook bij aan de visie en ontwikkeling van de praktijk en de eenheid.

Functie-eisen

Wij zijn op zoek naar gepassioneerde collega’s die graag de grenzen verleggen op het gebied van digitale transformatie en technologieconsultancy. Bij Sopra Steria krijg je de kans om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen in een constructieve, samenwerkende teamomgeving, waarbij je werkt aan impactvolle projecten die verandering teweegbrengen voor onze klanten. Als je gedijt op uitdagingen en (de meeste van) de onderstaande kwalificaties bezit, kijken we uit naar je sollicitatie!

Type dienstverband: Hybride

Locatie: Nieuwegein

Aantal uren: 32-40 uur werkweek

Contracttype: Vast

Opleiding: Je hebt een HBO- of WO-opleiding afgerond in de richting van IT

Talen: Nederlands (vereist) en Engels

Je hebt kennis en ervaring van de volgende zaken:


vanaf ongeveer 3jaar ervaring met ten minste één van de volgende tools of bibliotheken en kunt dit aantonen via je portfolio of certificaten:
o Power BI
o Tableau
o Qlik
o D3.js
Ervaring met het optimaliseren van de prestaties van dashboards
Creatief, maar pragmatisch met oog voor detail
Kennis van best practices en visuele ontwerpprincipes
Kennis van programmeertalen zoals JavaScript, Python, C# is een voordeel
Kennis en gevoel voor UX-design is een extra pluspunt
Je geniet ervan om expert te zijn en collega's en klanten te coachen
Je kunt gemakkelijk communiceren, zowel met je collega’s als met de klant en eindgebruikers van je visualisaties
Het toevoegen van je dashboards of portfolio aan de sollicitatie is een voordeel


Aanvullende informatie

Als onderdeel van een van Europa’s grootste aanbieders van digitale oplossingen profiteer je van uitgebreide carrièremogelijkheden, zowel lokaal als internationaal. Bij de Sopra Steria Academy maak je deel uit van een dynamisch netwerk van 56.000 professionals in verschillende stadia van hun loopbaan. Je wordt onderdeel van een toonaangevende techspeler in Europa, erkend voor zijn consultancy, digitale diensten en softwareontwikkeling.

Binnen de area Data creëren wij duurzame waarde bij onze klanten op het gebied van data. Wij helpen bedrijven om wendbaar te blijven in de transitie door data en techniek onderdeel te laten zijn van zowel de dagelijkse operatie als de strategische besluitvorming. Hiermee helpen wij onze klanten de verandering voor te zijn met behulp van data. Het is onze ambitie om organisaties te laten excelleren met data. Je werkt in een hightech omgeving met focus op kennis en innovatie, een open no-nonsense bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor eigen initiatief. De area bestaat uit 5 practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualisation, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations en Spatial Intelligence. Elk met een duidelijke signatuur en focus op inhoud en bijbehorende solution. Binnen deze area zijn ruim 170 professionals werkzaam in een voor hen logische en passende vakinhoudelijke practice.

Onze medewerkers staan bekend om hun gedurfde keuzes en het leveren van resultaten. Werk samen met hooggekwalificeerde professionals die voorop lopen in bedrijfs-softwareoplossingen en innovatie bij Europa's toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale diensten.

Wij bieden een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder:


Locatie onafhankelijk en flexibel werken;
Onbeperkte ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden;
Een laptop, telefoon en thuiskantoor;
Een aantrekkelijk salaris;
Keuze tussen een bedrijfsauto of een mobiliteitsbudget;
De mogelijkheid om je eigen voordelen aan te passen via Flex Benefits:
Vakantiegeld en winstdeling;
27 verlofdagen (20 wettelijke en 7 bovenwettelijke vakantiedagen).

______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
HTML:
Communiceren, verbinden én uitdagen. Heb jij al enige ervaring als BI consultant? Dan zijn wij opzoek naar jou! Bij E-mergo ga je werken aan uitdagende projecten voor diverse klanten, werk je met ervaren & gezellige collega's die altijd voor je klaar staan én leer je ontzettend veel door ons trainingsaanbod.


Als Business Intelligence Consultant ondersteun je de klanten door het analyseren van data, het ontwerpen, het testen en bouwen. Dit doe je aan de hand van BI de oplossingen Qlik en/of Microsoft Power BI. Strategische en tactische doelstellingen van klanten worden door jou vertaald naar projecten. Ook ontwikkel, lever en onderhoud je complexe rapportage-omgevingen en bouw je tooling voor organisaties, zodat zij beter gebruik kunnen maken van hun data.


Wat krijg je van ons?

Wij bieden een specialistische functie aan, waarbij je zelfstandig en in teamverband te werk gaat. Samen met onze enthousiaste en ervaren professionals werk je hier aan innovatieve projecten. Je komt terecht in een informele werkomgeving met veel ruimte voor innovatie en eigen ideeën. Hiernaast is het voorop lopen in de toepassing van innovatieve oplossingen kenmerkend bij

E-mergo en staat persoonlijke ontwikkeling bij ons hoog in het vaandel. Zo krijg je bij ons de kans om te ontwikkelen op hard skills en soft skills.


Er zijn ook een aantal dingen die je standaard van ons krijgt:

-Een goed en marktconform salaris op fulltime basis afhankelijk van de ervaring die je meebrengt;

-Opleidingsmogelijkheden (je krijgt van ons 10 opleidingsdagen per jaar)

-25 vakantiedagen (meer is mogelijk);

-Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden (bonus, leaseauto naar keuze, telefoon en laptop);

-Onze Employee Benefits, waar jij nog extra voordelen uit kan halen;

-Hoge mate van verantwoordelijkheid;

-Onkostenvergoeding;

-Goede pensioenregeling.


Wat zoeken wij in jou?

Wij zijn opzoek naar een Consultant die innovatief te werk gaat en graag initiatief neemt. Je bent ervaren binnen jouw vakgebied en hebt passie voor Business Intelligence en data technologieën. Het adviseren en het creëren van slimme oplossingen zie je steeds als een uitdaging. Je analyseert en integreert data uit verschillende bronnen, zet complexe voorspellende rapportagestructuren op en plant scenario’s.


-Je hebt minimaal een afgeronde HBO diploma en aantoonbare kennis van Business Intelligence;

-Ervaring met Qlik, TimeXtender en/of Microsoft Power BI

-Je hebt een goede beheersing van de Nederlands en Engels taal in zowel woord als geschrift

-Ervaring met het modelleren van data;

-Je bent bekend met systeembeheer concepten, processen en normen;

-Je bent analytisch sterk en flexibel;

-Je kunt goed zelfstandig werken en in teamverband;

-Je bent communicatief vaardig en beheerst de Nederlandse taal.


Over ons

E-mergo is gespecialiseerd in Business Intelligence oplossingen. Wij zijn een kennisintensief bedrijf met medewerkers die gespecialiseerd zijn in Business Intelligence oplossingen. Onder het motto ‘Manage your data, innovate your business’ helpen wij organisaties het maximale om uit hun data te halen. Dit doen wij met behulp van de oplossingen van Qlik, TimeXtender en Microsoft, waarvoor wij software, consultancy en beheer leveren. Hiermee bieden wij zinvolle informatie waarmee organisaties sneller en slimmer beslissingen kunnen nemen. E-mergo heeft in de Business Intelligence markt een unieke positie met betrekking tot BI software. Wij zijn één van de Elite partners van Qlik in Nederland, Microsoft Solution Partner en daarnaast TimeXtender Benelux partner of the year van 2019, 2020 en 2021 + wereldwijd partner of the year in 2023. Naast onze professionele werkzaamheden vinden wij het sociale aspect ook erg belangrijk. Zo gaan wij jaarlijks met een groep op wintersport en houden wij maandelijkse teammeetings. Hierbij ontstaat altijd een mix van inhoudelijke onderwerpen en collegiale gezelligheid.



Bij E-mergo geloven we dat verschillen ons samen sterker en beter maken en staan we voor gelijke carrièrekansen voor iedereen. We streven naar een inclusieve cultuur, waarin verschillen worden herkend, gewaardeerd en benut. En we sluiten niemand buiten.


Enthousiast?

We kijken ernaar uit om met jou in gesprek te komen en meer over jou te weten! We ontvangen daarom graag jouw sollicitatie via de sollicitatiebutton of via een mail naar recruitment@e-mergo.nl. Voor vragen mag je natuurlijk altijd even contact opnemen.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Een positieve toekomst voor iedereen, daar werken we bij Sopra Steria aan. Met meer dan 56.000 collega’s in 30 landen zijn we Europa’s toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale oplossingen. Wij geloven dat het niet alleen technologie is die transformatie aandrijft, maar dat mensen de kern vormen van verandering. Daarom staan mensen centraal in alles wat we doen, zowel individueel als in teamverband. De wereld is hoe we haar vormgeven. Laten we haar samen vormgeven.

Vacatureomschrijving

Je identificeert de behoeften van de organisatie en vertaalt deze naar informatieoplossingen. Je stelt ook gevalideerde vereisten en specificaties op met de juiste kwaliteit en diepgang, en prioriteert deze samen met de business. Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor de organisatie en voor de scrumteams als het gaat om inhoud. Bovendien ben je in staat om duidelijk over te brengen wat gerealiseerd moet worden als geen ander.

Je hebt een passie voor je werk en richt je volledig op klanttevredenheid en kwaliteit. Durf, proactieve communicatieve vaardigheden en een sterke analytische benadering zijn essentieel voor je rol als Data Analist.

Als Data Analist bij Sopra Steria overbrug je de kloof tussen business, informatie en technologie. Als echte expert in jouw vakgebied voer je gesprekken met stakeholders zoals beheerders, gebruikers en architecten. Je identificeert hun behoeften en vertaalt deze naar informatieoplossingen. Je stelt gevalideerde vereisten en specificaties op met de juiste kwaliteit en diepgang en prioriteert deze samen met de business. Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor de organisatie en voor de scrumteams als het gaat om inhoud. En je bent in staat om duidelijk over te brengen wat gerealiseerd moet worden als geen ander.

Functie-eisen

We zijn op zoek naar gepassioneerde collega’s die graag de grenzen van digitale transformatie en technologieconsulting verleggen. Bij Sopra Steria krijg je de kans om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen in een constructieve, samenwerkende teamomgeving, waarbij je werkt aan impactvolle projecten die verandering teweegbrengen voor onze klanten. Als jij gedijt in een uitdagende omgeving en voldoet (tenzij anders vermeld) aan de meeste kwalificaties hieronder, kijken we uit naar je sollicitatie!

Type dienstverband: Hybride

Locatie: Nieuwegein

Aantal contracturen: 32-40 uur per week

Contracttype: Vast

Opleiding: Je hebt een HBO- of WO-opleiding afgerond in de richting van IT

Talen: Nederlands (vereist) en Engels

Je hebt kennis en ervaring van het volgende:


Minimaal twee jaar ervaring in data-analyse en datavormgeving
Affiniteit met data, datastructuren en datamapping
Kennis en ervaring met datamodellering en relationele algebra
Nauwkeurige en precieze werkhouding
Analytisch denkvermogen, sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en een praktische instelling
Ervaring met SQL is een duidelijke pré


Aanvullende informatie

Als onderdeel van een van Europa’s grootste aanbieders van digitale oplossingen profiteer je van uitgebreide carrièremogelijkheden, zowel lokaal als internationaal. Bij de Sopra Steria Academy maak je deel uit van een dynamisch netwerk van 56.000 professionals in verschillende stadia van hun loopbaan. Je wordt onderdeel van een toonaangevende techspeler in Europa, erkend voor zijn consultancy, digitale diensten en softwareontwikkeling.

Binnen de area Data creëren wij duurzame waarde bij onze klanten op het gebied van data. Wij helpen bedrijven om wendbaar te blijven in de transitie door data en techniek onderdeel te laten zijn van zowel de dagelijkse operatie als de strategische besluitvorming. Hiermee helpen wij onze klanten de verandering voor te zijn met behulp van data. Het is onze ambitie om organisaties te laten excelleren met data. Je werkt in een hightech omgeving met focus op kennis en innovatie, een open no-nonsense bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor eigen initiatief. De area bestaat uit 5 practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualisation, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations en Spatial Intelligence. Elk met een duidelijke signatuur en focus op inhoud en bijbehorende solution. Binnen deze area zijn ruim 170 professionals werkzaam in een voor hen logische en passende vakinhoudelijke practice.

Onze medewerkers staan bekend om hun gedurfde keuzes en het leveren van resultaten. Werk samen met hooggekwalificeerde professionals die voorop lopen in bedrijfs-softwareoplossingen en innovatie bij Europa's toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale diensten.

Wij bieden een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder:


Locatie onafhankelijk en flexibel werken;
Onbeperkte ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden;
Een laptop, telefoon en thuiskantoor;
Een aantrekkelijk salaris;
Keuze tussen een bedrijfsauto of een mobiliteitsbudget;
De mogelijkheid om je eigen voordelen aan te passen via Flex Benefits:
Vakantiegeld en winstdeling;
27 verlofdagen (20 wettelijke en 7 bovenwettelijke vakantiedagen).

______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.

Title: BI/Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Stellen-ID: 1033

Das ist Deine neue Leidenschaft


Du entwickelst und implementierst Standards für Reportings, darunter Gestaltungsprinzipien, KPI-Definitionen und machst datengetriebene Arbeit dadurch effizienter und verständlicher.
Du behältst den Überblick über alle bestehenden Reportings und sorgst für Transparenz, um eine einheitliche Datenbasis als Entscheidungsgrundlage im Unternehmen zu gewährleisten.
Du unterstützt unsere Fachabteilungen leidenschaftlich beim Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung von Reportings - immer genau dann, wenn deine Expertise gebraucht wird.
Du packst in der Implementierung selbst mit an,und setzt KPIs und Dashboards eigenständig um. Dabei gestaltest du visuell ansprechende und funktionale Reports, die echten Mehrwert liefern.
Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für Power BI als zentrales Reporting Tool, treibst die Weiterentwicklung voran und bist unser zentraler Ansprechpartner für alles rund um Reporting und Analysen.


Damit begeisterst Du uns


Erste Berufserfahrung als BI/Data Analyst oder in einer ähnlichen analytischen Rolle
Fundierte Erfahrung mit BI-Tools, idealerweise Power BI, sowie ein solides Verständnis von Datenmodellen, ETL-Prozessen und SQL.
Ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Zahlen, Daten und deren Zusammenhänge sowie die Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich darzustellen.
Du hast Erfahrung in der technischen Aufbereitung der relevanten Rohdaten über die verschiedenen Qualitätslevel und verstehst die Analytics-Anforderungen des Business.
Praktische Erfahrung im Design und in der Entwicklung von Dashboards und Reports, einschließlich der Definition und Visualisierung von KPIs.
Hervorragende schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, um Diskussionen auf technischer, Business- und Führungsebene in deutscher und englischer Sprache erfolgreich zu führen
Lust darauf, in einem interdisziplinären Team zu arbeiten und gemeinsam datengetriebene Innovationen voranzutreiben.


Das bieten wir Dir


Durch die Möglichkeit zur Gleitzeit (40h/Woche bei Vollzeit) und zum mobilen Arbeiten innerhalb Deutschlands, gestaltest du deine individuelle Arbeitsweise.
Nutze modernste Hardware, die wir dir selbstverständlich zur Verfügung stellen.
Ein familiengeführtes, international agierendes Unternehmen - Sei Teil unserer digitalen Transformation und gestalte die Zukunft im Gesundheitswesen aktiv mit.
Begleite zukunftsweisende Innovationen im Bereich der Digitalisierung und setze gemeinsam mit uns neue Maßstäbe.
Erlebe eine New Work Kultur der Partizipation - bei uns stehen Empowerment und der wertschätzende Umgang miteinander im Mittelpunkt.
Profitiere von individuellen Angeboten der Thieme.ACADEMY, die deine Stärken fördern und deine persönliche Entwicklung vorantreiben.
Profitiere von diversen Gesundheits- und Sportangeboten.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Lebensversicherung
Description:
Wir sind die Württembergische, der verlässliche Fels in der Brandung für unsere Kunden. Diese Leitidee begleitet uns in allem, was wir tun. Und dafür suchen wir Menschen, Mitstreiter und Macher. Die Württembergische Versicherung AG - mit Standort in Kornwestheim im Großraum Stuttgart - gehört zu den traditionsreichsten Versicherern Deutschlands. Diese Stärke nutzen wir für den Aufbruch, für die Veränderung, für die Zukunft. Wir sind Teil der W&W-Gruppe, einem Finanzdienstleister mit über 13.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern.

Data Analyst (m/w/d) Lebensversicherung

Kennziffer: 33464 | Standort: Kornwestheim

Wir suchen einen Data Analyst (m/w/d) für unsere Organisationseinheit RPD Statistik & Data Analytics, der die spannende Herausforderung liebt, Daten zu analysieren und auszuwerten, um fundierte Business-Entscheidungen zu treffen.

Aufgaben


Statistische Auswertungen erstellen: Du entwickelst und präsentierst maßgeschneiderte statistische Auswertungen für unsere internen und externen Stakeholder, um wertvolle Einblicke zu liefern, die strategische Entscheidungen unterstützen. Du nutzt dazu die BI-Software SAS Enterprise Guide und SAS Viya.
Projektverantwortung: Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für spezifische Arbeitspakete und stellst sicher, dass die Projekte im Zeitrahmen und innerhalb der vereinbarten Qualitätsstandards abgeschlossen werden.
Innovationen vorantreiben: Du spielst eine Schlüsselrolle in der Weiterentwicklung unseres Competence Center für KI & Data Analytics in der Lebensversicherung und begleitest spannende Anwendungsfälle von der Idee bis zur Umsetzung.
Anforderungsmanagement: Du arbeitest eng mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen, um die Anforderungen zur Optimierung der Datenlandschaft klar zu definieren und effizient umzusetzen.
Datenbasis weiterentwickeln: Du sorgst für den reibungslosen Betrieb und die kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Statistischen Datenbasis Leben (SDB), um stets qualitativ hochwertige Daten zur Verfügung zu stellen.


Profil


Akademische Ausbildung: Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Mathematik, Informatik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet – oder vergleichbare praktische Erfahrung.
Erfahrung: Du bringst mehrere Jahre Erfahrung im Datenmanagement im Versicherungssektor mit und hast fundierte Kenntnisse in der Projektarbeit.
Technische Fähigkeiten: Du bist versiert in der Datenanalyse und -aufbereitung und hast solide Kenntnisse in SQL, SAS und modernen Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R.
Versicherungsmathematik: Du verfügst über versicherungsmathematische Kenntnisse und hast Erfahrung im Bereich KI & Data Analytics, die Du in Deinen Projekten effektiv einsetzt.
Analytische Denkweise: Du hast ein tiefes Verständnis für analytische Fragestellungen und kannst komplexe Daten in umsetzbare Empfehlungen umwandeln.
Teamfähigkeit und Eigenverantwortung: Du arbeitest gerne im Team, bringst jedoch auch eine starke Eigenverantwortung mit, um zielorientiert und effizient zu handeln.
Kommunikationsstärke: Deine Fähigkeit, komplexe Informationen klar und präzise zu kommunizieren, ist einer der Schlüssel zu Deinem Erfolg.


Wir bieten

Flexibilität


Mobiles Arbeiten
Individuelle Teilzeitmodelle


Gesundheit


Vielseitige Sportangebote
Gesundes Essen im Betriebsrestaurant


Familie


Kita Kooperation & Kindernotfallbetreuung
Unterstützung bei der Pflege von Angehörigen


Extras


Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Vergünstigungen auf W&W-Produkte


Entwicklung


Laufbahnmodelle
Persönliche & fachliche Weiterbildung


Mobilität


Jobrad & Jobticket
Ladestationen für E-Bikes und E-Autos


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Wir bieten

Flexibilität

  • Mobiles Arbeiten
  • Individuelle Teilzeitmodelle

Gesundheit

  • Vielseitige Sportangebote
  • Gesundes Essen im Betriebsrestaurant

Familie

  • Kita Kooperation & Kindernotfallbetreuung
  • Unterstützung bei der Pflege von Angehörigen

Extras

  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
  • Vergünstigungen auf W&W-Produkte

  • Persönliche & fachliche Weiterbildung

Mobilität

  • Jobrad & Jobticket
  • Ladestationen für E-Bikes und E-Autos

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Working Student in Data Analysis
Description:
Advantest has embarked on a digital transformation journey, which is a key enabler for our continuous business growth.

Your Contribution

You will work closely with our data analysis team to assist in managing data, conducting analyses, and reporting findings. This position offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data processing, analysis, and visualization techniques in a supportive and challenging environment. Your contribution aids in the creation of solutions that create efficiency savings in the operational teams.

Areas of responsibility: Support the Data Analysts within transformation projects


Collect business requirements and develop proposals on how to fulfil them
Analyze business data, identify data quality issues and possible solutions under supervision of Data Analysts
Understand and clean data, establish data cleaning automation
Maintain our global data catalog
Create and maintain documentation for data analysis processes and their outcome
Create visualizations
Engage with business users in meetings and contribute ideas for enhancing reporting and analysis capabilities
Research and knowledge sharing


Requirements

Your background:


Enrolled in an undergraduate or advanced program related to statistics, computer science, business informatics or similar
Track record in data analysis, descriptive analytics, predictive analytics (bonus) based on recent projects
Good fluency in SQL and Python with a shareable portfolio
Fluent in English, German is a bonus
Experience with Azure and Databricks is a bonus
Eagerness to learn and apply new concepts
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data enthusiast with a passion for uncovering hidden insights? Do you thrive in solving complex problems and want to make an impact? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

My name is Camilla Sternberg, Head of Data & Analytics Delivery for TV & Revenue Assurance at Telia Company. Today, we're looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our TV Analytics team. Your analytical skills will play a vital role in safeguarding Telia Company’s success as a media aggregator. Ready to make a difference? Apply now and embark on an exciting career journey with us!

Telia has built a leading position as a media aggregator, allowing viewers to access the most popular streaming services and TV channels in one place through our platform. This is a key reason why Telia’s TV customers have been the most satisfied in Sweden for several years in a row.

As a Data Analyst you will…

As a Data Analyst in the TV Analytics team, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to identify customer and usage trends, measuring product performance across the Nordic footprint and providing insights supporting strategic decision-making.

In this role, you will work in a cross-functional team tightly integrated with our Pay TV, Content management and TV business teams. You will analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns to understand TV Customers’ viewing and behavior patterns and identify key drives for stickiness. Your insights will be used to prioritize TV development, ensuring a focus on what matters most to our customers.

Additionally, you will enable content provider statistics and trends as input to negotiation processes and strategic planning of Telia’s content portfolio.

You will also play a crucial role in identifying and addressing fraud and misuse of the TV service, showcasing our commitment to exploring new opportunities and maximizing the potential of our vast data resources.

Who We’re Looking For

You are independent with a strong drive, yet a team player who appreciates an inclusive team environment. You have a proven track record in data analysis, where your unique blend of analytical, technical, and business skills has created value. Specifically, you have proven experience as a Data Analyst with several success stories to share.

Your strong analytical skills enable you to interpret complex data sets and work with various databases while effectively managing data from multiple sources. You are proficient in data analysis tools and software such as SQL and Python and have experience with data visualization tools like PowerBI, Qlik Sense or Tableau. Experience with cloud technologies like GCP, Big Query is a plus.

Your curious and proactive mindset drives you to raise and test hypotheses to uncover insights. You have excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and strong communication and collaboration abilities. You can initiate, drive, and adapt to change in a dynamic environment.

(Monthly salary range for this position: 3 908 - 5 863 EUR before tax deduction. This range is applicable for candidates based in Lithuania).

We are more than a workplace

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.

Ready to make better happen?

We´re looking forward to your application by 30/03/2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed.

Got questions? Please reach out to Camilla Sternberg at Camilla.Sternberg@teliacompany.com

Join us and let’s make better happen – together!


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.




We are hiring Data Analyst in Stockholm, Sweden with below expertise:




Minimum 8 10 years of IT experience and minimum 3 4 years of Analyst experience overall 5 years of Data Analyst experience
Advanced Business Analyst who has profound experience in doing data Analysis using SQL Knowing SAS Python is an added advantage
Well versed and comfortable in handling Huge Datasets
Good Analytical and problem-solving skills
Should be able to understand the Business terminologies and act as a very good barrier between Business and IT development team
Added advantage to have Functional background around Credit Risk
Independently Convert the Business requirements into High level and low level Solution design
Should be able to support in UT ST and end to end UAT testing
Good Analytical and problem solving skills
Added advantage in creating functional test cases and validating the results
It is very important to have good communication skills and an agile team player




Mandatory Skills : MS Excel, PowerBI, Python, QlikView, Tableau

Good to Have Skills : ANSI-SQL

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description


Help quality check data between different data sources.
Secure data model logic
Help with ad hoc data anlysis and visualisation.


Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


Experience in Data Analytics visualization tools such as PowerBI
Knowledge in SQL
Knowledge/experience in GCP/Big Query
Experience in data modelling and data strategy.


Application deadline: 11-03-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: Data Analyst (B2B Product)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Become part of a team that's exploring data to enhance online trust. As a member of Trustpilot's B2B Product Analytics team, you'll be integrated into an engaging environment where your insights will directly contribute to product strategy and drive innovation. We work together to solve complex challenges and uncover opportunities that elevate the experiences of businesses and consumers globally.

At Trustpilot, data isn't just an asset, it's the lifeblood of our platform. We leverage tools and technologies like BigQuery, DBT, Looker, Amplitude, and advanced statistical modelling to understand user behaviour, optimise product performance, and drive data-informed decisions across the business. You'll be working alongside a team of analysts, data scientists, product managers, engineers, and designers, collaborating to build impactful solutions that enhance the value of Trustpilot for businesses worldwide. Our goal is to create an inclusive environment where diverse perspectives are appreciated and everyone’s contributions are valued.

What You’ll Be Doing


Drive product strategy with data: Conduct in-depth analyses to understand user behaviour, identify opportunities for product improvement and innovation, and measure the impact of product changes
Promote data-driven decision-making: Collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and designers to translate data insights into actionable recommendations that influence product roadmap and development
Build and maintain data infrastructure: Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and other data visualizations in Looker and Amplitude to track key product metrics and provide ongoing visibility into product performance
Conduct in-depth experimentation: Design and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the effectiveness of new features and product enhancements, ensuring data-driven decisions are at the core of product development
Communicate effectively: Present your findings and recommendations to diverse audiences, clearly articulating the value and impact of your work to both technical and non-technical stakeholders up to C-suite level


Who You Are


You leverage data to solve complex product challenges. You're curious and motivated to uncover the 'why' behind the data, constantly seeking new knowledge and exploring different perspectives.
Skilled in product analytics: You have prior experience working with key analytical and statistical methodologies, including cohort analysis, A/B testing, and model-based analyses (regression, clustering, etc.)
Experienced in data visualization and reporting: You have built insightful dashboards and reports using BI/product analytics tools such as Looker and Amplitude.
A skilled communicator: You can effectively communicate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences, translating data into compelling narratives that drive action and business challenges into technical requirements
An effective team contributor: You thrive in a collaborative environment, working closely with cross-functional teams to reach shared goals
You possess proficient SQL skills and some experience in DBT. You’re comfortable working with scripting languages like Python or R for data analysis


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 320 million reviews and 70 million monthly active users across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst - Copenhagen:




Are you a data-driven problem solver with a passion for turning numbers into insights?

Do you thrive in a collaborative team and love working with stakeholders to drive real business impact?




I am looking for a data driven problem solver to join a dynamic workforce and help them on their digitalization journey.

Joining the business development team means you are a key point of contact for our internal stakeholders - helping to bring new business value through detailed reports.




Your goal? Bring data to the forefront of the business!




Role and Responsibilities:




Play a forward role within the business, helping to achieve strategic goals by leveraging data
Define, design and deliver advanced reporting through Power BI
Using your analytical mindset to find new value from the data
Collaborate with the Data & Analytics Manager to become the key point of contact for internal stakeholders




Key Skills Required:




Previous experience in an analytical or data focused environment
Hands on experience with Power BI and reporting
Strong work ethic as an individual or in a team
Self-starter mentality with confidence in their own ability to solve data focused problems
Fluency in Danish and English




Alongside your Danish counterparts, this business has a large collaboration with a larger team in Sweden.

Cross collaboration on projects is not only expected but promoted.




If you are looking to kick-start your career with a data driven position in a team that wants to see you thrive - then here it is!




d.nichol@tenthrevolution.com

Show more

  • Define, design and deliver advanced reporting through Power BI
  • Using your analytical mindset to find new value from the data
  • Collaborate with the Data & Analytics Manager to become the key point of contact for internal stakeholders


Key Skills Required:


  • Previous experience in an analytical or data focused environment
  • Hands on experience with Power BI and reporting
  • Strong work ethic as an individual or in a team
  • Self-starter mentality with confidence in their own ability to solve data focused problems
  • Fluency in Danish and English


Alongside your Danish counterparts, this business has a large collaboration with a larger team in Sweden.

Cross collaboration on projects is not only expected but promoted.


If you are looking to kick-start your career with a data driven position in a team that wants to see you thrive - then here it is!


d.nichol@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about solving business challenges through Data modelling & Deep Analytics?

Do you love coding and exploring the junction of data analytics and business processes, while keeping the business goals in mind?

If so, join us!

What the job is …

The job is in the global master data team in Satair OEM located in Copenhagen. The team currently consists of 12 employees all located in Copenhagen.


Standardize analytics and ensure high-quality visualization.
Support the data-driven transformation of the Master Data OEM team
Understand the processes and pain points, to gather requirements, opportunities and value levers regarding data and possible use of technologies
You will design and model scalable data assets on the BW4HANA / Skywise ecosystem while handling data from various data sources and determine how best to structure it in order to provide data in a ready-to-use form for the to the wider master data OEM team
You are expected to write high quality, maintainable, and robust code to ensure data quality and integrity.
Performing analysis and experiments to derive business insights
Be the interface between the master data team ,the data ecosystem and the business.
Actively contribute and share best practices, findings, and techniques with the wider data community.
Develop, test and implement the most suitable analytical models to identify meaningful patterns or trends from complex data sets and types.
Work alongside data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems


What do you offer?

You are an enthusiastic team player, self-driven, proactive and autonomous with a business-oriented mindset. You are curious and enjoy providing solutions to business needs. You demonstrate excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex analytical and technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Ideally, You Have


University degree in Engineering / Computer science preferred
Robust coding abilities (Python, SQL) & experience in working with APIs, algorithms, data structures would be a plus
Proven experience in developing and implementing analytics solutions in a business context.
Fluency in English.


What does your next challenge look like?

At Satair, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.

We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow.

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers’ orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.

With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.700 people and a turnover of $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.

Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options


Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company

Satair A/S

Contract Type

Permanent

Experience Level

Professional

Job Family

Digital

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing Insights)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 113 million registered users and 240,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 419+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.132.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst to join us in shaping the future of our newly established Demand Analytics team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in enhancing our team's capabilities around Marketing analytics while benefiting from a robust support structure designed to foster growth and innovation. We are also ready to consider candidates with more work experience as Senior Data Analyst.

As a Marketplace, Marketing is one of Too Good To Go’s most powerful levers for driving demand. Consequently, a strong foundation in marketing metrics is essential for this role. The models and methodologies you will help develop are largely marketing-focused, emphasizing the importance of experience with causal impact modeling and econometric modeling.

That said, Demand Analytics at Too Good To Go extends beyond Marketing. We are looking for someone who can also contribute to broader analytical initiatives, such as demand forecasting and other data-driven projects.

If you’re passionate about leveraging analytics to make a real-world impact and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Collaborate with marketing teams to optimize campaign strategies and resource allocation based on data-driven insights
Conduct in-depth analyses to identify the drivers of demand and measure marketing impact
Utilize marketing insights to inform and enhance demand forecasting models


Requirements


You have an understanding of Marketing Data and KPIs, or a strong appetite to learn this space.
Having experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics would be a clear advantage.
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You have hands-on experience working closely with senior stakeholders, ideally within Marketing, to deliver data-driven insights.
You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests, as well as applying causal inference and impact modeling techniques.
You have econometric modeling experience; familiarity with marketing mix models (MMM) is a plus.
You are proficient in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation
You have Python expertise for data pre-processing, or statistical analysis. R would also be considered.
You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.

Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about enabling insights to be discovered through data? Do you have a keen eye for how to best visualize and communicate with data through reporting and analytics solutions? Do you want to assist in enabling data-informed decision making in area of Supply & Distribution to grow the world’s largest jewelry brand? If yes, you are the person we are looking for. As our new data visualization specialist, you will play a pivotal role in making sure that we create technical analytics solutions that solve real business problems and engage users to drive adoption.

Transform, model and visualize data

At PANDORA, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new Data Visualization Specialist, you will collaborate with product managers, data engineers, stakeholders, and end-users across the global organization. You will help business verticals and clusters maximize the value of our data and drive impactful business change.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing analytics solutions on our global data platform along with our team of excellent engineers in the organization.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  


Working closely with your products team to design efficient, stable, and to-the-point products to drive commercial business value through reporting, self-service analytics and other data communication cases.
Creating and maintaining high-quality and high-performance Power BI reports and semantic models.
Taking ownership of your products and continuously tracking stability, adoption, and impact.
Ensuring that great user experiences are at the heart of all deliverables.
Delivering self-service solutions for end-users and training them in their usage.
Working with stakeholders and end-users to assist with data-related technical challenges.
Following best practices and existing guidelines but also challenging the status quo.



Team Player With Strong Analytical Skills

We are looking for a real team player with a product-oriented, can-do attitude who is both technically proficient but also able to engage with end-users. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, we are looking for a confident communicator that can explain solution designs and can tailor their message and solutions according to the audience.

You’re perfect for this role if you have:


Relevant education within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field, however experience and passion for data analytics is most important.
At least 2 years of experience working with BI, data preparation, and visualization.
Experience from a global retail organization.
Experience with Power BI, DAX, Analysis Services, Tabular Editor, SSMS, Databricks, Power Automate, Power Apps, and Jira.
Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL and Tabular models.
High proficiency in English and ability to communicate at all levels of technical competence.
Agile mindset and experience with Scrum and agile ways of working.



Your new team

You will be an essential asset to one of PANDORA’s Data & Analytics product teams, consisting of data engineers, business analysts, scrum masters, and product managers who all enable our global business users in making impactful decisions informed by data. You will join our Digital Hub in Havneholmen, a peninsula on Kalvebod Brygge with a great view over Copenhagen Harbour.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake 

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
Show more

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Copenhagen:




A new role available with one of my most forward facing tech hubs. We are now looking to find a senior analyst to join an international workforce.




Helping to drive new innovation and striving to spearhead data-driven decision making with a tailored data solution built with snowflake, dbt and airflow. Reporting directly to Director of data platform you will adopt key responsibilities, guiding the team and stakeholders across multiple offices.




Being in a fast paced dynamic environment, we need you to be a strong team player as well as a confident individual. Bringing new ideas forward based of well structured research. You will be helping to manage a data set that can be 100TB daily so having that attention to detail is really valuable!




Key responsibilities:

Spearhead data-driven decision making, guiding and advising stakeholders through digital projects
Help to strengthen best practices for data management
Collaborate with an existing team of IT specialists
Take ownership of our data sets, discovering new opportunities and add greater value
Define, manage and maintain projects, helping to ensure delivery to a high quality




Skills needed to succeed:

Proven track record with SQL and data management
Previous experience in a fast paced data environment
Strong analytical and communication skills
Confidence in a team and as a solo team member
Previous experience driving digital projects is a plus
Fluency in English




You will be welcomed and supported by a team of like-minded specialists, 5 of which are also data analysts.




All team members help to drive the business forward through knowledge sharing and sparing - helping to adopt an innovative culture.




Working flexibility is heavily promoted but we do need someone who can be on site in the office which is located in central Copenhagen.




Salary will be measured based on experience and ambition, if you are a more junior profile who believes they have what it takes to succeed - please still apply!

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Company Description

Enversion is a health-tech company focused on improving well-being through intuitive solutions for patients and healthcare professionals worldwide.




Role Description

This is a full-time hybrid role for a Business Intelligence Specialist at Enversion A/S. The specialist will be responsible for tasks related to data analytics, data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and analytical skills. The role is located in Copenhagen Metropolitan Area with the option for some remote work.




Qualifications

Consultancy experience, including documented external consultancy work, is a must.
Experience with BI tools such as MS Power BI, Tableau, or SAS is essential.
Data Analytics and Data Modeling skills
Experience with Extract Transform Load (ETL) processes
Strong Analytical Skills
Knowledge of Data Warehousing
Excellent problem-solving abilities
Experience in the health-tech or healthcare industry is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Business, or related field.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
Company Description

Vialto Partners is a market leader in global mobility services. Our purpose is to ‘Connect the world’. We are unique and the only stand-alone global mobility business. This presents a rare opportunity for our clients, stakeholders and colleagues.

Our teams help companies streamline and effectively manage their global mobility programs in a cost-efficient and compliant manner. Our services focus on providing cross-border compliance and risk assessment for tax, immigration, business travel, rewards and compensation, and remote work.

Working at Vialto Partners is about getting the chance to be part of a global and dynamic team. Globally, Vialto Partners has over 6,500 staff worldwide and continues to grow. You will work with clients from a range of industries and different geographical locations. We believe in connecting the world and supporting our colleagues to do the same in their careers by undertaking assignments and opportunities globally that broaden their skills and ultimately benefit our clients.

Vialto is unstoppable when we work together in a culture of belonging, where everyone can thrive. We encourage employees to bring their true selves and share their unique talents and expertise to positively impact the communities we serve.

To learn more about what we do, tune in to our podcast On the Move to hear expert insights on issues affecting global mobility, and read about the latest news in the industry. You can also follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram .

Job Description Summary

The Global Office of Transformation at Vialto Partners has the mission to continuously optimize our delivery model and business processes, leveraging our people, technology and scale as a global enterprise. We are obsessed with driving value for our clients, assignees and employees.

Your pivotal role revolves around applying your expertise in data interpretation & manipulation to transform complex datasets into actionable insights. You will take the lead in automating routine tasks, deploying scalable tools across the organization, and enabling the organization to make faster, more informed decisions, all while driving growth and innovation.

Job Description

Data Analysis


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights for business decisions in the form of dashboards & business intelligence products
Utilize statistical tools and software to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven strategies
Assist in optimizing business operations through data analysis
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across reports and analyses
Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in data analytics


Self-service Automation


Design, develop, and maintain self-service automation solutions that allow users to independently manage tasks and access data with minimal manual intervention
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify automation opportunities that improve user experience and operational workflows
Create user-friendly interfaces for automation tools, ensuring accessibility and ease of use for non-technical users
Implement automation solutions that integrate with various applications
Monitor and troubleshoot the performance of self-service automation tools, ensuring high availability and minimal disruptions
Develop training materials & documentation to empower users to take full advantage of self-service tools
Continuously analyze automation processes and feedback to improve functionality and user satisfaction
Stay updated with the latest automation technologies and best practices to continuously enhance service offerings


Change Management & Collaboration


Lead change management initiatives for the rollout of self-service automation tools and new data analytics capabilities, ensuring smooth transitions and adoption across teams
Collaborate closely with the Technology function and stakeholders in Client Service teams to align automation efforts with organizational goals and ensure tools meet business needs
Support ongoing communication and training efforts to encourage self-service adoption and guide users through any process changes


Qualifications & Skills


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
>5 years of proven experience in transforming operational and client-facing processes through data manipulation and insights
>5 years of proven experience in developing and implementing automation solutions, particularly self-service tools
Strong understanding of automation platforms and scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Power Automate or similar)
Highly proficient with tools such as Power BI, Power Apps, and Google Apps Script or Web Apps. Certification in these areas would be preferable
Knowledge of data-wrangling tools e.g. Alteryx is useful but not a must-have
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to build effective solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users
Experience working with cross-functional teams to drive automation projects and improve workflows


Additional Information


We are an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate based on any legally protected status.


Please note, AI is used as part of the application process.
Show more

Please note, AI is used as part of the application process.

Title: Business and Data Analyst
Description:
Business and Data Analyst – Drive Data-Driven Decision Making!

Are you passionate about analyzing business needs, exploring what information is needed to drive decision-making, and digging deep to find the underlying data needed to create said information? Do you thrive in an international environment where you can make a real impact? Then this role might be for you!

At STARK Group IT, we are on an exciting digital journey, leveraging our scale across Europe to create a competitive advantage in sourcing and supply chain. To accelerate this transformation, we are looking for a Business and Data Analyst to take the lead in analyzing business information needs and their data sources in Norway at Neumann Bygg (part of STARK Group).

Your Role & Responsibilities


Lead the exploration of all reporting needs at Neumann Bygg.
Translate complex and vast business reporting needs to technical specifications of what data is needed.
Collaborate with the Group BI team to leverage synergies between STARK/Neumann in Denmark and Norway.
Engage actively with business stakeholders across the organization to ensure alignment of expectations.
Analyze current systems to find data sources for the reporting needs.
Define and clarify KPIs used and how they are calculated.


The position is based in either Viby J or Frederiksberg. Travel between the two offices can be expected and travels to Norway may be required.

Who We Are Looking For


Strong data analytics skills – You are structured, systematic and diligent, when digging deep into complex data sets, with the purpose to understand which data is found where.
Business understanding and experience – You are accustomed with business processes and ‘speak the language’ of stakeholders executing in the business part of the organization.
Technical acumen – You have experience working with Azure DevOps and understand Data Warehouse & BI methodologies.
Excellent communication skills – You can translate business needs into technical specifications for data engineers, and vice versa.
International mindset – You have worked in a multinational environment and can navigate cultural diversity.


Nice to Have:


Experience in specific business domains (e.g., finance, logistics, pricing).
Experience working in virtual teams.


Why join Group IT?

At STARK Group IT, you will be part of a dynamic and ambitious organization where digital transformation is at the core of our strategy. We offer a collaborative culture, exciting challenges, and the opportunity to work on innovative projects that drive real business value.

When joining Group IT, you will be joining a digital transformation journey as we replace our legacy monoliths and transition towards a modular and flexible integrated setup. Group IT, a dynamic and rapidly evolving part of STARK Group, is responsible for delivering groupwide business-critical IT solutions. We strive to modernise and reimagine the IT landscape to ensure both scalability and composability to meet existing and future business needs, and we would like your help to rethink the way things are done in our industry to offer our customers a superior experience.

At STARK Group IT, we believe in the richness diversity brings. We invite individual of all backgrounds to join us in creating and inclusive and welcoming environment. We believe in a workplace where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.

Want to know more and apply?

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and your options in STARK Group. You are welcome to contact Head of AI, Data & Analytics at mail guy.smith@stark.dk for any specific questions regarding the role.

Are you ready to take the lead in analyzing business and data needs at Neumann Bygg, backed by a competent team of BI specialists? Apply now and be part of our journey!

STARK Group

STARK Group is a growing private equity-owned company with a strong legacy. STARK Group was first established in Denmark in 1896 and has today evolved into a leading European retailer and distributor of heavy building materials with net sales of approx. EUR 9 billion. With a dedicated team of more than 20,000 employees and +1,150 branches and distribution centres across the Nordics, Greenland, Germany, Austria and the UK, we live and breathe to serve professional craftsmen with heavy building materials all the way from the Austrian Alps to Tromsø, close to the Arctic circle and everywhere in between. STARK Group is committed to reach net zero emissions by 2050 across the entire business, is a signatory to the UN Global Compact, and works within fully 2030 validated science-based targets to keep global warming below 1.5°C

Agency Policy

STARK Group IT appreciates the interest of all candidates. However, we prefer to directly engage with individuals seeking employment opportunities. Therefore, we kindly request recruitment agencies, headhunters, and third-party staffing services to refrain from contacting us regarding this job posting. All applications should be submitted directly by the candidates through our official application process. We value direct communication and look forward to reviewing your application.

STARK Group IT appreciates the interest of all candidates. However, we prefer to directly engage with individuals seeking employment opportunities.
