Title: Intelligence and Risk Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Intelligence and Risk Analyst position at Pandora plays a pivotal role in safeguarding the company’s global operations by proactively identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks that could impact its people, customers, and assets. This position is responsible for monitoring emerging threats, analysing intelligence data from various sources, and providing actionable insights to senior leadership.

Key accountabilities:


Risk and Threat Monitoring
Proactively monitor and assess risks and threats that could impact Pandora’s operations, including retail stores, manufacturing, distribution centers, and head offices. Collect, analyze, and interpret intelligence data from various sources to identify emerging risks. Provide real-time reporting on potential or active threats, ensuring immediate escalation to relevant stakeholders'
Data Collection and Analysis


Aggregate physical security reports from across the business to identify trends, patterns, and potential vulnerabilities. Use analytical tools to produce actionable insights and recommendations to mitigate identified risks.


Stakeholder Management
Collaborate with internal teams, including retail operations, manufacturing, and distribution, to communicate risks and propose solutions. Build strong relationships with external intelligence providers and industry networks to ensure timely and accurate data flow.
Proactive Threat Mitigation
Develop and maintain systems and processes for monitoring global risks. Contribute to the development of protocols and procedures for responding to security incidents and mitigating risks.

KPI's:


Successfully implement risk mitigation strategies within an agreed timeframe.
Correlate intelligence reports, presentations, and dashboards that to effective decision-making or operational changes.



Background:


Proven experience in intelligence and data analysis, with a strong ability to interpret and synthesize complex information.
Background in data collection and analysis, preferably within a global or multinational context.



Personal Competencies:


Strong analytical and critical-thinking skills with exceptional attention to detail.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills to effectively relay findings and recommendations.
Ability to work proactively, independently, and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Experience in retail security or familiarity with the retail sector. Proficiency in using data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and intelligence platforms.
Knowledge of physical security measures and protocols.



Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Joe McBrien, TA Specialist, Global Office jomcb@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.  

We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a Data Analyst in our Copenhagen office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change? 

The Role 

As a Data Analyst at Viaplay Group, you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights, enabling us to deliver exceptional experiences to our customers. By leveraging your analytical, visualization, and data modeling skills, you’ll inspire and lead the way toward a more data-informed business. Collaborating with diverse teams, you’ll be integral in evaluating trends, optimizing strategies, and supporting data-driven decision-making. Your expertise will help shape the future of Viaplay Group through enhanced user engagement, content performance, and operational excellence.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business strategies and improve user experiences
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to bring the business closer to data by offering expertise, advice, and insights. Actively contribute to creating a data-informed culture across all levels of the organization
Data Visualization: Build dashboards and reports with a strong focus on storytelling, making complex data easy to understand for stakeholders
Strategic Impact: Partner with stakeholders to align data strategies with business goals, support roadmap decisions, and ensure appropriate tracking is in place for new initiatives
Self-Service Analytics:Champion a self-service analytics culture across the organization, empowering teams to access, interpret, and utilize data independently
Education & Communication: Lead and participate in data education initiatives to improve understanding and utilization of data tools and methodologies across the organization
Process Automation: Identify opportunities for automation in data tracking, analysis, and reporting to streamline processes and improve scalability
Documentation: Create standardized and accessible documentation to ensure clarity, reduce dependencies, and enable teams to operate autonomously


What We’re Looking For 

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following: 


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, demonstrating the ability to work independently and proactively drive change
Strong knowledge of SQL and proficiency in visualization tools like Tableau or ThoughtSpot
Expertise in data storytelling, with the ability to translate complex insights into clear, compelling presentations for technical and non-technical audiences
A passion for setting up dashboards, KPIs, and reporting structures that inspire action and align with business goals
A collaborative mindset, with the ability to build strong relationships and work cross-functionally
A proactive approach to problem-solving, actively seeking new solutions and considering scalability in your work
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for making others enthusiastic about data
Strong proficiency in Danish, both written and spoken


It’s a bonus if you have: 


Experience with analytical engineering or tools like Databricks
Background in the streaming or media industry


What we offer you


We’ve got you covered! 25 days + 5 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more. 


Hit play today 

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position. 

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.   
Show more

Hit play today 

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position. 

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

Title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you’ll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have


Continuous learning Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.


Your Impact

As a junior associate, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.

You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.

As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

Read more about McKinsey Digital here.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
Show more

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.

As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.

About The Job

As a Customer Data Analyst, you will be part of Alfa Laval’s Business Unit Hygienic Fluid Handling at our global center in Kolding. In this role, you will support our B2B operations, collaborating with the industry’s leading channel network. Our Kolding site is home to over 850 dedicated professionals, and we are excited to welcome you to our innovative and dynamic team.

Role

We aim to leverage data to drive business growth and enhance customer experiences. We are looking for a talented Customer Data Analyst to help us understand and utilize customer data across various touchpoints. In this role, you will:


Analyse data across different touchpoints to identify trends and focus on lead generation.
Champion the use of Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Provide input on enterprise feature improvements and refinements for data analytics.
Understand customer behaviour through data analysis to improve our digital customer journeys.
Ensure data quality and interpret patterns with a detail-oriented approach.
Solve business challenges through data-driven insights


The position will be based in Kolding, Denmark. We expect travel activity to be approximately 10-20 days a year.

What You Know

To succeed in this role, you should have:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Data Science, Data Engineering, Business Administration, Statistics, e-Commerce, or a related field.
Experience in data analysis, business intelligence, customer experience or a related field - B2B experience is a strong plus.
Strong analytical skills with a detail-oriented and structured approach.
Ability to interpret data and translate insights into business decisions.
Proficiency in Excel and Power BI.
Familiarity with web analytics tools like Adobe Analytics and Hotjar.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken, with strong communication skills.
Strong collaboration and teamwork abilities.


Who You Are

You are curious with a creative mindset, but you have a structural approach to getting things done. You have a track record in data analysis. You have good digital understanding and ability to understand how systems interact and how to extract data that can be transformed into actions.

For More Information, Please Contact

Jens Sønnichsen, Marketing Manager, jens.sonnichsen@alfalaval.com

Anabela Leite, Talent Acquisition Partner, anabela.leite@alfalaval.com

Please submit your application no later than March 25th, 2025.

We review applications on a rolling basis, so please submit yours as soon as possible. Applications sent directly via email will not be considered due to GDPR regulations.

Our commitment to integrity

We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this, we apply Pymetrics assessments. Upon application, you will be invited to play the assessment games and completing them is mandatory.


Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Gladsaxe, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to support the management in strategic decision-making with your analytical capabilities and business acumen? Are you ready to turn large volumes of complex data into insights and decisions? Do you want to impact the decisions taken in our clinical development organisation, ensuring alignment with business goals to bring life-changing treatments?

Then, this is your chance to join us as a Senior Data Analyst in Global Clinical Business Analysis, Global Trial Portfolio.

Apply now for a life-changing career!

The position
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will act as a value-adding business partner with a key focus on speed, productivity, cost, and performance analysis across our global clinical development organisation. Establishing strong collaboration with the project organisation will be one of your goals in this role.

You will also have the opportunity to:



Turn complex analysis into clear conclusions and easy-to-understand communication slides
Support our leadership teams with in-depth analysis and recommendations on how to improve productivity and performance ensuring that we meet our ambitus targets
Create transparency and analysis for informed decision-making and further develop your presentation skills




This role is an exciting chance to further develop your career in a market-leading global pharmaceutical company. You will be engaging in cross-organisational projects and developing your stakeholder management skills even further. We can offer challenging assignments, flexible working conditions, and continuous personal and professional development.

Qualifications

To thrive and succeed, we imagine you have:



A master’s degree in business, business data science or another relevant scientific field combined with strong business acumen
6-10 years of experience in big-data analysis, data science, or business analysis showing both strong analytical and communication skills, as well as proficiency with IT- tools
Proven track record translating data into strategic and actionable recommendations, determining the added value and potential risks, combined with experience in creating compelling presentations for senior executives, preferably from business consulting background
Curiosity and willingness to learn about clinical drug development and the pharma industry
Fluency in written and spoken English




As a person, you are outgoing, self-driven, ambitious, analytical, a good communicator and you thrive in a dynamic global environment. Furthermore, you enjoy collaborating with many different stakeholders with diverse cultural backgrounds.

About The Department

Global Clinical Business Analysis is a global department of 15 dedicated professionals supporting and collaborating across the global clinical development organisation which is responsible for the clinical research and project management of our products in development with approximately 1100 people in the headquarters function and approximately 2500 in our regions. It is a complex environment with many projects in our development portfolio. Transparency and in-depth analysis on global trial performance, capacity and performance management is critical to us.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information please call Simon Munch Hermansen, Senior Director, at + 45 3075 3792.

Deadline
19 March 2025

Please note that applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews will be conducted accordingly

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

You will also have the opportunity to:


  • Turn complex analysis into clear conclusions and easy-to-understand communication slides
  • Support our leadership teams with in-depth analysis and recommendations on how to improve productivity and performance ensuring that we meet our ambitus targets
  • Create transparency and analysis for informed decision-making and further develop your presentation skills



This role is an exciting chance to further develop your career in a market-leading global pharmaceutical company. You will be engaging in cross-organisational projects and developing your stakeholder management skills even further. We can offer challenging assignments, flexible working conditions, and continuous personal and professional development.

Qualifications

To thrive and succeed, we imagine you have:


  • A master’s degree in business, business data science or another relevant scientific field combined with strong business acumen
  • 6-10 years of experience in big-data analysis, data science, or business analysis showing both strong analytical and communication skills, as well as proficiency with IT- tools
  • Proven track record translating data into strategic and actionable recommendations, determining the added value and potential risks, combined with experience in creating compelling presentations for senior executives, preferably from business consulting background
  • Curiosity and willingness to learn about clinical drug development and the pharma industry
  • Fluency in written and spoken English



As a person, you are outgoing, self-driven, ambitious, analytical, a good communicator and you thrive in a dynamic global environment. Furthermore, you enjoy collaborating with many different stakeholders with diverse cultural backgrounds.

About The Department

Global Clinical Business Analysis is a global department of 15 dedicated professionals supporting and collaborating across the global clinical development organisation which is responsible for the clinical research and project management of our products in development with approximately 1100 people in the headquarters function and approximately 2500 in our regions. It is a complex environment with many projects in our development portfolio. Transparency and in-depth analysis on global trial performance, capacity and performance management is critical to us.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information please call Simon Munch Hermansen, Senior Director, at + 45 3075 3792.

Deadline
19 March 2025

Please note that applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews will be conducted accordingly

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Analytics Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
📍Sthlm/Gbg/Cph/Ldn/Italy                                         📆 As soon as possible

👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week                                               📚 Our Recruitment Process  

At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.

Are you curious to learn more about us? You can meet some of our coworkers and read about our departments here. For insights into how is life at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices. 


We’re looking for an Analytics Specialist to join our team at Precis, working with clients in finance and healthcare - industries that offer exciting and complex analytics challenges.

At Precis, we transform data into value, ensuring our clients have the insights they need for growth while prioritizing user privacy and ethical solutions. You’ll work directly with clients, solve analytics challenges, implement technical solutions, and contribute to commercial processes - all with a focus on data governance and compliance.


WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING 

Tagging and analytics implementations.

Leading complex collaborations and driving your clients’ analytics roadmap.

Exploring new ways to support clients in regulated industries and drive value out of compliant data.

Delivering actionable insights and supporting your clients’ profitability with data and analytics strategy.

Building dashboards and reports.

Ensuring the best data quality for clients and recommending improvements.

Continuously learning and mastering the latest technologies and techniques in our industry.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR 

1+ years of experience working with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.

An understanding of data strategy and digital marketing.

Experience in data analysis and building insights out of extensive data sets.

An interest in privacy, data protection and data governance.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.

Previous studies in topics related to data, tech, analytics or business.

A friendly personality with good collaboration skills, plenty of ambitions, and a desire to become a real expert in digital marketing.

[Preffered] Knowledge of SQL and programming languages such as Python or JavaScript.

WHAT WE OFFER
You can read our full offering in our handbook.

An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.

A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.

Transparent salary setting - you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an L2 role within the Analytics column. Check it out!

30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.

A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.

We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.
We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.

Title: Student Consultant for Data & Intelligence
Description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to help manage a digital platform for renewable services for energy projects worldwide? PEAK Wind is looking for a talented and ambitious Student Assistant to support our Data & Intelligence team (D&I).




Trusted Advisors for Developers and Investors for Some of the Largest Renewable Assets

At PEAK Wind, we specialise in operations, asset management, and project management of renewable energy assets and take pride in providing best-in-class commercial, financial, and operational advisory and support to our clients. We work with some of the world’s largest infrastructure investments and are proud to count market-leading utilities, investment funds, and IPPs among our clients.




The role of the student consultant

Based in our Copenhagen office, you will be part of the Data & Intelligence team, which operates within PEAK Wind's operations advisory unit and handles full value chain data management for clients. Reporting to the Head of Data & Intelligence, you will work in a small, agile team comprising members of varying seniorities.




Your responsibilities will include:

Conducting operational performance analysis of renewable energy assets, including offshore and onshore wind farms.
Analyzing market volatility for the European energy market and its impact on renewable energy operations.
Performing analytics related to Health, Safety, Security, and Environment (HSSE) for renewable energy assets.
Producing high-quality reports, presentations, and meeting materials with insightful information for clients on specific renewable assets and market trends.
Supporting various departments within PEAK Wind by addressing data requirements and assisting in testing data quality.
Engaging in project management tasks, ensuring timely execution and coordination of activities.
Communicating with stakeholders, gathering project requirements, providing updates, and addressing inquiries.




Ambitious and Proactive Student with a Passion for Data and Analytics

You are a driven student with a strong interest in the renewable energy field and an eagerness to learn. We welcome students from all educational backgrounds to apply. Ideally, you are in your final year of a bachelor's program or the early stages of a master's program. As a person, you are solution-oriented with a 'can-do' attitude. You are structured, proactive, and open-minded, with a willingness to engage in product development and a strong desire to learn.




To succeed in this role, you should have:

Proficiency in MS Excel and MS PowerPoint.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English.
A curious and analytical mindset with a keen interest in data and analytics.
Enthusiasm for the renewable energy sector.
Knowledge of Data Science or Statistics, as well as experience with Python or Power BI, is a plus but not required.




Experience the Highest Degree of Involvement

PEAK Wind is dedicated to fostering a work environment that values diversity and our values of Expertise, Passion, Unity, and Integrity are materialized through our team members every day. Here you will be able to utilize your financial and technical skills while developing a strong understanding of renewable energy assets. We offer an opportunity to get on board and experience the highest degree of involvement and responsibility in PEAK Wind’s global renewable energy team. Together with the rest of the team, you will play an instrumental part in the continued success of PEAK Wind. Above that, you will participate in an entrepreneurial environment, with a focus on cooperation and a desire to change the status quo. The position will also offer global exposure as our clients work globally.




Interested and want to know more?

If you have any questions or want to know more about the position, please contact People & Development via recruitment@peak-wind.com. We look forward to receiving your applications & CVs as soon as possible, latest by March 15th, 2025. Please apply through our website. Applications will be assessed on an ongoing basis.




PEAK Wind is dedicated to fostering a work environment that values diversity. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.

Title: Data Model Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
GS1 Denmark søger en Data Model Specialist til vores digitale services.




Brænder du for datamodellering og at sikre høj datakvalitet? Vil du være med til at udvikle og vedligeholde datamodeller, der understøtter digitale løsninger for både danske og internationale virksomheder? Så har vi jobbet til dig!




Hos GS1 Denmark søger vi en Data Model Specialist, der vil få ansvar for vores datamodeller til services som GS1Trade Sync, GS1Trade Exact og GS1Trade Activate. Vi tilbyder et spændende job i en international organisation, hvor dine kompetencer og ambitioner kan være med til at sætte standarder for fremtidens handel og samarbejde.




Om rollen

Som Data Model Specialist bliver du ansvarlig for at:

Udvikle, vedligeholde og optimere datamodeller til vores services.
Sikre, at datamodellerne understøtter forretningsbehov og internationale standarder.
Samarbejde med vores kunder og partnere for at forstå og implementere deres krav.
Bidrage til at udvikle nye digitale løsninger baseret på GS1-standarder.
Sikre dokumentation og vidensdeling på tværs af organisationen.




Vi forestiller os, at du

Har erfaring med datamodellering og dataanalyse.
Kender til dataudvekslingsstandarder og systemintegration – kendskab til GS1-standarder er en fordel, men ikke et krav.
Har stærke analytiske evner samt at du er detaljeorienteret.
Trives i en rolle med både selvstændigt ansvar og samarbejde på tværs af teams.
Har gode kommunikationsevner på dansk og engelsk.




Vi tilbyder

En spændende stilling i en organisation med stor impact på handel og logistik.
Et internationalt miljø med dygtige og engagerede kolleger.
Mulighed for faglig og personlig udvikling.
En arbejdsplads, hvor innovation og samarbejde er i fokus.




Ansøgning

Peoplematter A/S hjælper os med rekrutteringen. Der afholdes samtaler løbende og vi lukker stillingen, når den rette kandidat er fundet. Ansøgning og CV sendes til so@peoplematter.dk i ét dokument. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Søren Overbeck på tlf. +45 22 80 96 84.




Om GS1

GS1 Denmark er den danske division af den globale standardiseringsorganisation GS1. Vi støtter aktører i forsyningskæden og øger effektiviteten, sikkerheden og reducerer omkostningerne. Vi opererer primært inden for detailhandlen og sundhedssektoren med fokus på sporbarhed og data for at øge sikkerheden i Danmark. GS1 er en neutral, non-profit, FN-godkendt NGO.




For yderligere information se mere på www.gs1.dk og www.gs1.org eller ring til Søren Overbeck på ovennævnte telefonnummer.

Title: Senior Energy Data Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for extracting, transforming and visualizing data from multiple sources, such as energy production, prices and budget. You’ll develop and maintain efficient data flows, as well as build insightful visualisations on our reporting platforms (Power BI and Tableau). You’ll leverage your data analytical skills and industry experience to create performance transparency for our sites and leadership teams.

Welcome to Commercial Data Intelligence

You’ll be part of the Commercial Data Intelligence team where you, together with your colleagues, will refine data for performance reporting, develop data logics, and secure a robust data foundation for our global offshore portfolio of turbines and assets. You’ll join a team of nine colleagues with diverse competencies within the offshore wind power industry and you'll have the chance to develop both your data analytics skills and your expertise within the wind industry.

You’ll play an important role in:


developing and maintaining ETL data flows for analytical and reporting purposes
visualising insights through our reporting platforms
having a constructive and profitable relationship with multiple stakeholders
informing and advising the team on state-of-the-art data analytics tools
ensuring data availability and high data quality standards for reporting.


To succeed in the role, you:


have a master’s degree in IT, engineering, business, economics or similar
speak and write English fluently
have experience in analytical roles and are proficient with at least one data analytics tool such as Alteryx, Power BI, Tableau or similar
are passionate about data literacy and can communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
work systematically, show responsibility and deliver high-quality results.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Would you like to make an impact on how BESTSELLER competes in the fashion industry, and are you excited about working in an agile environment? Then BESTSELLER TECH is the place for you! 

We are looking for a Tech Analyst to help us build great material management solutions for the buyers and suppliers within BESTSELLER. We do this by balancing and supporting demands from our business, understanding, and challenging complex processes and introducing modern technology and new ways of working.

YOUR TEAM

You will join a cross-cultural team of highly skilled colleagues who are curious and always searching for new ways of creating value. The team consist of Product Owners, a Scrum Master and the development team of analysts, developers and a designer. With us, you will experience an informal tone, and even though we sit in Malaga, Brande and Aarhus, we connect virtually and psychically as much as possible.

YOUR ROLE

As our Tech Analyst, you interact with the team, the product owners, and the business to gather, understand, and translate requirements into solutions and optimizations of business processes. In our team, we own the products we build, and you will – together with the rest of the team – be responsible for the successful implementation of the solutions.

More specifically, your tasks include:


Supporting and leading various projects, incl. stakeholder management, documentation, and facilitation
Identifying data needs based on business needs and identifying business needs based on data
Supporting the business in the implementation and realization of solutions
Participating in team events as required per our agile setup
Staying up-to-date on current business initiatives, technology trends and best practices within the product development and buying field


YOUR PROFILE

We are looking for a team player who can work independently and maintain focus despite changing demands. You work in a structured and determined manner, meeting deadlines with a focus on quality. You contribute constructively to team discussions, enjoy finding creative solutions to complex challenges, and take an analytical and data-driven approach to problem-solving. Finally, having an outgoing mindset will help you build relations and communicate with colleagues across brands, functions, and organisational levels - and ultimately succeed in the position.

The Material Tech team is looking for an analyst, with:


The ability to understand and communicate complex flows
A positive and proactive mindset and an eagerness to learn
An ability to stay focused despite changing demands and deadlines.


In addition, we’re looking for the following specific qualifications:


Relevant degree, e.g. within supply chain, engineering, or information technology
Experience with analysis of data using SQL, Excel, and/or PowerBI
A solid understanding of business processes within supply chain
Experience being a part of software development
Fluent in written and spoken English – any Danish skills are considered an advantage, but not a requirement.


WORK LOCATION

Aarhus, Denmark.

CURIOUS FOR MORE?

To get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH follow this link and be sure to visit us on us on LinkedIn.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

For any further questions, you are welcome to contact Varun Kashiva +45 30852868. Otherwise, please send us your application and CV as soon as possible and no later than April 19, 2025. We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the ad, when we find the right candidate.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 300 people strong, located in Denmark and in Spain. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more
HTML:
Would you like to make an impact on how BESTSELLER competes in the fashion industry, and are you excited about working in an agile environment? Then BESTSELLER TECH is the place for you! 

We are looking for a Tech Analyst to help us build great material management solutions for the buyers and suppliers within BESTSELLER. We do this by balancing and supporting demands from our business, understanding, and challenging complex processes and introducing modern technology and new ways of working.

YOUR TEAM

You will join a cross-cultural team of highly skilled colleagues who are curious and always searching for new ways of creating value. The team consist of Product Owners, a Scrum Master and the development team of analysts, developers and a designer. With us, you will experience an informal tone, and even though we sit in Malaga, Brande and Aarhus, we connect virtually and psychically as much as possible.

YOUR ROLE

As our Tech Analyst, you interact with the team, the product owners, and the business to gather, understand, and translate requirements into solutions and optimizations of business processes. In our team, we own the products we build, and you will – together with the rest of the team – be responsible for the successful implementation of the solutions.

More specifically, your tasks include:

  • Supporting and leading various projects, incl. stakeholder management, documentation, and facilitation
  • Identifying data needs based on business needs and identifying business needs based on data
  • Supporting the business in the implementation and realization of solutions
  • Participating in team events as required per our agile setup
  • Staying up-to-date on current business initiatives, technology trends and best practices within the product development and buying field

YOUR PROFILE

We are looking for a team player who can work independently and maintain focus despite changing demands. You work in a structured and determined manner, meeting deadlines with a focus on quality. You contribute constructively to team discussions, enjoy finding creative solutions to complex challenges, and take an analytical and data-driven approach to problem-solving. Finally, having an outgoing mindset will help you build relations and communicate with colleagues across brands, functions, and organisational levels - and ultimately succeed in the position.

The Material Tech team is looking for an analyst, with:

  • The ability to understand and communicate complex flows
  • A positive and proactive mindset and an eagerness to learn
  • An ability to stay focused despite changing demands and deadlines.

In addition, we’re looking for the following specific qualifications:

  • Relevant degree, e.g. within supply chain, engineering, or information technology
  • Experience with analysis of data using SQL, Excel, and/or PowerBI
  • A solid understanding of business processes within supply chain
  • Experience being a part of software development
  • Fluent in written and spoken English – any Danish skills are considered an advantage, but not a requirement.

WORK LOCATION

Aarhus, Denmark.

CURIOUS FOR MORE?

To get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH follow this link and be sure to visit us on us on LinkedIn.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

For any further questions, you are welcome to contact Varun Kashiva +45 30852868. Otherwise, please send us your application and CV as soon as possible and no later than April 19, 2025. We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the ad, when we find the right candidate.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 300 people strong, located in Denmark and in Spain. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll be an integral part of our Strategic Portfolio Management team, supporting executive management in the design and execution of our global investment strategy. This entry-level position offers a unique opportunity to develop your analytical skills and gain comprehensive insights into the global renewable energy industry.

Welcome to Strategic Portfolio Management

You’ll be part of a dynamic team where you, together with your colleagues, will conduct in-depth research and analysis, support senior team members on high-impact projects and monitor market dynamics. As a team, we value curiosity, collaboration and a proactive mindset.

You’ll play an important role in:


conducting in-depth research and analysis; delving deep into market trends, new business opportunities and our existing investment portfolio all to provide actionable insights for executive leadership
supporting the evaluation and prioritisation of growth opportunities (across technologies and geographies), helping guide capital to where it has the greatest value to Orsted
managing data and reporting; gathering, processing, and analysing data
collaborating with various departments such as strategy, innovation, M&A teams, and macroeconomics teams.


To succeed in the role, you:


have experience working in a research or analytical role, ideally within the energy, infrastructure, commodity, power or financial sectors
possess proficiency in quantitative and qualitative research methods, with the ability to interpret complex data and present clear, actionable and nuanced recommendations
demonstrate curiosity to seek out new experiences and knowledge coupled with a determined and pro-active attitude to work, with a willingness to take ownership of tasks and challenges
can effectively communicate complex analysis in a simple and impactful way
enjoy working in a collaborative, fast-paced and high-impact environment.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

Title: Junior Data Process Executive
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At YouGov, we aim to provide key insights into consumer behaviour, including who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to help our clients enhance customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.




To achieve our mission, it's essential that our panel data meets the highest quality standards. The Junior Data Process Executive will support our Panel Management team in maintaining our panels in Denmark and Sweden.

The Junior Data Process Executive will enhance the efficiency of our team by streamlining processes and improving data quality. This position is perfect for someone detail-oriented, curious about automation, and driven to make a meaningful impact. The Junior Data Process Executive will collaborate with experienced panel management experts who will guide you through our processes.




You Will:

Panel Data Management: Organize, clean, and maintain panel data for analysis, including repetitive tasks that require consistent attention.
Process Improvement Collaboration: Identify repetitive tasks that could benefit from automation or optimization and support their implementation.
Support Data Quality & Validation: Maintain high data standards with automated quality checks and consistency monitoring.
Communication Support: Assist colleagues in their panel support tasks, including handling phone calls and emails.
Language Skills: Proficiency in either Swedish or Danish (knowledge of both is a plus). The official language of our company is English, and effective communication is expected. You should feel comfortable reaching out to colleagues in our expert centers across Europe.
Technical Skills: Interest in data handling, technology, and IT. Comfortable with Excel and basic knowledge of the Microsoft Suite. Familiarity with scripting/programming languages (e.g., Python, R), automation tools (e.g., Power Automate, Apache Airflow), and advanced Excel skills (e.g., macros, VBA, Power Query) would be considered a plus.
Educational Background: A bachelor’s degree in Data Management, Data Science, Automation, IT, or a related field is a strong asset, but a can-do attitude is most crucial.
Experience: Previous roles in data management, automation, software scripting or coding, or panel management is considered an advantage.




You Have:

Adaptable and Eager to Learn: Excited about evolving technologies and processes.
Tech-Savvy and Data-Driven: Enthusiastic about data, automation, and tech tools.
Detail-Oriented: Understand the importance of data accuracy and work carefully with information to solve challenges.
Independent and Solution-Oriented: Have a strong attitude towards finding solutions on your own and being self-reliant, while also knowing when to seek support from colleagues.




What We Offer:

Career Development: On-the-job training and professional development.
Full time position: a Danish employment contract with a standard 36-hour workweek
Flexible Work Environment: Hybrid work options, allowing flexibility between remote work and our new offices located in Copenhagen (Kødbyen), near the Central Station, making it easily accessible by train, including from Sweden (e.g., Malmö or Lund).
Growth Opportunities: Opportunities for advancement within the company.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to leverage data analysis to drive impactful decisions in an international organization? At KK Wind Solutions, you will enhance our business intelligence capabilities by developing, optimizing, and implementing data-driven solutions.




"You will be a key member of our team; connecting data with business operations to support decision making at both operational and strategic level," explains Kristine Nedergaard-Berntsen, Vice President, Commercial & Sales.




Develop and optimize data solutions

As our new Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a crucial role in ensuring data is accessible, accurate, and actionable. Your primary focus will be on supporting data-driven decision-making by maintaining and improving our data models, reports, and dashboards while ensuring alignment with key stakeholders and business objectives.




Specifically, you will

Act as an expert on our key customers by analyzing wind market data and insights to anticipate trends and identify opportunities. You will use this knowledge to assess wind market development and volume outlook, supporting strategic decision making.
Prepare market intelligence insights to support budget processes, ensuring forecasts accuracy and assumptions logic, based on customer and market conditions.
Work closely with a central team responsible for maintaining and developing our core data models, ensuring alignment and integration with organizational needs.
Ensure accurate retrieval, reconciliation, and analysis of commercial data by understanding table structures, tracing data origins, and addressing data quality issues.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI and Excel to support strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with team members to simplify workflows and reduce repetitive tasks by identifying opportunities to improve and automate processes, leveraging your technical skills to enhance efficiency and save time.
Ad hoc support on deeper business area analysis to understand performance and improvement opportunities.




What we are looking for

You are proactive, detail-oriented, and thrive in a collaborative environment. You have a solid data background and a natural curiosity for understanding the wind market and players, business processes and the impact of data on strategic decisions.




Moreover, you have:

A keen interest in developing your knowledge within renewable energy and the wind market.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Intelligence, Business Analytics, or a related field.
Recent graduate with strong analytics skills. If you’re still studying, and will graduate this summer, we could start up with a few days a week till graduation.
Proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Excel (including Power Query), with experience integrating these tools into workflows. Knowledge of D365 is a great plus.
Experience with SQL Server Management Studio for creating and managing custom SQL views and database relationships is beneficial, complementing your data management skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an eye for detail.
Expertise in data visualization tools, such as Power BI or Tableau.
Knowledge of DAX and advanced Excel formulas; experience with VBA is a plus.
Financial acumen or a background in economics and finance to analyze market and customer data effectively.




Why join KK Wind Solutions?

You will join a dynamic and inclusive team dedicated to innovation and customer satisfaction. We value collaboration, learning, and a growth mindset, offering a hybrid work environment that fosters work-life balance.




At KK Wind Solutions, you will have the opportunity to:

Shape how we use data to drive decisions and streamline operations.
Work in an international company focused on renewable energy and innovation.
Collaborate across departments to contribute to impactful greentech solutions.
Develop professionally in an environment that values growth, creativity, and sustainability.




Do not meet all the requirements? No worries. If you possess a can-do attitude, have a passion for data analysis, and embrace a culture of continuous learning, we would like to hear from you. We are committed to tailoring the role to fit your strengths, just as we tailor our solutions to meet our customers' demands.




Location

This role can be based in KK Wind Solutions’ offices in Hammel or Ikast, with flexibility for hybrid work.




How to apply

If you are a motivated Business Intelligence Analyst ready to make a significant impact in a growing organization, send your CV and application in English by [insert deadline]. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis, so early applications are encouraged.




Contact information

For further information, please contact: Kristine Nedergaard-Berntsen, Vice President, Commercial & Sales by mail on kribe@kkwindsolutions.com




About KK Wind Solutions

Building on more than 40 years of experience, KK Wind Solutions is a leading systems supplier to the renewable energy industry. We deliver state-of-the-art technologies, high-quality manufacturing, and flexible aftermarket services, empowering a sustainable future. Owned by A.P. Moller Holding, our diverse team of over 3,600 employees is united by a shared mission to enable renewable energy solutions.

Visit www.kkwindsolutions.com to learn more about our company and career opportunities.




Show more

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join us, be part of more.

We’re so much more than an energy company. We’re a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that’s energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn’t rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion and more potential. That’s why working here is #MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently – we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it and mend it.

About your team:

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We’re energy movers by nature. We’re a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use – powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We’re energy movers by nature. We’re a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use – powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

About the role:

The Quantitative Analytics team at Centrica Energy is part of the Trading Analytics and Algorithms centre of excellence, and is responsible for:


Delivering quantitative analysis of complex and structured products, that provides insight to help traders to maximise value and manage risk
Designing and implementing complex mathematical models that allow for consistent pricing and joint risk quantification across multiple portfolios, enabling more holistic and optimal hedging decisions
Assisting originators in development of structured products across the Renewables, LNG, Gas & Power sectors.


As a Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of an agile team of c10 people located across our offices in both London (UK) and Aalborg (Denmark).

The successful candidate will be required to:


Produce high quality increments to the team’s model library working both individually and collaboratively
Assist/advise trading and origination via quantitative analysis and a strong mathematical/financial intuition
Leverage the teams cross-asset expertise to connect business locations, helping to identify synergies and increase efficiency.


What we’re looking for:


Master’s Degree or PhD qualification within science, mathematics or other quantitative subject
Good understanding of a variety of mathematical and statistical models used in finance
Experience with derivatives pricing and risk management systems
Experience of code development (ideally Python)
Familiarity or high level of interest in Energy / commodity markets
Strong Communicator and fluent in English language
Strong interpersonal skills.


Why should you apply?

We’re not a perfect place – but we’re a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That’s why we’ve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we’re a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.

https://www.morethanacareer.energy/centricaenergy

If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.

Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.

HTML:
Copenhagen, hybrid

This role is part of our Data team in Copenhagen. At DEPT®, we combine data, technology and marketing to solve brands’ business problems and drive revenue through a variety of digital solutions.

Job Purpose

As an Analytics Consultant at DEPT®, you work with our clients on the best data setup, implement these and educate the clients in the world of Analytics. Of course this role has its challenges. The death of the cookie is near, and in this role you will consult our clients to deal with this new reality. How do they need to set up their server-side measurement? Which new products and features should we test? How can we make the best use of Consent Mode, conversion uploads and more? And GA4. The end of the session, which is changing analytics like we know it. You like to dive into these questions and want to help our clients answer them. As an Analytics Consultant, you are the absolute expert in data collection and solving complex analytics cases. You know how to create and implement measurement setups, take care of server-to-server connections between owned and marketing platforms and help clients to implement the best data collection setup.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and configure tag management systems (eg. GTM) to ensure accurate data collection;
  • Develop measurement plans in collaboration with clients;
  • Troubleshoot and fix data discrepancies & tracking issues;
  • Conduct audits of data collection setups;
  • Collaborate with development teams to develop and maintain tracking across digital platforms;
  • Use data visualisation tools (eg. Looker Studio, Power BI) to present data in an easily understandable format;
  • Consult with clients and help them take their analytics setup to the next level.


What We Are Looking For

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data role, preferably at agency side;
  • Hands-on experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager;
  • Are proficient in Javascript;
  • Maybe you don't have the technical skills yet, but are eager to learn more about SQL, Python and Cloud;
  • Full working proficiency in the English language - spoken and written (proficiency in Danish is considered a plus, not a requirement);
  • Somebody who can switch from serious to play in a heartbeat;
  • An analytical, technical, independent profile with good communication skills.


WE OFFER

  • A healthy, varied and delicious lunch at the office;
  • A lot of fun social events such as Friday bars, company parties, team events, etc.;
  • A flexible, hybrid working policy and a great workplace in our awesome office in Christianshavn;
  • A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards;
  • Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries;
  • The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training and development;
  • Stay happy and healthy with a contribution to your health through the OpenUp platform, gym and wellness discounts, and healthy lunches at the office;
  • Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.


WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.

Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients problems, no matter where you are in the world.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Hvidovre Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer / Analytics Engineer




NTG Nordic Transport Group (NTG)

NTG is listed on Nasdaq OMX Nordic and is one of the fastest-growing freight forwarders in Europe. Since the Group’s foundation in Denmark in 2011, our unique partnering-model has successfully expanded NTG to a revenue of more than DKK 8 billion in 2023, presence in +30 countries and ~100 companies. Our culture is characterized as entrepreneurial, trusting, and accountable.




The Position

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer or Analytics Engineer to join our newly established BI team at our Global Headquarters in Hvidovre (Copenhagen), Denmark. Your main responsibilities will be:

· Develop and maintain our Data Warehouse platform

· Build and maintain data ingestion pipelines in DBT

· Design and create Analytics Models for consumption in PowerBI

· Collaborate with business users to create concise and meaningful data assets that fit our platform architecture

· Advise on the design, and optimization of our data storage solutions, ensuring best practices are followed and influencing the strategic direction of our Data Warehouse.

You will work closely with our Head of Group Business Intelligence to support our broader organization within IT, Finance and operations.




The Candidate

· Possess a strong analytical mindset

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team

· Solid communication and collaboration skills

· Previous experience with solutions like Snowflake, Databricks hosted on one of the big cloud providers (Azure, AWS or GCP)

· Proficiency with Python, SQL, dbt

· Data modelling and schema design for relational databases

· Fluent in English (Danish is a plus)

· Experience with PowerBI is a plus




How do I apply?

If you would like to join our team, apply for the position by clicking the button below. We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

We hope we got your attention and look forward to receiving your application!

Show more

Title: 4x IT Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company: BluEdge
Max Price rate (SEK/h): Open to Bid
Location: Copenhagen (DK)
Start date: 2025-02-18
End date (renewable): 2025-02-28


We are currently seeking 4 IT Analysts to join our Core Banking program team.

Responsibilities

The primary objective of the program is to transition from old local legacy systems to a unified Nordic core banking program and establish an Agreement Directory Service. The ideal candidates should be capable to contribute to the team responsible for building the Common Booking Component. They will be responsible for gathering requirements from business stakeholders and documenting them in the form of features and user stories. They should be capable of independently driving the requirements process, from collection and documentation to handover to developers. The role requires the ability to operate in a complex environment with multiple stakeholders and dependencies. Familiarity with tasks such as data mapping and data governance is essential.

Requirements


Professional knowledge of data mapping and data governance
Experience in the banking sector, preferably within a larger bank.
Extensive knowledge in the accounting area.
Extensive experience as a senior Business analyst and/or senior IT analyst.
Previous experience in a larger program with approximately 300+ employees.
Experience in a Nordic bank is advantageous.


Required Skills


IT Governance
Mapping
Business Analyst
IT Analyst


Languages


English (Proficient)


Start-date: ASAP

End-date: 28-02-2025

Location: Denmark, Nordics
