Title: Business Analyst in Data Management
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about transforming ideas into digital solutions? Do you enjoy working with data, optimizing processes, and collaborating across teams? We are looking for a driven and analytical professional to join our digitalization team within Primeserv Denmark. You will play a key role in structuring and managing digitalization initiatives, ensuring that we turn complex requests into actionable solutions that improve our business.

You Will Play An Important Role In

In this role, you will be at the center of our digitalization efforts, taking ideas from across the organization and transforming them into structured projects. You will act as a bridge between business needs and technical implementation, ensuring that digital solutions align with strategic goals and deliver real value. This will include


Concept Development – Work closely with stakeholders across the 800-person organization to refine requests into concrete digital concepts.
Backlog Management – Oversee the development backlog together with the department manager, the team and other stakeholders.
Stakeholder Engagement & Problem-Solving – Collaborate with frontline employees to fully understand business challenges and translate them into technical requirements for our developers.
Cross-Border Project Coordination – Establish and maintain an overview of projects running across multiple locations, ensuring structured execution and progress.
Solution Handover & Implementation – Once solutions are matured, facilitate a smooth handover to project managers and development resources for implementation.
Process Documentation & Communication – Ensure clarity by documenting processes, decisions, and best practices to enhance efficiency and knowledge sharing.


We Imagine That You

To succeed in this role, you should have a strong foundation in both technical and analytical skills, combined with a keen ability to engage with stakeholders and drive digitalization initiatives forward. We are looking for someone who can independently navigate complex challenges and contribute innovative solutions to our team. This could include:


A university degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Engineering, IT, Data Science, or similar).
Strong analytical and technical skills with the ability to translate business needs into digital solutions.
Experience or strong interest in digitalization, process improvement, and data-driven decision-making.
Comfortable communicating with stakeholders at all levels, gathering requirements, and presenting solutions.
Highly independent and proactive, with the ability to generate ideas and drive progress.


Welcome to Data Management

In Data Management, we are a diverse team of 15 colleagues and 7 students from 11 different countries, all passionate about digitalization and finding smart solutions to tough challenges. We also collaborate closely with our team in Greece to drive common projects forward. Our work spans across the Danish after-sales organization, where we help implement new and improved ways of working.

Teamwork is our superpower—we support each other by leveraging our different strengths, always striving to find the best solutions together. While we have a strong sense of collaboration, we also value independence, as each of us takes responsibility for different areas within our organization. If you enjoy working in an international and dynamic environment, where innovation and problem-solving are at the core of what we do, you’ll fit right in!

What Can You Expect From Us

We believe in fostering an environment where innovation and collaboration thrive. Here’s what you can expect when joining our team:


A dynamic and international work environment with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.
The opportunity to work with cutting-edge digitalization initiatives, including AI, process automation, and data-driven solutions.
A supportive team that values knowledge sharing and professional growth.
The ability to make a real impact by shaping digital solutions that improve efficiency and business processes.
A strong culture of teamwork, independence, and problem-solving.


Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

At MAN Energy Solutions, we offer you an opportunity to shape the future while achieving your career goals.

We understand that balancing work life and personal life can be a challenge. This is why we prioritize providing our employees with the best opportunities to achieve this balance. In addition to flexible working hours, the option to work from home, and a focus on brain breaks during the day, we also offer over 7 weeks of paid time off distributed across vacation days, extra days off, and flex days.

We focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture and believe that a mix of gender, nationalities, and different perspectives, drives innovation, creativity, and productivity in our organization. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will get the opportunity to join different social activities clubs from yoga and fishing clubs to creative clubs.

At MAN Energy Solutions you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions while achieving your personal career goals. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship. 

In 2027, MAN Energy Solutions will move to Trekroner in Roskilde. Here we will consolidate all our current locations on Zealand into one large site.

About MAN Energy Solutions


250 years of experience in advanced engineering
We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe
We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy
We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are 2,200 passionate employees with more than 40 nationalities


Build your own future

Please submit your application to us no later than Friday the 7th of March 2025. We will conduct interviews during the application period. When we have received enough relevant applications the advertisement will be closed. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Ingi Helgason, Head of Data Management by phone +45 23701492. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com .

Relocating to Denmark is a major step for our new international colleagues. To support this transition, we offer several initiatives, including Spouse Days to help build a strong cross-cultural network within MAN Energy Solutions, as well as Danish language courses based on individual proficiency levels. Furthermore, we offer intercultural training tailored to the countries and regions we collaborate with, as well as global mindset training for all employees and managers. This is to promote a collaborative and inclusive work environment. Our mobility package also includes assistance with obtaining a Danish CPR number, tax information, and work permits.

At MAN Energy Solutions, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: Junior Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a passion for Sports & Outdoor?

Do you know how to adapt to a challenging environment?

Do you love finding ways to make complex processes simpler through data?

Apply now and become part of our great team at DANISH ENDURANCE®!

We are looking for a talented and ambitious Junior Analytics Engineer to contribute to the continuous development and growth of our brand of endurance and outdoor gear.

Who is DANISH ENDURANCE®?

DANISH ENDURANCE® is a global endurance & outdoor brand within e-commerce. With a focus on Danish design and sustainable manufacturing in Europe and Asia, we are a young high-growth company, with a flat structure and a friendly, dynamic working environment. We are a truly international team consisting of 60 professionals with 25 different nationalities based in Copenhagen at Holmen and Gramrode near Horsens.

We have a scalable and unique business model, our ambitions are rocket-high, and we strongly believe that everything is possible. That is why we need you!

What can you expect from the job?

As Our Junior Analytics Engineer, You Will


Build and maintain data models and ETL pipelines
Create dashboards and automated reports
Support financial processes including VAT reporting and month-end closing
Perform regular data analytics and ad-hoc analysis
Drive process optimization and automation initiatives
Ensure data quality and maintain documentation
Participate in ML/AI projects


What do we expect from you?


Transform complex business requirements into efficient technical solutions
Build and optimize SQL models for various reporting needs
Optimize and automate reporting processes
Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement solutions
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Take ownership of assigned projects and deliver high-quality results


Qualifications


Degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field
Strong SQL modelling and data warehouse knowledge
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools
Understanding of basic financial concepts
Experience with dbt and version control is an advantage
Experience with Python
Business process optimization experience
Passion for sports is a bonus


Additional Facts

Weekly working hours: Full time

Location: Copenhagen Holmen, at Talent Garden Rainmaking

Deadline: We will review applications on an ongoing basis, the sooner you apply, the better

Start date: As soon as possible

How To Apply

Feel free to contact Elias Fischer in case you have any questions

One applications via the Hub will be considered.

Read more about DANISH ENDURANCE® at www.danishendurance.com

KEEP YOUR PERSONAL DATA SAFE

Danish Endurance take responsibly for the protection of your personal data. Accordingly, upon receiving your job application and additional material you choose to submit, we keep it in a safe and secure environment and ensures confidentiality.

You also have a role to play in keeping your personal data safe. We request you only submit personal data about yourself in your job application, CV or other relevant material you choose to provide to us that is relevant for the specific position you are applying for.

(Please consider whether there is personal information you are about to submit, such as health information, that is not necessary for our recruitment process or the position you are applying for. Please also be aware of certificates or other documents that are not necessary for the vacancy.

Title: Jr. Data Engineer
Description:
The Job

We are looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join us at HelloFresh Nordics. Working in the Operations Tech team, you will support the design, build, and maintenance of data-driven solutions that impact our daily operations. Working closely with experienced team members, you’ll help develop reliable data pipelines, internal applications, and infrastructure—all while growing your technical skills and operational understanding.


This role is in-office at our Nordic HQ at Islands Brygge, Copenhagen.
You’ll join a close-knit team of four engineers, one student assistant, and a Technical Product Manager.
We value innovation, mutual respect, and personal growth in an inclusive environment.


If you’re excited by the prospect of working in a code-first, fast-moving environment—while ensuring the highest level of quality and reliability—then we’d love to hear from you!

You will…


Design, build, and maintain data pipelines using Databricks or Airflow on Kubernetes.
Develop and deploy Streamlit applications, backed by Postgres, to streamline operational workflows.
Write clean, efficient, and well-tested Python code, building a strong foundation in software best practices.
Learn and contribute to managing infrastructure using Terraform and configuring CI/CD pipelines via GitHub Workflows.
Gain exposure to AWS services (e.g., S3 and Glue) for data storage and transformation.
Work with cross-functional teams (e.g., logistics, procurement, production) to understand requirements and support operational systems.
Help monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines and internal apps to ensure smooth operations.
Contribute to an agile, detail-oriented culture, balancing speed with the need for robust and dependable operational systems.


You have…


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or an Engineering field related to Operations / Supply Chain.
Proficiency in Python with a focus on writing maintainable, testable code.
Relevant internships or academic projects demonstrating hands-on work with data engineering or software development are a strong plus.
Good knowledge of SQL and familiarity with relational databases is a plus.
Basic understanding of orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow) and containerized environments (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker) is a plus.
An interest in learning about AWS services and Infrastructure as Code tools (e.g., Terraform) along with CI/CD processes.
Knowledge of operations and supply chain management is a plus.
Good communication skills in English, a proactive attitude, and the ability to work collaboratively with both technical and non-technical teams.
A keen eye for ensuring operational stability in a fast-paced environment.


We offer…


A diverse and vibrant international environment of 35+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box or Factor_ meals
Annual learning and development budget to grow and develop your skills
Subsidized healthy lunches everyday in our Copenhagen office
Mental health resources through online subscriptions
Monthly pension scheme including health insurance benefits
Additional perks: Discounts for our neighboring gyms, company events and parties, fruit & snacks in the office and free Friday bar


Are you up for a challenge?


Apply with your CV (In English please)
If we see a match, you’ll have a call with one of our recruiters to share more about what you can bring to the team
Are both sides still positive? Then we proceed to the assessment stage to assess key skills required for the job
We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and will close down the position once the successful candidate has been found.


15316
Show more
HTML:
The Job

We are looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join us at HelloFresh Nordics. Working in the Operations Tech team, you will support the design, build, and maintenance of data-driven solutions that impact our daily operations. Working closely with experienced team members, you’ll help develop reliable data pipelines, internal applications, and infrastructure—all while growing your technical skills and operational understanding.

  • This role is in-office at our Nordic HQ at Islands Brygge, Copenhagen.
  • You’ll join a close-knit team of four engineers, one student assistant, and a Technical Product Manager.
  • We value innovation, mutual respect, and personal growth in an inclusive environment.

If you’re excited by the prospect of working in a code-first, fast-moving environment—while ensuring the highest level of quality and reliability—then we’d love to hear from you!

You will…

  • Design, build, and maintain data pipelines using Databricks or Airflow on Kubernetes.
  • Develop and deploy Streamlit applications, backed by Postgres, to streamline operational workflows.
  • Write clean, efficient, and well-tested Python code, building a strong foundation in software best practices.
  • Learn and contribute to managing infrastructure using Terraform and configuring CI/CD pipelines via GitHub Workflows.
  • Gain exposure to AWS services (e.g., S3 and Glue) for data storage and transformation.
  • Work with cross-functional teams (e.g., logistics, procurement, production) to understand requirements and support operational systems.
  • Help monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines and internal apps to ensure smooth operations.
  • Contribute to an agile, detail-oriented culture, balancing speed with the need for robust and dependable operational systems.

You have…

  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or an Engineering field related to Operations / Supply Chain.
  • Proficiency in Python with a focus on writing maintainable, testable code.
  • Relevant internships or academic projects demonstrating hands-on work with data engineering or software development are a strong plus.
  • Good knowledge of SQL and familiarity with relational databases is a plus.
  • Basic understanding of orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow) and containerized environments (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker) is a plus.
  • An interest in learning about AWS services and Infrastructure as Code tools (e.g., Terraform) along with CI/CD processes.
  • Knowledge of operations and supply chain management is a plus.
  • Good communication skills in English, a proactive attitude, and the ability to work collaboratively with both technical and non-technical teams.
  • A keen eye for ensuring operational stability in a fast-paced environment.

We offer…

  • A diverse and vibrant international environment of 35+ different nationalities
  • The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe
  • A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box or Factor_ meals
  • Annual learning and development budget to grow and develop your skills
  • Subsidized healthy lunches everyday in our Copenhagen office
  • Mental health resources through online subscriptions
  • Monthly pension scheme including health insurance benefits
  • Additional perks: Discounts for our neighboring gyms, company events and parties, fruit & snacks in the office and free Friday bar

Are you up for a challenge?

  • Apply with your CV (In English please)
  • If we see a match, you’ll have a call with one of our recruiters to share more about what you can bring to the team
  • Are both sides still positive? Then we proceed to the assessment stage to assess key skills required for the job
  • We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and will close down the position once the successful candidate has been found.

15316

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses samt laver MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi arbejder med en række spændende teknologier, herunder Databricks, Fabric, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory, Azure Synapse og Spark, og laver ikke bare dataudtræk, men bygger ting, der skal i Prod. Vi leder derfor efter flere profiler med erfaring indenfor enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som har lyst til at bygge dataløsninger for vores kunder.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. Cvation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datamigrerings- og datamoderniseringsprojekter
rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i data engineering, data science, Human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring og kan skrive Python - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme. Vi skal nok lære dig det, du mangler på Azure, IaC, MLOps etc.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Infrastructure as code er måden du arbejder på, f.eks. Bicep eller Terraform
Du har erfaring med nogle - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Spark - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Senior Consultant - Data & Process Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

Celonis Services is a strategic services organisation that focuses on the technical aspects of our customers' journeys, which includes Consulting Services, Academy and Customer Support. We are thought leaders with deep product, technical and domain expertise and focus on delivering Celonis implementations and driving product adoption for our customers. We achieve this by bringing together our best practices, delivery experience, award-winning enablement and support expertise.

The Role:

As a Senior Consultant, you will accelerate our customers’ digital transformation and drive Celonis’ international expansion. You identify our customers’ strategic priorities and develop data-driven process insights using SQL and create complex data models to ensure that customers receive maximum value. You will become an expert in all kinds of company processes such as Finance, Order Management, Procurement, Warehouse Management, Customer Service, Production, e-Commerce, Opportunity Management, Supply Chain Management. You leverage the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Analytics, Process Automation, Task Mining and Machine Learning.

The work you’ll do:


Lead and drive the implementation process while delivering exceptionally high levels of service to ensure the optimal solution for our customers with our Celonis technology
Transform the customer’s data using SQL to create the data model for your process analysis
Design and implement innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms or Task Mining to make the customer’s processes transparent and automated
Analyze the data to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes to jointly suggest approaches to overcome them
Quantify the business and financial potential and present the most relevant KPIs to the management
Translate business requirements into technical specifications
Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies
Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen


The qualifications you need:


Min. 3 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement or a similar area
Proficiency with SQL or other programming languages (Python, R, Matlab...) and a strong interest in Big Data, Data Mining, and Process Mining
Strong communication skills in English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining technology forward
Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner


Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program

What Celonis Can Offer You:


The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


About Us:

Celonis helps some of the world’s largest and most esteemed brands make processes work for people, companies and the planet. With over 5,000 enterprise customer deployments across nearly every industry, the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses process mining and AI to give you a living digital twin of your business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and empowers companies to reduce waste, create value and benefit people across the top, bottom, and green lines. Since 2011, the Celonis platform has enabled its customers to identify more than $18 billion in value. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Data Privacy, Equal Opportunity, and Accessibility Information

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws. As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. Different makes us better.

Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’ Statements on Data Privacy, Equal Opportunity and Accessibility.

Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.

Title: Principal Statistician
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Principal Statistician




Are you a skilled statistician looking to make a significant impact in biometrics?




Our client, a small-sized CRO specialized in statistics and data management, is seeking a talented Statistician to join their dedicated team.




Our client specializes in top-tier biometric services, including statistical consulting, data mapping, clinical data management, and data monitoring committee services. Their commitment to excellence and innovation has established them as a trusted partner in the industry.




Key Responsibilities:




Developing methods for gathering data from multiple sources.
Ensuring data accuracy and creating necessary documentation.
Managing projects, including stakeholder relationships.
Occasionally serving in a supervisory capacity for sponsors.




Why join the team?




Professional Growth: Be part of a small, dedicated team with a flat organizational structure, offering ample room for personal and professional development.
Work-Life Balance: Offering a 4-day, 30 hours, work week, they value work-life balance, ensuring a flexible work environment where teamwork and personal well-being go hand-in-hand.
Collaborative Culture: They prioritize chemistry and the desire to be part of a close-knit group of colleagues, welcoming both new and experienced candidates.







If you're ready to contribute to meaningful projects and grow with a company that values expertise and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Show more

  • Ensuring data accuracy and creating necessary documentation.
  • Managing projects, including stakeholder relationships.
  • Occasionally serving in a supervisory capacity for sponsors.


Why join the team?


  • Professional Growth: Be part of a small, dedicated team with a flat organizational structure, offering ample room for personal and professional development.
  • Work-Life Balance: Offering a 4-day, 30 hours, work week, they value work-life balance, ensuring a flexible work environment where teamwork and personal well-being go hand-in-hand.
  • Collaborative Culture: They prioritize chemistry and the desire to be part of a close-knit group of colleagues, welcoming both new and experienced candidates.



If you're ready to contribute to meaningful projects and grow with a company that values expertise and collaboration, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Commercial Business Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

We are looking for a proactive and results-oriented Commercial Business Analyst to join our Digital Activation Analytics team under Group Commercial at Saxo Bank. In this role, you will play a key part in analyzing data to understand customer needs and suggesting improvements based on your findings as well as understanding and optimizing the impact of our TREA inspirational content, measuring what content strategies work and for which clients.

The ideal candidate will need to have a strong background in commercial operations, data analysis and cross-functional collaboration.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze data to identify trends and insights that can help improve our products and services.
Create and maintain dashboards to visualize data and track performance.
Track our digital engagement efforts such as how TREA inspirational content is impacting key KPIs: %Clients Active, %Multi-Asset and %NFC->NTC.
Identify, define, and quantify clients’ needs. Develop and maintain global and local “client buckets” clustering clients in similar situations and similar needs.
Collaborate with cross functional teams and local offices to identify successful strategies and areas for improvement. Share best practices and drive continuous improvement across all locations
Proactively suggest solutions based on data analysis to meet customer needs.
Identify which of our products, solutions and services address persona buckets’ needs in the most commercially viable way
Contribute to the strategy and advocate for automation of processes and tooling improvements.
Promote the adoption of a data-driven mindset and the benefits of A/B testing by educating our local offices and internal stakeholders.


Ideal Candidate


Experience in a commercial or business development role, preferably in a global context
Excellent skills in creating dashboards and visualizing data to support decision making
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and multiple offices
Excellent collaboration and communication skills
Proactive and results-oriented mindset.
Familiarity with statistics and econometrics.
Experience with performance tracking and dashboard management
Knowledge of SQL, Power BI, Databricks, Adobe CDP, or Adobe Journey Optimizer is a plus.


Why Join Us

At Saxo Bank, we value innovation, collaboration, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Join our team and help us shape the future of finance by providing valuable insights and solutions based on data.

Does this look good to you? Is there anything else you would like to add or change?

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!

Title: Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Student Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re searching for a Student Analyst to join our Commercial team based in Copenhagen Denmark!




About PureGym:




Founded in 2009, the PureGym Group is one of the largest gym operators in Europe and provides high-quality, low-cost fitness facilities. The Group has more than 2million members across 500+ gyms and holds market leading positions across the UK, Denmark and Switzerland. By providing quality gyms at affordable prices, and where everybody is welcome, we help more people in more places live healthier lives.




The Role




PureGym is looking for a Student Analyst (approx. 15-20 hours per week) to play a key role in supporting the business in making data-led commercial decisions. The essence of the role is to conduct performance tracking for us to spot and react to developments in a timely manner and to conduct ad hoc analyses to answer questions related to strategic or operational opportunities.




The Commercial Analyst will be part of a small but highly capable Commercial Management team, located in PureGym DK’s headquarters in Valby. However, you will be a part of the overall Group, which covers PureGym businesses in DK, UK and CH and a number of franchises around the world.

Therefore, the Student Analyst will have a broad interaction with colleagues from all functional areas as well as across different geographies.




Key Responsibilities:




The Student Analyst will have a leading role in the following:




Recurring performance reviews: Carry out recurring performance reviews, commenting on findings and trends
Commercial analysis: Support decision-making in the organization by conducting and presenting ad hoc analysis on business challenges
Price management: Support in generating overviews of prices, changes to member privileges and the associated performance
Execution of changes: Liaise with other teams (mainly IT, Marketing, Operations) to conduct tests to optimize commercial model/mechanisms and implement the resultant changes
Competitor analysis: Track trends in the industry and our competitive landscape




The Person




We are looking for an ambitious individual with the following core attributes:




Curious and driven: You constantly seek to learn and find new and better ways of doing things; not just solving problems but actively looking for how to improve any given situation
Love data crunching: You thrive working with large and complex data sets, finding the underlying patterns and insights
Highly structured: You enjoy bringing order to chaos and have an eye for detail – you probably like to organize your bookshelf by size or alphabet.
Operational mindset: You take pride in having a specific area of responsibility and working continuously on improving and executing this area over time.




The ideal candidate has the following qualifications:




At least one year left of study, preferably within an analytical area
Ideally has previous working experience from a full-time position, another student job or internship
Strong business acumen and a solid methodological toolkit from your studies, capable of reflecting and advising on the best approach from case to case
Ability to work with various data sources, ranging from BI data over surveys to more qualitative data
Experienced in Excel, working quickly and efficiency with all the main formulas
Speak and write English fluently
Ability to work on Mondays would be appreciated but not a necessity




Our Values




Make a difference. Excite and inspire others. ‘Own it’ and be the best we can be.

Stand Shoulder to Shoulder. Collaborate and share with each other. Include everyone and embrace uniqueness.

Focus on the detail. Care about the little things. Have determination and resilience to get the job done.

Play to Win. Improve and innovate – never get complacent. Challenge ourselves and each other. Celebrate our success.




** Please apply with your CV in English **




PureGym is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Our company mantra is ‘Everybody Welcome’ and we are dedicated to promoting a diverse and inclusive place to work. From a hiring standpoint, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to ensuring that our PureGym colleagues reflect the diversity of the nation as well as our millions of gym members we serve.




#LI-DNI

Title: Register in our candidate data base
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Still interested? Join us at Veo and become a part of a team that delivers greatness and has a great time doing it.

We will invite for interviews continuously, so apply with LinkedIn or your resume as soon as possible.

Title: Praktikant, Data Intelligence
Description:
Interesserer du dig for arbejdet med data transformation, cloud computing samt data science, og leder du efter et spændende internship i et ambitiøst bureau?

Så er det os, du skal søge hos!

Bliv en del af Data Intelligence-teamet og få erfaring med at arbejde med data på nye og innovative måder – alt sammen med fokus på at skabe værdi for kunderne gennem intelligent brug af data.

Konkret Vil Du Komme Til At Arbejde Med


Opsætning af Cloud-miljøer i f.eks. Google Cloud Platform
Data transformering og analyse af data i SQL, Dataform og Python
Udvikling af business cases og visualisering af data i førende BI-platforme såsom Retool, Power BI og Looker
Håndtering af dataorkestrering, integration med API’er og Cloud Functions
Brug af data science til at løse komplekse problemstillinger, f.eks. forecasting, clustering og predictions


Som praktikant i s360 bliver du en del af en kultur gennemsyret af et højt ambitionsniveau, ekspertise og fællesskab!

Vi kan med overbevisning sige, at vi lever vores værdier Down to earth, To the point, Eager to improve og Act with integrity. Vi har en flad organisationsstruktur, afholder vidensdelingssessioner på tværs af afdelinger og kontorer, opfordrer altid til konstruktiv feedback, og så er vi frontløbere inden for tech og AI.

I løbet af året afholder vi flere sociale arrangementer såsom fredagsbarer og sportsturneringer. I løbet af praktikperioden er der rig mulighed for at skabe et stærkt professionelt og socialt netværk med kolleger og de andre Interns gennem velkomstmiddagen, løbende check-in sessioner, fælles frokoster og fredagsøl på tagterrassen.

"Som praktikant i Data Intelligence får du et stort indblik i, hvor mange muligheder der er, når man arbejder med data. Du kommer til at sidde med alt fra kode og modellering til flotte visualiseringer, som skaber en fortælling omkring dataen" - Louise Ellegaard, tidligere Intern og nu Assistant i Data Intelligence.

Alt dette er med til at gøre os stolte af vores kultur.

Det praktiske om dig

Du Er En Af Dem, Dine Medstuderende Betegner Som Ambitiøs, Og Så Ønsker Du At Sætte Dit Præg På Et Af Nordens Mest Ambitiøse Digitale Marketingbureauer. Derudover Er Du


I gang med en relevant videregående uddannelse, f.eks. fra BSS, Aarhus Universitet, Erhvervsakademi Aarhus eller lignende
Flydende i mundtlig og skriftlig dansk samt behersker engelsk på højt niveau
Nede på jorden og ser stor værdi i at samarbejde


Det praktiske om dit internship


Praktikperioden løber fra midten af august til midten af december 2025
Ulønnet fuldtidsstilling på 37 timer. Med i din praktikstilling får du selvfølgelig frokost samt te, kaffe og frugt ad libitum (oftest er der også god kage at finde på kontorerne)
Du bliver en del af et praktikhold med praktikanter fra forskellige afdelinger i s360. Gennem både sociale og faglige events, er der god mulighed for at dele erfaringer og netværke på tværs af teams.


Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Har du spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte Director & Team Lead, Thomas Aba på +45 30149737 eller [email protected]. Du kan også læse meget mere om vores praktikforløb her.

Hvem er s360?

s360 er et førende digitalt marketingbureau i Europa, der hjælper brands og detailhandlere med at vokse ved at levere et solidt teknologisk fundament, topkvalitets eksekvering og dyb brancheekspertise. Med mere end 320 digitale specialister har s360 kontorer i ti byer fordelt på syv europæiske lande: Danmark, Norge, Sverige, Finland, Holland, Storbritannien og Spanien. I de seneste år har s360 modtaget flere nationale og europæiske branchepriser, og er derfor et af Europas mest prisvindende digitale marketingbureauer.

  • Flydende i mundtlig og skriftlig dansk samt behersker engelsk på højt niveau
  • Nede på jorden og ser stor værdi i at samarbejde

Det praktiske om dit internship

  • Praktikperioden løber fra midten af august til midten af december 2025
  • Ulønnet fuldtidsstilling på 37 timer. Med i din praktikstilling får du selvfølgelig frokost samt te, kaffe og frugt ad libitum (oftest er der også god kage at finde på kontorerne)
  • Du bliver en del af et praktikhold med praktikanter fra forskellige afdelinger i s360. Gennem både sociale og faglige events, er der god mulighed for at dele erfaringer og netværke på tværs af teams.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Har du spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte Director & Team Lead, Thomas Aba på +45 30149737 eller [email protected]. Du kan også læse meget mere om vores praktikforløb her.

Hvem er s360?

s360 er et førende digitalt marketingbureau i Europa, der hjælper brands og detailhandlere med at vokse ved at levere et solidt teknologisk fundament, topkvalitets eksekvering og dyb brancheekspertise. Med mere end 320 digitale specialister har s360 kontorer i ti byer fordelt på syv europæiske lande: Danmark, Norge, Sverige, Finland, Holland, Storbritannien og Spanien. I de seneste år har s360 modtaget flere nationale og europæiske branchepriser, og er derfor et af Europas mest prisvindende digitale marketingbureauer.

Title: Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Lead Data/IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 24876

At Nordea, we know our stakeholder needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating a new cloud environment where we’re harnessing the power of near real time data – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you’ll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea´s target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:


Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team


Your experience and background:


Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/03/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.
Show more

Title: Azure løsningsarkitekt
Description:
Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?




Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt




Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.




Andre ansvarsområder:

Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen




Dine kompetencer:

5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter




Om dig:

Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater




En hos Crayon Danmark betyder også;

at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse på hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
at arbejdstiden følger ’the new normal policy’, som er 2-3 dage på kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra – vi er fleksible
at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i køleskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om året – vi holder altid nogle gode fester




Crayon har positioneret sig som Nordens førende indenfor Cloud-services, Software Asset Management og salg af software. Vores specialister leverer skræddersyende løsninger indenfor softwareleverandørstyring på tværs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. – altså nogle af de største navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en børsnoteret koncern, som globalt beskæftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere på vores kontorer på tværs af landegrænserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt på 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i Søborg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.




Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk miljø, hvor vi har en meget åben og hjælpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er stærkt drevet af at gøre en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer – og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

Der er aldrig en typisk dag hos Crayon, vores DNA er noget helt særligt – og det er det vi elsker ved at være medarbejdere i Crayon.




At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.




If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.

Title: Data Engineer/ETL
Description:
We are looking for Data Engineer/ETL for our client in the banking industry. You will be responsible for optimizing data workflows, writing efficient scripting code e.g. bash, python and SQL, and manage both on prem and cloud-based hybrid infrastructure.




Location: Greater Copenhagen area, hybrid.




QUALIFICATIONS & COMPETENCIES

Proficient in designing OLAP system and using techniques like STAR schema or denormalization
Python & PLSQL Proficiency
ELT/ETL development using GUI-based tool e.g. IBM Datastage, ADF, Stitch, Matillion
Database Management, Oracle, MSSQL, Snowflake
DevOps & CI/CD understanding of Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD pipeline development tool e.g. Jenkins, Bamboo, Azure DevOps
Experience with test automation e.g. Robot, Selenium and understand the different test scenarios
Understanding version control technique Git, GitHub, GitLab
Workflow Orchestration e.g. Airflow & Prefect
Streaming & Batch processing knowledge involving Kafka
Distributed and parallel Computing solution e.g. Spark, Flink or Dask
Data governance & security implementation RBAC, GDPR, HIPAA compliance
Experience from the banking industry, preferred
Professional level of English - both oral and written
Valid EU work permit making you able to start working right away




AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY

Design, build and maintain scalable ELT pipeline
Develop and optimize PLSQL queries and database objects for high performance data storage in Oracle
Write python-based data engineering scripts to process data
Implement CI/CD pipelines for data infrastructure and workflow automation
Understand and have experience of database change management
Work one or more of the major cloud vendor
Integrate and manage modern data stack
Monitor, debug and optimize data workflows and infrastructure performance
Ensure data quality, governance, and compliance with good practices




INTERESTED?

If you have questions about the position, please contact us on:

denmark@rdtengineers.com or call Thomas Sindahl at (+45) 28343536

The position will be closed when we have found the right candidate, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Notice only your CV in English is necessary.




Passionate about Engineering - RDT

At RDT, our primary focus is our PEOPLE. We support our employees in professional and individual development. With our flat hierarchy, commitment and values, which inspire them to do their best. We pursue our PEOPLE’s work satisfaction and can guarantee highest quality, which leads to our second mission – our CLIENTS. We, our PEOPLE, provide engineering solutions that enable our customers to have a competitive advantage in efficiency, flexibility and costs.

Thanks to our PEOPLE, we have supplied the best engineering services since 2007 and offer the best and most flexible terms in the market for engineering services.

Be part of our missions and join RDT in Denmark.

Show more

  • ELT/ETL development using GUI-based tool e.g. IBM Datastage, ADF, Stitch, Matillion
  • Database Management, Oracle, MSSQL, Snowflake
  • DevOps & CI/CD understanding of Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD pipeline development tool e.g. Jenkins, Bamboo, Azure DevOps
  • Experience with test automation e.g. Robot, Selenium and understand the different test scenarios
  • Understanding version control technique Git, GitHub, GitLab
  • Workflow Orchestration e.g. Airflow & Prefect
  • Streaming & Batch processing knowledge involving Kafka
  • Distributed and parallel Computing solution e.g. Spark, Flink or Dask
  • Data governance & security implementation RBAC, GDPR, HIPAA compliance
  • Experience from the banking industry, preferred
  • Professional level of English - both oral and written
  • Valid EU work permit making you able to start working right away


AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY

  • Design, build and maintain scalable ELT pipeline
  • Develop and optimize PLSQL queries and database objects for high performance data storage in Oracle
  • Write python-based data engineering scripts to process data
  • Implement CI/CD pipelines for data infrastructure and workflow automation
  • Understand and have experience of database change management
  • Work one or more of the major cloud vendor
  • Integrate and manage modern data stack
  • Monitor, debug and optimize data workflows and infrastructure performance
  • Ensure data quality, governance, and compliance with good practices


INTERESTED?

If you have questions about the position, please contact us on:

denmark@rdtengineers.com or call Thomas Sindahl at (+45) 28343536

The position will be closed when we have found the right candidate, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Notice only your CV in English is necessary.


Passionate about Engineering - RDT

At RDT, our primary focus is our PEOPLE. We support our employees in professional and individual development. With our flat hierarchy, commitment and values, which inspire them to do their best. We pursue our PEOPLE’s work satisfaction and can guarantee highest quality, which leads to our second mission – our CLIENTS. We, our PEOPLE, provide engineering solutions that enable our customers to have a competitive advantage in efficiency, flexibility and costs.

Thanks to our PEOPLE, we have supplied the best engineering services since 2007 and offer the best and most flexible terms in the market for engineering services.

Be part of our missions and join RDT in Denmark.

Title: Web Analyst Intern
Description:
Are you eager to learn about and work with the latest technology in web analytics within an international company operating across 28 markets?




If yes, we are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Web Analyst Intern to join our UX and Insights team.




JYSK is in constant growth, and the same applies to our UX and Insights department. We have an increasing strategic focus on online data and insights and are always looking for new talents.




WHAT WE OFFER YOU

As a Web Analyst Intern, you will get a unique opportunity to develop your analytical skills and gain hands-on experience with advanced web analytics tools – primarily Google Analytics 4 (GA4).




In the Autumn of 2025, we offer a 4-6 months internship, where you will become an integral part of our UX and Insights team. Our expert in web analytics and data tracking will guide you and share their methodologies, helping you grow into a skilled web analyst.




You will have the chance to work independently on your own projects and contribute to the development of data-driven insights.




WHAT YOUR INTERNSHIP WILL BE ABOUT

Your tasks and responsibilities will include:

analysing user behavior and traffic data to optimize conversions and online performance
preparing reports that provide insights into our online performance
collaborating with internal teams on data analysis projects
identifying opportunities to improve our digital customer experience based on data




You can read more about our department here.




WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING

We are looking for an intern who:

is currently studying E-commerce, IT, Business Analytics, or related fields
has a strong interest in web analytics and digital user data, particularly with a focus on GA4
works independently and thrives in a dynamic and busy work environment
is detail-oriented and has a structured approach to tasks
has experience with or interest in tools like Google Tag Manager, GA4, and Excel
is fluent in English




IS THIS YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY? Apply today!

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Senior Web Analyst, Thomas Lykke Sørensen, at +45 3125 4474.




Send us a short application along with your CV by clicking on “Apply.” We process applications on an ongoing basis and will close the recruitment process once we have found the right candidate.

The internship is set to start the 18th of August.




We offer flexibility to make sure you obtain the required 30 ECTS by attending an extra course during the semester or flexibility to prioritise writing days.




ABOUT US

We believe our employees are key to our success. That is why we strive to offer development and possibilities of growing and finding new challenges within JYSK. Since our founder, Lars Larsen, opened his first store in Denmark in 1979, JYSK has expanded our global presence with stores and web shops in countries around the world.




Our three fundamental JYSK Values – Tradesman, Colleague and Corporate Spirit – express the behavior and attitude that we can expect from each other. We trust each other, and we believe in Empowerment and freedom with responsibility. We also take pride in rewarding engagement and a great effort among our employees. With the right attitude, opportunities abound in JYSK.




JYSK wants to include everyone, no matter the age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and experience. Together, we secure our inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. Because a great mix of minds, talents and unique personalities makes us a stronger team.




For more information, please visit our career page.

Title: Junior Data Process Executive
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At YouGov, we aim to provide key insights into consumer behaviour, including who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to help our clients enhance customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.




To achieve our mission, it's essential that our panel data meets the highest quality standards. The Junior Data Process Executive will support our Panel Management team in maintaining our panels in Denmark and Sweden.

The Junior Data Process Executive will enhance the efficiency of our team by streamlining processes and improving data quality. This position is perfect for someone detail-oriented, curious about automation, and driven to make a meaningful impact. The Junior Data Process Executive will collaborate with experienced panel management experts who will guide you through our processes.




You Will:

Panel Data Management: Organize, clean, and maintain panel data for analysis, including repetitive tasks that require consistent attention.
Process Improvement Collaboration: Identify repetitive tasks that could benefit from automation or optimization and support their implementation.
Support Data Quality & Validation: Maintain high data standards with automated quality checks and consistency monitoring.
Communication Support: Assist colleagues in their panel support tasks, including handling phone calls and emails.
Language Skills: Proficiency in either Swedish or Danish (knowledge of both is a plus). The official language of our company is English, and effective communication is expected. You should feel comfortable reaching out to colleagues in our expert centers across Europe.
Technical Skills: Interest in data handling, technology, and IT. Comfortable with Excel and basic knowledge of the Microsoft Suite. Familiarity with scripting/programming languages (e.g., Python, R), automation tools (e.g., Power Automate, Apache Airflow), and advanced Excel skills (e.g., macros, VBA, Power Query) would be considered a plus.
Educational Background: A bachelor’s degree in Data Management, Data Science, Automation, IT, or a related field is a strong asset, but a can-do attitude is most crucial.
Experience: Previous roles in data management, automation, software scripting or coding, or panel management is considered an advantage.




You Have:

Adaptable and Eager to Learn: Excited about evolving technologies and processes.
Tech-Savvy and Data-Driven: Enthusiastic about data, automation, and tech tools.
Detail-Oriented: Understand the importance of data accuracy and work carefully with information to solve challenges.
Independent and Solution-Oriented: Have a strong attitude towards finding solutions on your own and being self-reliant, while also knowing when to seek support from colleagues.




What We Offer:

Career Development: On-the-job training and professional development.
Full time position: a Danish employment contract with a standard 36-hour workweek
Flexible Work Environment: Hybrid work options, allowing flexibility between remote work and our new offices located in Copenhagen (Kødbyen), near the Central Station, making it easily accessible by train, including from Sweden (e.g., Malmö or Lund).
Growth Opportunities: Opportunities for advancement within the company.
