Title: Lead Data Analyst til Dataindsigt
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du passion for Power BI, og vil du være arkitekt og drive udviklingen af vores fremtidige indsigtsunivers? Vil du højne brugeroplevelsen for vores mange brugere, så vi får endnu mere værdi ud af data? Lyder det som spændende udfordringer? Så er du måske vores nye Lead Data Analyst.




Velkommen til Dataindsigt

Vi er et nyere team på fem Data Analysts, som er en del af bankens Data og Modeller afdeling, der rummer over 35 dataentusiaster. Vi er kendetegnet ved godt samarbejde og sparring i hverdagen. Vi tager tid til fælles opgaveafklaring og opgavemøder, har retrospektiv med fokus på teamlæring, samt interne demoer og reviews med fokus på at kunne fordybe sig i detaljerne.




Om jobbet

Det er en helt ny stilling i banken, som du skal være med til at præge og udvikle. Vi har store ambitioner på indsigtsområdet, som er blevet konkretiseret i vores nye datastrategi. Derfor har vi i Dataindsigts-teamet brug for en Lead Data Analyst til at gå forrest i transformationen og opbygningen af vores fremtidige indsigtsunivers til hele banken.




Derudover skal du være med til at sikre et godt samspil mellem vores centrale og lokale løsninger i banken. Endelig ser vi, at du får en vigtig rolle i at højne brugen af Power BI hos alle vores mange brugere.




Vi tilbyder dig derfor et spændende job, hvor dine opgaver blandt andet vil være at:

Tage ejerskab for den fremtidige arkitektur for vores indsigtsunivers i Power BI
End-to-end dataarbejde med at oversætte forretningsbehov til konkrete løsninger
Sikre en endnu bedre user adoption for vores løsninger
Sikre at vi bliver et center of excellence på Power BI-området, som kan understøtte central og lokal udvikling
Understøtte resten af teamets arbejde med din viden og erfaring




Du får dermed en meget central rolle i at vi lykkes med data og får indsigter ud at leve, der giver værdi for os og kunderne.




Din profil

Du har stor passion for dataindsigt/Business Intelligence og har stor erfaring (5+ år) med større indsigtsløsninger inden for den finansielle sektor eller som konsulent. Uddannelsesmæssigt er der mange veje hen til jobbet.




Vi forventer, at du:

Har stor erfaring med at være arkitekt og drive udviklingen af et indsigtsunivers
Har stor erfaring med at bygge løsninger i Power BI og DAX
Det er en fordel hvis du kan programmere i SAS
Har erfaring i Power BI-undervisning, så løsninger bliver forankret hos brugerne
Har erfaring med at bygge løsninger ovenpå et DW i Databricks
Er god til at samarbejde med forretningen og kan oversætte deres behov til løsninger
Er struktureret og har erfaring med agil udvikling, samt brugen af Azure DevOps
Er løsnings- og resultatorienteret og samtidig har sans for detaljen
Har et godt humør - ellers bliver det kedeligt at gå på arbejde
Koncernsproget i Arbejdernes Landsbanker dansk så det er et krav, at du behersker dansk i skrift og tale.




Vi vil være landets bedste arbejdsplads…

… og det er ikke bare tomme ord. Som medarbejder i Arbejdernes Landsbank får du plads til både dit arbejde og dit privatliv, med mulighed for hjemmearbejde og individuelle ordninger. Vi prioriterer din udvikling og tilbyder løbende kompetenceudvikling samt karrieremuligheder. Det kan du læse mere om her.

Vi tilbyder også en række medarbejdergoder som sundhedsforsikring, tandforsikring, ekstra ferietillæg, 7 ugers ferie og meget mere, som vi glæder os til at fortælle dig om.




Lyder det som noget for dig?

Vi vil løbende gennemgå ansøgninger og håber derfor, at vi hører fra dig snarest muligt.

Hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Chef for Dataindsigt og -platform Mattias Westergaard Clausen på tlf. nr. 2370 1741.




Ansøgningsfristen er den 2. marts.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to leverage data analysis to drive impactful decisions in an international organization? At KK Wind Solutions, you will enhance our business intelligence capabilities by developing, optimizing, and implementing data-driven solutions.




"You will be a key member of our team; connecting data with business operations to support decision making at both operational and strategic level," explains Kristine Nedergaard-Berntsen, Vice President, Commercial & Sales.




Develop and optimize data solutions

As our new Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a crucial role in ensuring data is accessible, accurate, and actionable. Your primary focus will be on supporting data-driven decision-making by maintaining and improving our data models, reports, and dashboards while ensuring alignment with key stakeholders and business objectives.




Specifically, you will

Act as an expert on our key customers by analyzing wind market data and insights to anticipate trends and identify opportunities. You will use this knowledge to assess wind market development and volume outlook, supporting strategic decision making.
Prepare market intelligence insights to support budget processes, ensuring forecasts accuracy and assumptions logic, based on customer and market conditions.
Work closely with a central team responsible for maintaining and developing our core data models, ensuring alignment and integration with organizational needs.
Ensure accurate retrieval, reconciliation, and analysis of commercial data by understanding table structures, tracing data origins, and addressing data quality issues.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI and Excel to support strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with team members to simplify workflows and reduce repetitive tasks by identifying opportunities to improve and automate processes, leveraging your technical skills to enhance efficiency and save time.
Ad hoc support on deeper business area analysis to understand performance and improvement opportunities.




What we are looking for

You are proactive, detail-oriented, and thrive in a collaborative environment. You have a solid data background and a natural curiosity for understanding the wind market and players, business processes and the impact of data on strategic decisions.




Moreover, you have:

A keen interest in developing your knowledge within renewable energy and the wind market.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Intelligence, Business Analytics, or a related field.
Recent graduate with strong analytics skills. If you’re still studying, and will graduate this summer, we could start up with a few days a week till graduation.
Proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Excel (including Power Query), with experience integrating these tools into workflows. Knowledge of D365 is a great plus.
Experience with SQL Server Management Studio for creating and managing custom SQL views and database relationships is beneficial, complementing your data management skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an eye for detail.
Expertise in data visualization tools, such as Power BI or Tableau.
Knowledge of DAX and advanced Excel formulas; experience with VBA is a plus.
Financial acumen or a background in economics and finance to analyze market and customer data effectively.




Why join KK Wind Solutions?

You will join a dynamic and inclusive team dedicated to innovation and customer satisfaction. We value collaboration, learning, and a growth mindset, offering a hybrid work environment that fosters work-life balance.




At KK Wind Solutions, you will have the opportunity to:

Shape how we use data to drive decisions and streamline operations.
Work in an international company focused on renewable energy and innovation.
Collaborate across departments to contribute to impactful greentech solutions.
Develop professionally in an environment that values growth, creativity, and sustainability.




Do not meet all the requirements? No worries. If you possess a can-do attitude, have a passion for data analysis, and embrace a culture of continuous learning, we would like to hear from you. We are committed to tailoring the role to fit your strengths, just as we tailor our solutions to meet our customers' demands.




Location

This role can be based in KK Wind Solutions’ offices in Hammel or Ikast, with flexibility for hybrid work.




How to apply

If you are a motivated Business Intelligence Analyst ready to make a significant impact in a growing organization, send your CV and application in English by [insert deadline]. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis, so early applications are encouraged.




Contact information

For further information, please contact: Kristine Nedergaard-Berntsen, Vice President, Commercial & Sales by mail on kribe@kkwindsolutions.com




About KK Wind Solutions

Building on more than 40 years of experience, KK Wind Solutions is a leading systems supplier to the renewable energy industry. We deliver state-of-the-art technologies, high-quality manufacturing, and flexible aftermarket services, empowering a sustainable future. Owned by A.P. Moller Holding, our diverse team of over 3,600 employees is united by a shared mission to enable renewable energy solutions.

Visit www.kkwindsolutions.com to learn more about our company and career opportunities.




Show more

  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI and Excel to support strategic decision-making.
  • Collaborate with team members to simplify workflows and reduce repetitive tasks by identifying opportunities to improve and automate processes, leveraging your technical skills to enhance efficiency and save time.
  • Ad hoc support on deeper business area analysis to understand performance and improvement opportunities.


What we are looking for

You are proactive, detail-oriented, and thrive in a collaborative environment. You have a solid data background and a natural curiosity for understanding the wind market and players, business processes and the impact of data on strategic decisions.


Moreover, you have:

  • A keen interest in developing your knowledge within renewable energy and the wind market.
  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Intelligence, Business Analytics, or a related field.
  • Recent graduate with strong analytics skills. If you’re still studying, and will graduate this summer, we could start up with a few days a week till graduation.
  • Proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Excel (including Power Query), with experience integrating these tools into workflows. Knowledge of D365 is a great plus.
  • Experience with SQL Server Management Studio for creating and managing custom SQL views and database relationships is beneficial, complementing your data management skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an eye for detail.
  • Expertise in data visualization tools, such as Power BI or Tableau.
  • Knowledge of DAX and advanced Excel formulas; experience with VBA is a plus.
  • Financial acumen or a background in economics and finance to analyze market and customer data effectively.


Why join KK Wind Solutions?

You will join a dynamic and inclusive team dedicated to innovation and customer satisfaction. We value collaboration, learning, and a growth mindset, offering a hybrid work environment that fosters work-life balance.


At KK Wind Solutions, you will have the opportunity to:

  • Shape how we use data to drive decisions and streamline operations.
  • Work in an international company focused on renewable energy and innovation.
  • Collaborate across departments to contribute to impactful greentech solutions.
  • Develop professionally in an environment that values growth, creativity, and sustainability.


Do not meet all the requirements? No worries. If you possess a can-do attitude, have a passion for data analysis, and embrace a culture of continuous learning, we would like to hear from you. We are committed to tailoring the role to fit your strengths, just as we tailor our solutions to meet our customers' demands.


Location

This role can be based in KK Wind Solutions’ offices in Hammel or Ikast, with flexibility for hybrid work.


How to apply

If you are a motivated Business Intelligence Analyst ready to make a significant impact in a growing organization, send your CV and application in English by [insert deadline]. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis, so early applications are encouraged.


Contact information

For further information, please contact: Kristine Nedergaard-Berntsen, Vice President, Commercial & Sales by mail on kribe@kkwindsolutions.com


About KK Wind Solutions

Building on more than 40 years of experience, KK Wind Solutions is a leading systems supplier to the renewable energy industry. We deliver state-of-the-art technologies, high-quality manufacturing, and flexible aftermarket services, empowering a sustainable future. Owned by A.P. Moller Holding, our diverse team of over 3,600 employees is united by a shared mission to enable renewable energy solutions.

Visit www.kkwindsolutions.com to learn more about our company and career opportunities.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join us, be part of more.

We’re so much more than an energy company. We’re a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that’s energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn’t rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion and more potential. That’s why working here is #MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently – we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it and mend it.

About your team:

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We’re energy movers by nature. We’re a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use – powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We’re energy movers by nature. We’re a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use – powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

About the role:

The Quantitative Analytics team at Centrica Energy is part of the Trading Analytics and Algorithms centre of excellence, and is responsible for:


Delivering quantitative analysis of complex and structured products, that provides insight to help traders to maximise value and manage risk
Designing and implementing complex mathematical models that allow for consistent pricing and joint risk quantification across multiple portfolios, enabling more holistic and optimal hedging decisions
Assisting originators in development of structured products across the Renewables, LNG, Gas & Power sectors.


As a Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of an agile team of c10 people located across our offices in both London (UK) and Aalborg (Denmark).

The successful candidate will be required to:


Produce high quality increments to the team’s model library working both individually and collaboratively
Assist/advise trading and origination via quantitative analysis and a strong mathematical/financial intuition
Leverage the teams cross-asset expertise to connect business locations, helping to identify synergies and increase efficiency.


What we’re looking for:


Master’s Degree or PhD qualification within science, mathematics or other quantitative subject
Good understanding of a variety of mathematical and statistical models used in finance
Experience with derivatives pricing and risk management systems
Experience of code development (ideally Python)
Familiarity or high level of interest in Energy / commodity markets
Strong Communicator and fluent in English language
Strong interpersonal skills.


Why should you apply?

We’re not a perfect place – but we’re a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That’s why we’ve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we’re a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.

https://www.morethanacareer.energy/centricaenergy

If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.

Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
Copenhagen, hybrid

This role is part of our Data team in Copenhagen. At DEPT®, we combine data, technology and marketing to solve brands’ business problems and drive revenue through a variety of digital solutions.

Job Purpose

As an Analytics Consultant at DEPT®, you work with our clients on the best data setup, implement these and educate the clients in the world of Analytics. Of course this role has its challenges. The death of the cookie is near, and in this role you will consult our clients to deal with this new reality. How do they need to set up their server-side measurement? Which new products and features should we test? How can we make the best use of Consent Mode, conversion uploads and more? And GA4. The end of the session, which is changing analytics like we know it. You like to dive into these questions and want to help our clients answer them. As an Analytics Consultant, you are the absolute expert in data collection and solving complex analytics cases. You know how to create and implement measurement setups, take care of server-to-server connections between owned and marketing platforms and help clients to implement the best data collection setup.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and configure tag management systems (eg. GTM) to ensure accurate data collection;
  • Develop measurement plans in collaboration with clients;
  • Troubleshoot and fix data discrepancies & tracking issues;
  • Conduct audits of data collection setups;
  • Collaborate with development teams to develop and maintain tracking across digital platforms;
  • Use data visualisation tools (eg. Looker Studio, Power BI) to present data in an easily understandable format;
  • Consult with clients and help them take their analytics setup to the next level.


What We Are Looking For

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data role, preferably at agency side;
  • Hands-on experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager;
  • Are proficient in Javascript;
  • Maybe you don't have the technical skills yet, but are eager to learn more about SQL, Python and Cloud;
  • Full working proficiency in the English language - spoken and written (proficiency in Danish is considered a plus, not a requirement);
  • Somebody who can switch from serious to play in a heartbeat;
  • An analytical, technical, independent profile with good communication skills.


WE OFFER

  • A healthy, varied and delicious lunch at the office;
  • A lot of fun social events such as Friday bars, company parties, team events, etc.;
  • A flexible, hybrid working policy and a great workplace in our awesome office in Christianshavn;
  • A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards;
  • Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries;
  • The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training and development;
  • Stay happy and healthy with a contribution to your health through the OpenUp platform, gym and wellness discounts, and healthy lunches at the office;
  • Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.


WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.

Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients problems, no matter where you are in the world.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Hvidovre Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer / Analytics Engineer




NTG Nordic Transport Group (NTG)

NTG is listed on Nasdaq OMX Nordic and is one of the fastest-growing freight forwarders in Europe. Since the Group’s foundation in Denmark in 2011, our unique partnering-model has successfully expanded NTG to a revenue of more than DKK 8 billion in 2023, presence in +30 countries and ~100 companies. Our culture is characterized as entrepreneurial, trusting, and accountable.




The Position

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer or Analytics Engineer to join our newly established BI team at our Global Headquarters in Hvidovre (Copenhagen), Denmark. Your main responsibilities will be:

· Develop and maintain our Data Warehouse platform

· Build and maintain data ingestion pipelines in DBT

· Design and create Analytics Models for consumption in PowerBI

· Collaborate with business users to create concise and meaningful data assets that fit our platform architecture

· Advise on the design, and optimization of our data storage solutions, ensuring best practices are followed and influencing the strategic direction of our Data Warehouse.

You will work closely with our Head of Group Business Intelligence to support our broader organization within IT, Finance and operations.




The Candidate

· Possess a strong analytical mindset

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team

· Solid communication and collaboration skills

· Previous experience with solutions like Snowflake, Databricks hosted on one of the big cloud providers (Azure, AWS or GCP)

· Proficiency with Python, SQL, dbt

· Data modelling and schema design for relational databases

· Fluent in English (Danish is a plus)

· Experience with PowerBI is a plus




How do I apply?

If you would like to join our team, apply for the position by clicking the button below. We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

We hope we got your attention and look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Data Analyst for Offshore Wind
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to contribute to the growth of a unique offshore wind data intelligence company within the Renewable Energy industry? Sea Impact is looking for a Data Analyst to drive software development and push the boundaries for different datasets.




Innovative Market Intelligence based on Unique Big Data Analysis for a Growing Offshore Wind Industry

At Sea Impact, we specialise in market intelligence for the offshore wind industry. We have developed a revolutionary market intelligence platform that provides key benchmarks for the design, installation, and maintenance of offshore wind farms. Our analyses are based on an innovative methodology of analysing vessel positions for market intelligence. We work with some of the world’s leading offshore wind developers, turbine OEMs and consultancies.




Help Us Create Unique Market Intelligence for Offshore Wind

Based in our Copenhagen office, you will lead the development of our data-driven solutions by analysing offshore wind activity and combining our unique offshore wind data with any publicly available data about the market development.




Your key responsibilities will include:

Data Analysis: Analyze offshore wind activities using Python, Power BI, and QGIS, extracting geospatial and operational insights.
Database Management & Integration: Maintain and optimize cloud-based PostgreSQL databases and develop efficient data pipelines for seamless integration with Power BI.
Predictive Analytics & Machine Learning: Design and implement ML-driven solutions to enhance market intelligence insights and expand our product offering.
Ad-hoc tasks: provide support for ad-hoc tasks such as developing custom reports.
Be the driver of Sea Impact's IT development and have the opportunity to shape and form the development




As this is a role in a small company you will have plenty of room to influence your position and take on new and exciting tasks as we grow.




Solution-Driven Data Analyst with a Strong Drive

You have a master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar. You are proficient in Python and SQL, have some experience in developing ML-based solutions and have previously worked with some of these tools: QGIS, PostgreSQL, Microsoft Azure, Power BI. Our ideal candidate is excited about being part of establishing a new organisation and creating industry-leading market intelligence for offshore wind. If you combine this with a proactive and entrepreneurial attitude and thrive in a fast-paced environment, you will enjoy “building something bigger together”.




Furthermore, you must have strong communication skills and function well in a collaborative environment. You are structured, proactive, and you are ready to learn and take on new challenges. As Sea Impact is a global company, you must have strong English communication skills.




Experience the Highest Degree of Involvement

A unique and challenging opportunity, where you will be part of forming the future growth of Sea Impact and success towards our clients. You will have the opportunity to play a central role in the development of Sea Impact and have chance to drive the development of market intelligence. Alongside a small team of dedicated problem-solvers, you are given the chance to learn and challenge yourself, while playing a vital part in the continued success of Sea Impact. Above that, you will join an ambitious team that is dedicated to delivering the highest quality, utilizing the diverse expertise and skillset we all bring. It is a prerequisite that you have strong English communication skills.




Sea Impact is dedicated to fostering a work environment that values diversity. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.




Interested and want to know more?

If you have any questions or want to know more about the position, please contact People & Development via recruitment@peak-wind.com. We look forward to receiving your application & CV as soon as possible, latest by March 16th, 2025. Please apply through our webpage. Applications will be assessed on an ongoing basis.

Title: Praktikant, Data Intelligence
Description:
Interesserer du dig for arbejdet med data transformation, cloud computing samt data science, og leder du efter et spændende internship i et ambitiøst bureau?

Så er det os, du skal søge hos!

Bliv en del af Data Intelligence-teamet og få erfaring med at arbejde med data på nye og innovative måder – alt sammen med fokus på at skabe værdi for kunderne gennem intelligent brug af data.

Konkret Vil Du Komme Til At Arbejde Med


Opsætning af Cloud-miljøer i f.eks. Google Cloud Platform
Data transformering og analyse af data i SQL, Dataform og Python
Udvikling af business cases og visualisering af data i førende BI-platforme såsom Retool, Power BI og Looker
Håndtering af dataorkestrering, integration med API’er og Cloud Functions
Brug af data science til at løse komplekse problemstillinger, f.eks. forecasting, clustering og predictions


Som praktikant i s360 bliver du en del af en kultur gennemsyret af et højt ambitionsniveau, ekspertise og fællesskab!

Vi kan med overbevisning sige, at vi lever vores værdier Down to earth, To the point, Eager to improve og Act with integrity. Vi har en flad organisationsstruktur, afholder vidensdelingssessioner på tværs af afdelinger og kontorer, opfordrer altid til konstruktiv feedback, og så er vi frontløbere inden for tech og AI.

I løbet af året afholder vi flere sociale arrangementer såsom fredagsbarer og sportsturneringer. I løbet af praktikperioden er der rig mulighed for at skabe et stærkt professionelt og socialt netværk med kolleger og de andre Interns gennem velkomstmiddagen, løbende check-in sessioner, fælles frokoster og fredagsøl på tagterrassen.

"Som praktikant i Data Intelligence får du et stort indblik i, hvor mange muligheder der er, når man arbejder med data. Du kommer til at sidde med alt fra kode og modellering til flotte visualiseringer, som skaber en fortælling omkring dataen" - Louise Ellegaard, tidligere Intern og nu Assistant i Data Intelligence.

Alt dette er med til at gøre os stolte af vores kultur.

Det praktiske om dig

Du Er En Af Dem, Dine Medstuderende Betegner Som Ambitiøs, Og Så Ønsker Du At Sætte Dit Præg På Et Af Nordens Mest Ambitiøse Digitale Marketingbureauer. Derudover Er Du


I gang med en relevant videregående uddannelse, f.eks. fra BSS, Aarhus Universitet, Erhvervsakademi Aarhus eller lignende
Flydende i mundtlig og skriftlig dansk samt behersker engelsk på højt niveau
Nede på jorden og ser stor værdi i at samarbejde


Det praktiske om dit internship


Praktikperioden løber fra midten af august til midten af december 2025
Ulønnet fuldtidsstilling på 37 timer. Med i din praktikstilling får du selvfølgelig frokost samt te, kaffe og frugt ad libitum (oftest er der også god kage at finde på kontorerne)
Du bliver en del af et praktikhold med praktikanter fra forskellige afdelinger i s360. Gennem både sociale og faglige events, er der god mulighed for at dele erfaringer og netværke på tværs af teams.


Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Har du spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte Director & Team Lead, Thomas Aba på +45 30149737 eller [email protected]. Du kan også læse meget mere om vores praktikforløb her.

Hvem er s360?

s360 er et førende digitalt marketingbureau i Europa, der hjælper brands og detailhandlere med at vokse ved at levere et solidt teknologisk fundament, topkvalitets eksekvering og dyb brancheekspertise. Med mere end 320 digitale specialister har s360 kontorer i ti byer fordelt på syv europæiske lande: Danmark, Norge, Sverige, Finland, Holland, Storbritannien og Spanien. I de seneste år har s360 modtaget flere nationale og europæiske branchepriser, og er derfor et af Europas mest prisvindende digitale marketingbureauer.

Vi har en flad organisationsstruktur, afholder vidensdelingssessioner på tværs af afdelinger og kontorer, opfordrer altid til konstruktiv feedback, og så er vi frontløbere inden for tech og AI.

I løbet af året afholder vi flere sociale arrangementer såsom fredagsbarer og sportsturneringer. I løbet af praktikperioden er der rig mulighed for at skabe et stærkt professionelt og socialt netværk med kolleger og de andre Interns gennem velkomstmiddagen, løbende check-in sessioner, fælles frokoster og fredagsøl på tagterrassen.

"Som praktikant i Data Intelligence får du et stort indblik i, hvor mange muligheder der er, når man arbejder med data. Du kommer til at sidde med alt fra kode og modellering til flotte visualiseringer, som skaber en fortælling omkring dataen" - Louise Ellegaard, tidligere Intern og nu Assistant i Data Intelligence.

Alt dette er med til at gøre os stolte af vores kultur.

Det praktiske om dig

Du Er En Af Dem, Dine Medstuderende Betegner Som Ambitiøs, Og Så Ønsker Du At Sætte Dit Præg På Et Af Nordens Mest Ambitiøse Digitale Marketingbureauer. Derudover Er Du

  • I gang med en relevant videregående uddannelse, f.eks. fra BSS, Aarhus Universitet, Erhvervsakademi Aarhus eller lignende
  • Flydende i mundtlig og skriftlig dansk samt behersker engelsk på højt niveau
  • Nede på jorden og ser stor værdi i at samarbejde

Det praktiske om dit internship

  • Praktikperioden løber fra midten af august til midten af december 2025
  • Ulønnet fuldtidsstilling på 37 timer. Med i din praktikstilling får du selvfølgelig frokost samt te, kaffe og frugt ad libitum (oftest er der også god kage at finde på kontorerne)
  • Du bliver en del af et praktikhold med praktikanter fra forskellige afdelinger i s360. Gennem både sociale og faglige events, er der god mulighed for at dele erfaringer og netværke på tværs af teams.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Har du spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte Director & Team Lead, Thomas Aba på +45 30149737 eller [email protected]. Du kan også læse meget mere om vores praktikforløb her.

Hvem er s360?

s360 er et førende digitalt marketingbureau i Europa, der hjælper brands og detailhandlere med at vokse ved at levere et solidt teknologisk fundament, topkvalitets eksekvering og dyb brancheekspertise. Med mere end 320 digitale specialister har s360 kontorer i ti byer fordelt på syv europæiske lande: Danmark, Norge, Sverige, Finland, Holland, Storbritannien og Spanien. I de seneste år har s360 modtaget flere nationale og europæiske branchepriser, og er derfor et af Europas mest prisvindende digitale marketingbureauer.

Title: People Analytics BI Specialist, Novonesis
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Can you help unleash our potential within People Analytics?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Join us as a People Analytics BI Specialist

In Novonesis you will join a People & Organization team that has an ambitious agenda to support the profitable growth of Novonesis through an engaged workforce. People Analytics play a critical part in materializing this, so this is your opportunity to be part of building People Analytics capabilities in Novonesis.

We are responsible for delivering insights into employee trends, deliver data to be used for optimizing HR processes, provide data-driven recommendations to improve organizational performance and employee experience to name a few areas. As we are a fairly new team, we offer;


A unique opportunity to shape and grow a people analytics function from the ground up
A supportive culture that values innovation, accountability, and professional development
A dynamic, collaborative environment with ample learning and growth opportunities
The chance to have a direct impact on driving HR and business decisions through innovative data solutions


Key Responsibilities


Oversee developing, deploying, and maintaining BI interfaces and engage with various stakeholders both within People & Organization and as well across the enterprise to assess business requirements and develop meaningful concepts
Conduct analysis of complex datasets to assess patterns and insights
Visualize and communicate data insights in a compelling and effective way to get buy-in from stakeholders
Educate stakeholders on data insights and findings to foster a data-driven culture
Development of reports and dashboards which can support self-service as well as insights to drive strategic business impact
Contribute to creation of global standards around metrics and KPIs and adoption of best practices
Participate in various People Analytics projects with a focus on e.g. process improvement


What We Are Looking For


Demonstrated experience in developing dashboards in Power BI
Experience from Workday reporting and data extraction
Solid hands-on experience with data manipulation, preferably using a low-code analytics tool like Knime or Alteryx
Knowledge of databases and database querying (e.g. SQL)
A solid understanding of data quality, privacy, and security best practices, especially in an HR context where sensitive data is involved
Innovative and motivated by the opportunity of building a people analytics function from the ground up – we need one with an entrepreneurial mindset
Familiarity with HR metrics and people analytics to understand what drives effective HR decision-making is a benefit
Proficiency in Python or R is a plus, enabling you to conduct ad-hoc analyses and support/ drive more advanced data processing tasks
Demonstrated ability to engage and influence a diverse set of stakeholders
Strong collaborative mindset with a focus on building analytical capabilities and promoting a self-service data culture
Bachelor’s degree in data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science or a related field


Application deadline: 16 March 2025 - we encourage to apply as soon as possible as incoming applications will be screened continuously.

Contact details: Morten Espersen, Head of People Analytics, mtes@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Lead Data/IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 24876

At Nordea, we know our stakeholder needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating a new cloud environment where we’re harnessing the power of near real time data – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you’ll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea´s target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:


Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team


Your experience and background:


Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/03/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.
Show more

Title: Azure løsningsarkitekt
Description:
Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?




Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt




Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.




Andre ansvarsområder:

Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen




Dine kompetencer:

5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter




Om dig:

Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater




En hos Crayon Danmark betyder også;

at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse på hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
at arbejdstiden følger ’the new normal policy’, som er 2-3 dage på kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra – vi er fleksible
at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i køleskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om året – vi holder altid nogle gode fester




Crayon har positioneret sig som Nordens førende indenfor Cloud-services, Software Asset Management og salg af software. Vores specialister leverer skræddersyende løsninger indenfor softwareleverandørstyring på tværs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. – altså nogle af de største navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en børsnoteret koncern, som globalt beskæftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere på vores kontorer på tværs af landegrænserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt på 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i Søborg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.




Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk miljø, hvor vi har en meget åben og hjælpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er stærkt drevet af at gøre en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer – og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

Der er aldrig en typisk dag hos Crayon, vores DNA er noget helt særligt – og det er det vi elsker ved at være medarbejdere i Crayon.




At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.




If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.

Show more
HTML:
• Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
  • Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
  • Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?


Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt


Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.


Andre ansvarsområder:

  • Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
  • Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
  • Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
  • Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen


Dine kompetencer:

  • 5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
  • Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
  • Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
  • Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
  • Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
  • Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter


Om dig:

  • Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
  • Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
  • Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater


En hos Crayon Danmark betyder også;

  • at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
  • at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse på hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
  • at arbejdstiden følger ’the new normal policy’, som er 2-3 dage på kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra – vi er fleksible
  • at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i køleskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
  • at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om året – vi holder altid nogle gode fester


Crayon har positioneret sig som Nordens førende indenfor Cloud-services, Software Asset Management og salg af software. Vores specialister leverer skræddersyende løsninger indenfor softwareleverandørstyring på tværs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. – altså nogle af de største navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en børsnoteret koncern, som globalt beskæftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere på vores kontorer på tværs af landegrænserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt på 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i Søborg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.


Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk miljø, hvor vi har en meget åben og hjælpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er stærkt drevet af at gøre en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer – og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

Der er aldrig en typisk dag hos Crayon, vores DNA er noget helt særligt – og det er det vi elsker ved at være medarbejdere i Crayon.


At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.


If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.

Title: Data Engineer/ETL
Description:
We are looking for Data Engineer/ETL for our client in the banking industry. You will be responsible for optimizing data workflows, writing efficient scripting code e.g. bash, python and SQL, and manage both on prem and cloud-based hybrid infrastructure.




Location: Greater Copenhagen area, hybrid.




QUALIFICATIONS & COMPETENCIES

Proficient in designing OLAP system and using techniques like STAR schema or denormalization
Python & PLSQL Proficiency
ELT/ETL development using GUI-based tool e.g. IBM Datastage, ADF, Stitch, Matillion
Database Management, Oracle, MSSQL, Snowflake
DevOps & CI/CD understanding of Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD pipeline development tool e.g. Jenkins, Bamboo, Azure DevOps
Experience with test automation e.g. Robot, Selenium and understand the different test scenarios
Understanding version control technique Git, GitHub, GitLab
Workflow Orchestration e.g. Airflow & Prefect
Streaming & Batch processing knowledge involving Kafka
Distributed and parallel Computing solution e.g. Spark, Flink or Dask
Data governance & security implementation RBAC, GDPR, HIPAA compliance
Experience from the banking industry, preferred
Professional level of English - both oral and written
Valid EU work permit making you able to start working right away




AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY

Design, build and maintain scalable ELT pipeline
Develop and optimize PLSQL queries and database objects for high performance data storage in Oracle
Write python-based data engineering scripts to process data
Implement CI/CD pipelines for data infrastructure and workflow automation
Understand and have experience of database change management
Work one or more of the major cloud vendor
Integrate and manage modern data stack
Monitor, debug and optimize data workflows and infrastructure performance
Ensure data quality, governance, and compliance with good practices




INTERESTED?

If you have questions about the position, please contact us on:

denmark@rdtengineers.com or call Thomas Sindahl at (+45) 28343536

The position will be closed when we have found the right candidate, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Notice only your CV in English is necessary.




Passionate about Engineering - RDT

At RDT, our primary focus is our PEOPLE. We support our employees in professional and individual development. With our flat hierarchy, commitment and values, which inspire them to do their best. We pursue our PEOPLE’s work satisfaction and can guarantee highest quality, which leads to our second mission – our CLIENTS. We, our PEOPLE, provide engineering solutions that enable our customers to have a competitive advantage in efficiency, flexibility and costs.

Thanks to our PEOPLE, we have supplied the best engineering services since 2007 and offer the best and most flexible terms in the market for engineering services.

Be part of our missions and join RDT in Denmark.

Title: Web Analyst Intern
Description:
Are you eager to learn about and work with the latest technology in web analytics within an international company operating across 28 markets?




If yes, we are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Web Analyst Intern to join our UX and Insights team.




JYSK is in constant growth, and the same applies to our UX and Insights department. We have an increasing strategic focus on online data and insights and are always looking for new talents.




WHAT WE OFFER YOU

As a Web Analyst Intern, you will get a unique opportunity to develop your analytical skills and gain hands-on experience with advanced web analytics tools – primarily Google Analytics 4 (GA4).




In the Autumn of 2025, we offer a 4-6 months internship, where you will become an integral part of our UX and Insights team. Our expert in web analytics and data tracking will guide you and share their methodologies, helping you grow into a skilled web analyst.




You will have the chance to work independently on your own projects and contribute to the development of data-driven insights.




WHAT YOUR INTERNSHIP WILL BE ABOUT

Your tasks and responsibilities will include:

analysing user behavior and traffic data to optimize conversions and online performance
preparing reports that provide insights into our online performance
collaborating with internal teams on data analysis projects
identifying opportunities to improve our digital customer experience based on data




You can read more about our department here.




WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING

We are looking for an intern who:

is currently studying E-commerce, IT, Business Analytics, or related fields
has a strong interest in web analytics and digital user data, particularly with a focus on GA4
works independently and thrives in a dynamic and busy work environment
is detail-oriented and has a structured approach to tasks
has experience with or interest in tools like Google Tag Manager, GA4, and Excel
is fluent in English




IS THIS YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY? Apply today!

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Senior Web Analyst, Thomas Lykke Sørensen, at +45 3125 4474.




Send us a short application along with your CV by clicking on “Apply.” We process applications on an ongoing basis and will close the recruitment process once we have found the right candidate.

The internship is set to start the 18th of August.




We offer flexibility to make sure you obtain the required 30 ECTS by attending an extra course during the semester or flexibility to prioritise writing days.




ABOUT US

We believe our employees are key to our success. That is why we strive to offer development and possibilities of growing and finding new challenges within JYSK. Since our founder, Lars Larsen, opened his first store in Denmark in 1979, JYSK has expanded our global presence with stores and web shops in countries around the world.




Our three fundamental JYSK Values – Tradesman, Colleague and Corporate Spirit – express the behavior and attitude that we can expect from each other. We trust each other, and we believe in Empowerment and freedom with responsibility. We also take pride in rewarding engagement and a great effort among our employees. With the right attitude, opportunities abound in JYSK.




JYSK wants to include everyone, no matter the age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and experience. Together, we secure our inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. Because a great mix of minds, talents and unique personalities makes us a stronger team.




For more information, please visit our career page.

Title: Business Analyst in Data Protection
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

At Danske Bank, our Data Protection team is driven by a vision to integrate data privacy into every aspect of our work, treating it as a fundamental human right. We are professionals focused on creating and enhancing processes and tools to ensure data is handled with care and respect. United by our values, we maintain trust and transparency, protecting personal data while creating a culture of compliance and innovation.

As a Business Analyst in the Data Protection team, you will be responsible for building the processes and solutions in the 1st line of defence which enables the bank to protect the rights of our customers and employees, ensuring compliance with data protection regulations. Joining our team means becoming part of a collaborative community that values openness in decision-making. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to robust data protection frameworks while enjoying the freedom to innovate and grow.

We are seeking a driven and motivated person with an interest in supporting GDPR compliance and a belief in treating personal data with great respect and attention. As a solution-finder with critical thinking skills, you will effectively collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to refine and implement requirements. If you thrive in situations that require quick thinking and are eager to contribute to innovative data protection solutions as a proactive team player, this role is well-suited for you.

Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you a different seniority for the role.

You will:


Contribute to the development and optimization of data protection processes, solutions, and governance frameworks to ensure compliance with regulations
Collaborate with Product Owners, Project Managers, and other stakeholders to refine and deliver requirements from both regulatory and end-user perspectives
Participate in workshops with Legal, Compliance, and technical and non-technical subject-matter experts across various business units
Prepare visual representations, such as process diagrams or PowerPoint presentations, to be presented to relevant parties
Document new workflows and controls in Standard Operating Procedures and Business Procedures
Collect and analyze data to provide insights and recommendations that enhance data protection strategies


About you:


Experience in business analysis, process improvement field or similar
Analytical and problem-solving skills, good communication skills
Experience in creating instructions and guidelines such as Business Procedures and Standard Operating Procedures
Have knowledge of data privacy and data protection, with practical experience in GDPR or other compliance regulations would be beneficial
An understanding of risk management and internal control frameworks and processes would be beneficial
Proficient with presentation tools such as PowerPoint
Be comfortable in a changing environment and eager to engage in a large and complex organization, where you can apply your initiative and involvement
Advanced English skills


“Be yourself. We like it that way.”

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If the position is located in Lithuania the monthly salary range will be from 2720 EUR to 4080 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package (benefits are only valid for Lithuania the same as the salary ranges) which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be Analyst - Business.

Depending on your location your hiring manager will be Jolita Margeleviciene (if you are located in Lithuania) or Christina Dylov (if you are located in Denmark), please feel free to reach out to any of us via LinkedIn.

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst for a Teleco & Technology Organisation

Location: London (2-3 days hybrid working)

Salary: Competitive

________________________________________

Company Overview:




We are looking for a dynamic, private equity-backed business. As the company continues to grow, we are seeking a Data Analyst to contribute to our exciting journey of integrating new systems and enhancing data capabilities. As part of a dynamic team focused on system and customer migration, you'll play a pivotal role in maturing our business processes. With your expertise in data analysis, you will help drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role is ideal for professionals with a strong commercial mindset and proficiency in SQL who are ready to make a significant impact.

________________________________________




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the finance team to optimize data analysis and generate meaningful insights.
Engage in the migration process focusing on system improvement and data enhancement.
Play an active role in driving better decision-making through in-depth data insights.
Work closely with finance business partners to align data initiatives with commercial objectives.
Support the integration of HOBS (billing system) and DOMO (reporting tool) to enhance data management and reporting.

________________________________________




Required Experience:

Proven experience in data analysis with a strong commercial mindset.
Exceptional SQL skills and proficiency in working with databases.
Demonstrated ability to generate actionable insights from complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex information effectively.

________________________________________




Benefits and Opportunities

Opportunity to be at the forefront of system integration and process improvement.
Collaborate with a talented and dedicated finance team led by experienced professionals.
Be part of a structured organisation with a strategic vision for growth and innovation.
Potential for personal and professional growth by significantly impacting the company's data capabilities.

________________________________________




Candidate Profile:

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with a proven capacity to turn data into actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments, particularly with finance and systems teams, to drive data-centric improvements.
Adept at balancing multiple projects and tasks while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about integrating new technologies and tools to enhance data handling and reporting.
Experience working in telecom or technology sectors is a plus, bringing industry-specific insights.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst - Tableau Specialist - Surveillance Analytics & Visualisations (MUST BE ABLE TO WORK WITHOUT SPONSORSHIP)

Location: London, UK

Salary: £50 - £60k plus bonuses/benefits

Ways of Working: 3x per week in London office

Engagement: Full-Time




Project Overview:

We are looking for a Tableau Specialist to join our Surveillance & Monitoring team, responsible for analyzing trading activity and business communications to detect potential market abuse. This role will focus on building impactful analytics and visualizations to enhance the effectiveness of the surveillance program. Your creativity in producing meaningful and visually compelling dashboards will be central to the product line, helping translate complex datasets into user-friendly insights.

In addition to developing high-quality visualizations, you will take a leading role in ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and quality of the data used within the surveillance framework. You'll also be involved in data mapping, product ownership of the surveillance system, and ensuring adequate surveillance coverage. If you're passionate about creating visualizations that drive insights and want to make a difference in identifying market abuse, this is the role for you.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop effective visualizations that clearly communicate key information.
Own the surveillance product line and manage the related work.
Partner with colleagues and stakeholders to understand their requirements.
Ensure that data is complete, accurate, and utilized sustainably.
Create MI, KPIs, and KRIs to enhance surveillance and governance.
Collaborate with IT and third-party vendors to ensure proper data mapping and coverage.
Produce documentation and procedures to support the visualizations.
Build and maintain a consistent team brand through visualizations.
Stay up to date with the latest trends and developments in Tableau and visualizations.#




Required Skills and Experience:

Proven track record of creating effective visualizations across a variety of subjects.
Strong knowledge of SQL, relational databases, data normalization, and blending.
Proficiency in query and reporting analysis tools, and Excel (macros, pivot tables, etc.).
Extensive experience with Tableau dashboards and analytics, with working knowledge of Tableau administration/architecture.
Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple tasks.
Self-starter, with the ability to work independently and within a team.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with SAP Web Intelligence and Power BI is a plus.
Knowledge of commodity trading or market abuse is advantageous but not required.




This role provides a fantastic opportunity for those looking to take ownership of a surveillance product and make a real impact through data visualization. If you’re passionate about building effective visualizations and improving market surveillance, apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

London




Data Quality, Governance, and Catalog Analyst with 6+ years of experience

1. Develop and implement data quality frameworks, governance policies, and cataloging standards on AWS using AWS Glue services.

2. Monitor and improve data accuracy, consistency, and completeness across AWS services.

3. Collaborate with stakeholders to define data lineage, metadata management, and compliance requirements.

4. Utilize AWS-native and third-party tools for data profiling, validation, and governance enforcement.

5. Support data stewardship initiatives, ensuring adherence to regulatory standards and best practices.
